Before joining One Acre Fund, Emily was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Emily and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Emily will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Nandika group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents). Magdalena has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 1 year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Magdalena sells her products from home, by means of retail. Magdalena has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Magdalena include seasonality, transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow to and become a wholesaler. Magdalena lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Octave

texts.en: Octave is married to a farmer and the couple has 5 children between the ages of 3 and 19. Octave has been selling maize flour, sugar and sodas for 8 years. He has requested this loan to buy more sugar, maize flour and sodas. He plans to use the profits generated from this loan for savings. He dreams of reaching a certain level of achievement.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 27-year-old, married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. Amira has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for 2 years.

Amira is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is divorced and has three children. She cooks banku, cooked fermented corn dough and cassava dough, for sale. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomatoes sauce at Ankako.  Ama has been doing this  for three months now. She is responsible for taking care of the family. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a structure for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Sènami's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sènami  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sènami est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Sènami est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Moise. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Sènami vend depuis huit ans de la nourriture. Sènami s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sènami, ensemble avec les membres de ce groupe, sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs, des pâtes alimentaires et des condiments.

loans.name: Anias

texts.en:
Anias is 26 years old. He is married with 1 child age of 2 years. Not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 3 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 24-year-old Syrian citizen who started three years ago working in Lebanon as an employee in a cafe to sup[port his beloved family back in Syria.
His limited monthly income and his family's increasing living needs, made him decide to start his own business, but he needs an external financial support to start his natural beauty cosmetics selling business.
That's why he is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to purchase natural beauty cosmetics and start his own retail selling business as an additional income to support his family back in Syria.
This is Bashar's forth loan cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, through his previous loans he was capable of financially supporting his beloved family back in his hometown Syria, where at the same time he proved to be a good standing borrower.

loans.use: To purchase natural beauty cosmetics and start his own retail selling business as an additional income to support his family back in Syria

loans.name: Seyfaddin

texts.en:
Seyfaddin is 50, married, has 4 children, lives in Salyan region Yenikand village.  He has his own grocery store. Having borrowed a loan of $600 from Komak Credit Union  Ramil to buy 30 sack wheat flour. 
He applies for the loan of $900 to expand the area of his grocery store

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Metleb

texts.en:
Metleb is 38 years old, married has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Fizuli region, Kayidish village.
His business involves supplying milk in the village. He has been in this business for 2 years. He has a dairy cow, which provides his income. 
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow. 
Metleb plans to expand the dairy farming because he provides for his family by selling milk.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Aswiyah

texts.en: Aswiyah  is 34 years old, and is married with 6 children. 5 of them are girls while the other is a boy. To supplement her husband's income, Aswiyah sells meatball soup in front of her house.  In a day they can earn $10 with net profit of $3 or $60 in a month. Aswiyah needs a loan of $100 and with this loan, she can buy more materials to make more food and thus more or less double her income. Aswiyah very much wants to earn more money  for her children's education and to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 1 year.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien's family has 4 members; the two children are still very young (4 & 2 years old). One of them suffers from malnutrition. Lien's husband works as a fisherman, and she sells fish. Their average income is $12 per month per person. Last year their house was destroyed by Typhoon Durian. Vietnam Plus and local authorities helped them to rebuild it.

Now Lien wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her available capital for her fish-selling business. She plans to repay it over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: capital for her fish-selling micro-business

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean C., 36, lives with her 36-year-old husband in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her three children, all of whom are students. Her husband earns $9.60 a day as a blacksmith. Sean C. herself can be hired by couples getting married to take care of their wedding. She decorates the premises herself, finds clothes for the bride to wear and organizes the food. She has applied for this loan to improve this business; in particular she would like to buy more decorative items. With the remainder of the money she would like to repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase decorating items for her wedding business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fabric and a machine to add buttons

loans.name: Latafet

texts.en: Latafet is a 32-year-old married woman . She is a farmer and lives with her family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 1995, when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. Her husband helps her to  purchase calves, breed them and cut and sell them to the butcher at the local big market. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all family expenses. To increase the profit margin from the selling, Latafet has to invest some money to make her small herd bigger. This summer she applied for $500 to buy four calves.  She hopes eventually to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anali

texts.es:
Anali is 28 years old and has a fifth-grade education. She has a daughter who is dependent on her. In her convenience store she sells all types of groceries like oil, noodles, sugar, salt, tuna, etc. She also buys and sells grains and curd, which she sells around the region and also in the city of Trujillo. She is a member of a women's communal bank and received her first loan from there. It wasn't much, but with it she purchased 100 kilograms of curd and started earning a profit. With ensuing loans and profits she was able to start up her store little by little.

With the $450 loan, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase in Trujillo five bags of sugar, three sacks of rice, 46 kg of flour, three boxes of oil, five bags of noodles, two packages of salt, one box of tuna, and other items as well.

She started her business 10 years ago out of a country house in Salpo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She had a tiny store that she started with the help of her parents. She later met her husband and left to live with him, and little by little she made enough money to slowly grow her store.

Anali dreams of selling more than just groceries items, like clothing or household appliances.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Anali Rodríguez F. tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene una sola hija que aún depende de ella. En su bodega vende todo tipo de abarrotes como aceite, fideo, azúcar, sal, atún, etc. Además se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales y cuajada, los que vende por la zona y también en la ciudad de Trujillo. Es socia del banco comunal Progresistas, en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00. Este dinero lo invirtió en compara 100 Kg. de cuajada. Con los siguientes créditos y con sus ganancias fue implementando poco a poco una bodega. Con el préstamo de S/.1,300.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará en la ciudad de Trujillo 5 bolsas de azúcar, 3 sacos de arroz, 1 quintal de harina, 3 cajas de aceite, 5 bolsas de fideos, 2 paquetes de sal, 1 caja de atún y otras cosas. El negocio empezó hace 10 años en el caserío de Sauco distrito de Salpo provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad, ahí tenía una pequeña tienda que había puesto con la ayuda de sus padres, posteriormente conoció a su esposo y se fue a vivir con el al barrio Miramar del distrito de Mache, ahí poco a poco hizo un pequeño capital con lo que sembraba y surtió lentamente la bodega. Su mayor sueño es vender algo más que abarrotes como por ejemplo ropa y utensilios para el hogar.

loans.use: Purchase groceries like sugar, rice, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Tojinisso

texts.ru:
Tojinisso Zaydulayevna S., 35, is married and has 4 children. Tojinisso has a college degree. She lives in the town of Vakhdat where she teaches at the local secondary school. In addition, Tojinisso is engaged in cattle farming. She wants to take this loan to purchase a milk cow to provide milk for her family. Tojinisso plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шерова Тоджиниссо Зайдуллаена проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 35 лет замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее. Работает Учителем средней школы. Занимается животноводством. На планируемый кредит хочет купить дойную корову для обеспечения семьи молоком. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mujeres De Chiapas 9 Group

texts.es:
Rocelia is 25 years old and is dedicated to make traditional clothes of the region. She makes skirts and blouses, and then adds embroidery work, which is very time consuming. This merchandise is sold with other women in the area or neighbor communities. The little money she earns from this activity maintains her five children. With this credit, she would like to purchase fabric and threads to tailor more clothes. The other members of this group are: Cecilia Pérez Santis, María A. Pérez, and Fidencia Pérez Pérez, who are all craftswomen.

Rocelia tiene 25 años, se dedica a confeccionar ropa típica de la región, elabora faldas y blusas a las cuales les dedica mucho tiempo ya que también las borda, esta mercancía es vendida con mujeres de su misma localidad o comunidades cercanas, con el poco dinero que obtiene de esto mantiene a sus 5 hijos, con el crédito le gustaría adquirir mas tela e hilos para confeccionar mas ropa. Las otras integrantes del grupo son: Cecilia Pérez Santis, María A. Pérez y Fidencia Pérez Pérez son artesanas. Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase raw material (fabric, thread)

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 44 years old and is a widow. Mwanakombo owns a small food vending store, and she is a fish seller, a business she started in 2001. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Luisa C., a resident of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, is well known for the delicious cakes that she makes and sells out of her home. Through her own mini-bakery she sells cakes and other pastries which she prepares in her own oven. It is necessary to point out that the income that she receives through the sale of her cakes and pastries allows her to pay for the studies of her three children who so greatly need her support.

The greatest need that this humble woman is currently is the acquisition of economic resources to purchase the raw materials for the elaboration of her cakes and pastries. It is for this reason that she is seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain the credit necessary that will permit her to acquire these raw materials to continue with her economic activity in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luisa C. habitante del municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua se ha caracterizado por elaborar deliciosos pasteles que vende en su casa de habitación teniendo su propia mini repostería la cual atiende por medio de la venta de pasteles y otras repostería que ella misma prepara en su horno. Es necesario destacar que por medio de los ingresos que percibe de la venta de sus pasteles y reposterías ella mantiene los estudios de sus tres hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.

La mayor necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa esta humilde dama es la pronta adquisición del recurso económico para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los pasteles y reposterías. Es por este motivo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita adquirir esta materia prima para continuar con su actividad económica en su localidad.

loans.use: To purchase raw material

loans.name: Zendia A 2008-2 Group

texts.en:
Patriselda T., 45 years old and married to a teacher, is the leader of this small group. She is in the business of selling charcoal, earning approximately 200 Sudanese pounds in profits each week. She is now requesting a loan to pay the school fees of her two children, aged 6 and 20.

Patriselda is joined in her group by Joice J., Marlina M., Lina D., and Sara D.. Joice J. sells charcoal and vegetables and wants to expand her business. Marlina M. operates a business selling vegetables at the market and wants a loan to open up a clinic. Lina D. sells bread and cool water and wants to expand her shop. Sara D. currently sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr:
Gilbert T. is 37 years old, married, and father of three. He lives in Wome, a city about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He distills “sodabi,” a liquor made from palm wine. Gilbert would like to use this loan to buy palm trees from which to get the wine, which he will use to make the liquor. This loan would allow Gilbert to increase his business and sales, and thus his family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Gilbert T. est âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite à Wome, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est distillateur de « sodabi », une liqueur préparée à base de vin de palme. Gilbert souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des palmiers pour en tirer le vin qui lui servira à préparer de la liqueur. Ce crédit permettra à Gilbert d’augmenter la capacité de son activité et de ses ventes, et par ricochet l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy palm trees from which to get wine for liquor sales

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of T. H.. She has been living in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Multan City is famous for its sweets and shoes.

Sugran baji's husband runs a grocery shop. She helps him in this business. She has no children. Her husband chose this profession because there is no other grocery shop in the colony. She collects good profits from this business. She successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to diversify the goods she sells in her grocery shop by adding more goods such as lentils, cooking oil and rice.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rani baji wants a loan to buy more clothes for her cloth business. Anwari baji wants a loan to buy more garments for her garment business. Sultana baji wants a loan to buy spices for her nimko business. Saira baji wants a loan to buy more clothes for her cloth business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi: Chị T. tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999, chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành.Gia đình chị sống ở cạch sông Đáy và có diện tích ruộng vườn rộng nên rất thuận lợi cho việc chăn nuôi trâu bò và đánh bắt cá. Hàng ngày ngoài thời gian đi đánh bắt cá trên sông anh chị còn đầu tư vốn để nuôi thêm bò, lợn. Với thu nhập khoảng 4.000.000đ /tháng từ công việc đánh bắt cá và nguồn thu khá ổn định từ chăn nuôi kinh tế gia đình chị T. đã ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị T. mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua 2 con bò giống về nuôi, phần vốn còn lại gia đình chị sẽ sử dụng để mua bộ lưới mới phục vụ cho việc đánh bắt cá.
texts.en:
Mrs T. participates in TYM fund since 1999. She has 3 children who are all grown up. Her family lives near the river Đáy on a fairly big piece of land so it is suitable for raising cattle and fishing. Everyday she and her husband go fishing on the river and after that they tend to their livestock. Their combined income is 4.000.000 VND a month form fishing and their livestock. Their income is stable and their living condition has improved a lot. This time Mrs T. would like to borrow 10.000.000 VND to buy 2 breeding cows and new fish net.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows and fishing net

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married. She and her husband Valeryi who serves in the military raise two wonderful daughters – 9 and 5 years old. Irina is a successful small entrepreneur selling women’s footwear in the local market of Melitopol where she is originally from. Irina started this business 4 years ago. She has benefited a lot from Nadiya Ukraine loans. Her business has grown to turnover capital of about $1600. Her gross income is about $1000 a month. Net profits amounts to $400.

Irina is constantly seeking ways to develop her business and promote its consistent growth. She is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to purchase additional stock for fall/winter season and attract more customers to her kiosk. She is hoping to invest some generated profit in purchase of new furniture for her family and also make savings for a future private house buy which has been the dream of all their family for a long time.

loans.use: increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add new clothing items to her inventory.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Хаитова Зульфия проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Женат , имеет пятерых детей. Обеспечивает семью путем работы в сельском хозяйстве. Имеет землю . Засеивает ее различными культурами. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить качественные семена пшеницы. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zulfiya H. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is married and has five children. She provides for her family by working in agriculture. She has some land. She sows various crops. She wants to take out a loan to buy high-quality wheat seeds. She can pay off the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wheat seed.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is divorced and has 3 children. She completed junior high school. Janet sells a cornmeal known locally as "banku."  She serves the banku with fried fish and hot sauce. It is one of the most popular foods in the country. She also sells fresh fish at Taterm near Elmina, which she has done since 1998.

Janet uses her income to pay the children's school fees, the utility bills, and other family expenses. Janet will use the loan to buy maize (which she uses to prepare the banku), fresh fish, and other ingredients of the meals she sells. With the profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to save towards a house she wants to build for the family.

She is shown with some fresh fish set out for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize and fish.

loans.name: Kul

texts.en: Kul K., 29, is single and lives with her elderly mother, sister and brother. She is a painter, and makes US $180 a month. She is aided by her sister who is currently employed as a waitress, at a restaurant, with a salary US $150 a month. Kul K. is asking a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will reduce the cost that she spends everyday on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en: Bayasgalan M. is a married woman and a mother of three. Her family lives in "ger" ((felt-lined tent) located on her sister's property. She runs the family business with her husband. She sews several types of clothes by machine, including winter coats, that her husband sells at the Narantuul market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Narantuul is a Ulaanbaatar's biggest market. She learned sewing when she was working at the clothing factory, as a master tailor, several years ago. She decided to start her own business in clothing when the sewing factory went bankrupt. She had MNT 200,000 (about $134 USD) of capital when she began the family business. Now her savings have increased to MNT 500,000. Last year, she bought some needed electronics for her family from the profits of her family business. Bayasgalan is one of best borrowers of XacBank, the microfinance institution of Kiva in Mongolia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for clothing business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells second-hand clothes. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. She is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
el Sr. Mateo P. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en union libre con la Sra. Brenda Yanez, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas.
el Sr. Mateo se dedica a la venta de pasto para vacas, y tambien se hace trabajo de transporte de pasto para alimentar vacas, el utiliza su carreta de bueyes para poder transportar el pasto a diferentes potreros en donde se encuentran las vacas, tambien hace traaslado de piedras y arena del rio, y lo lleva donde el cliente lo desee, el necesita el dinero para poder hacer su carreta mas grande ya que el tamaño que tiene es muy pequeño y necesita que sea mas grande para hacer menos viajes y llevar mas material.
su deseo es poder comprar un camion o un pickup para poder transportar lo que los clientes le digan y asi hacer el trabajo mas rapido y poder hacer muchos trabajos en el dia.
texts.en:
Mr. Mateo P. is 36 years old and lives with Mrs. Brenda Yanez in a common law marriage. She works selling sweets. Mr. Mateo sells hay for cows and also works transporting the hay for feeding the cows. He uses an ox cart to transport the hay to different pastures where cows are found. He also transports stones and sand from the river to wherever the customers want it. He needs the loan to make his cart bigger, since it is currently very small and he needs it to be bigger to be able to make fewer trips and carry more items. His desire is to be able to buy a truck or pickup to be able to transport whatever his customers tell him to move and in this way make his job go more quickly and be able to do more work in a day.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hay for livestock

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайо заёмщица в Микроинвест с 2006 года.Она каждый свой займ употребляет для увеличения своего бизнеса , пошива и продажи женских одежд.Она имеет учеников по обучению моделирования и шитья платьев.В первые года она имела только одну машинку и аверлок, а сейчас её производство увеличилось втрое, у неё много клиентов.Она хочет следующий займ использовать для покупки ещё одной машинки для аверлока платьев.
texts.en:
Muhayo has been a MircoInvest borrower since 2006. She uses every loan in order to expand her business – sewing and selling women’s clothing. She has students that learn how to cut patterns and sew dresses. In the beginning, Muhayo only had one sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine, but by now her productivity has tripled and she has a lot of customers. She would like to use her next loan in order to purchase one more machine that she can use to create overlock stitches on dresses.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es: Ana Victoria R. L. tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es casada. Ana tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. Ella es una mujer bastante entusiasta para los negocios. La actividad económica de Doña Ana es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, poco a poco a crecido su negocio, por que tenia que buscar el medio de mejorar su calidad de vida. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de ropa, camisas, faldas, pantalones, calzado, cosméticos y ropa interior. Los sueños de Ana son de proporcionarle a sus hijos la mejor educación para que el día de mañana tengan un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Ana Victoria R. L. is 30 years old and married. She has 3 children, all of them in school. Ana is a woman who is very enthusiastic about business. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise. She has made a living in this business for more than 10 years, and her business has been growing little by little; she originally went into business because she wanted to improve her quality of life. The current loan will be used as working capital for purchasing clothing such as shirts, skirts, trousers, footwear, and undergarments as well as cosmetics. Ana’s dream is to provide her children with a better education so that they can have a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kamaladin Group

texts.en:
Kamaladin is the group leader of the Kamaladin group. There are four members in this group. They would like to receive loans to be used for their various businesses, as follows:

- Kamaladin would like to obtain a loan to use toward his fresh fruit vending business. He hopes to buy necessary materials for his shop.

- Reza G. hopes for a loan to use for her business of carpet-weaving.

- Sakena wants to take out a loan for her tailoring work, specifically to buy a new machine for her business.

- Sayamoy is hoping to receive a loan for her husband’s general-store business, which he hopes to expand.

With this loan, these group members can improve and grow their businesses, support their families, and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To improve and expand their businesses

loans.name: Juan Xiii Group

texts.es: Las socias que componen el grupo "Juan XIII" son muy unidas y se apoyan mutuamente como lo demostraron en sus anteriores financiamientos en la Institución. La socias se dedican a actividades como la venta D. comida, cosméticos por catálogos y abarrotes en tiendas D. barrios. La competencia en el mercado D. venta D. productos es granD. en especial por la variedad que se ofertan en el mismo, por este motivo los miembros del grupo requieren un nuevo financiamiento que ayuD. a hacer frente a la competencia con productos mas competitivos y D. mejor calida con la compra D. mejores insumos y herramientas que ayuden a realizar un producto D. calidad que genere mayores ganancias para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The members that make up the group "Juan XIII" are very close and support each other, as they demonstrated in previous loan cycles with the institution. The members dedicate themselves to work such as the sale of food, cosmetics (through catalog-order), and groceries (in neighborhood stores). The competition in the market is high, especially because most of the products offered are similar. For this reason the members of the group need a new loan that will help them face the competition with more competitive products of better quality and with the purchase of better supplies and tools that will help them offer better products that generate more income to proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Duoc's Group

texts.en:
Được Thị Nguyễn was born in 1987. ( no: 010114140027).She lives with her hus band and her children. Her career as a transmission. Her husband made for insurance companies. She has a monthly income of about 1.500.000 VND. She needs 1.972.000 VND( or 115 USD) to purchase transmission equipment. There are 2 other Fund participants in her group:
 Dung Thị Đông was born in 1990. ( no: 010114140028). Her family has a photo shop. She and her husband are photo mechanics. She needs 1.972.000 VND( or 115 USD) to buy chicken to raise.
 Dựng Thị Nguyễn was born in 1973. ( no: 010114140026).She lives with her husband and 2 children. She raises chicken and grows vegetables. She wants to borrow 2.436.000 VND( or 145 USD ) to buy food for chicken.

loans.use: to purchase transmission equipment

loans.name: Blanca Giobanela

texts.es: Blanca Giobanela Hernández López, es una joven de 22 años. Tiene 1 hijo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por la necesidad de mantener a su hijo, por lo que sus ingresos los obtiene por medio del difícil trabajo que realiza, Blanca camina todos los días bajo el sol, y esto le perjudica su piel y la única protección que utiliza es su chaqueta. A pesar de sus circunstancias ha logrado, superar estos obstáculos y dedicarse a su trabajo. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y ropa para niños. Su deseo es obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca Giobanela Hernández López is a young woman who is 22 years old. She has 1 son. Her business is selling clothes. She has worked in this business for over 3 years. She started this business because of the need to support her child, so her income has been obtained through hard work, Blanca walks every day in the sun, and this damages her skin and the only protection she has is a jacket. Despite her circumstances, she has managed to overcome these obstacles and continue her work. The purpose of her loan is to obtain working capital for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts and children's clothing. Her desire is to have a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain working capital

loans.name: Soronzonbold

texts.en:
Soronzonbold J. is a 47-year-old married man who has four sons with ages ranging between 5 and 20 years. He currently lives with his wife and two young children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Two oldest sons are both students in universities in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Soronzonbold has a small retail business in clothing. He rents a small stall in the local black market and sells various men's and women's clothes. He frequently travels to purchase clothes from Ereen, China, a border town where many Chinese products are imported from. He started his retail business in 2000 with a small capital of 800,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). Since the beginning, his business has been quite successful. With his profits, he was able to purchase a house on a small plot of land in the town. His current business capital is now above 2,848,000 MNT. He says that with his business profits, he has been supporting his family and his two oldest sons' university tuitions.

He hopes to expand his business by diversifying the clothes that he offers at his stall. He requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa G. está muy agradecida por su gran aportación con el crédito anterior, y el cual le ayudo mucho en que su negocio creciera.
Ella nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para acondicionar mejor el salón de belleza que tiene ella y su hija, les está haciendo falta mas espacio y acondicionarlos, para poder atender a mas personas a la mismo vez y así poder darle trabajo a dos personas más. 
Pero en este momento no cuentan con el dinero para llevar acabo esta mejora es por eso que solicita un crédito, ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Doña María Luisa y su hija planean pagar esté nueva mente el crédito con los ingresos que genera el negocio.
texts.en:
María Luisa G. is very grateful for the great contribution of the previous loan. It helped a lot in making her business grow. She is asking for a new loan to renovate the beauty salon that she and her daughter have. They need more space and renovations to be able to take care of more people at the same time. This way they could give work to two more people. At this time they do not have the money to carry out the improvement. That is why she is asking for a loan because she does not want to take money out of the business. María Luisa and her daughter plan on paying this new loan with the income the business generates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate the location and buy more modern furniture

loans.name: Francisca Hortencia

texts.es: Francisca Hortencia B. C.  de 32 años de edad  vive en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y su hija Tania de 15 años, estudiante. Francisca posee un negocio desde hace veinte años en su casa, donde vende ropa y calzado para niños y adultos, también maneja un pequeño inventario de frutas, para lograr aumentar sus ingresos, ahora Francisca solita un crédito para la compra de mercadería nueva para su negocio que le permita ofrecer nuevos estilos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisca Hortencia B. C. is 32 years old. She lives in Atiquizaya in the Department of Ahuachapán with her husband and her daughter Tania, who is a 15-year-old student. Francisca has had a business for 20 years in her home, where she sells clothing and footwear for children and adults. She also keeps a small inventory of fruit. In order to be able to increase her income, Francisca is now asking for a loan in order to purchase new merchandise for her business that would allow her to offer new styles to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow Francisca's business

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: M. Sarah is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 40 years old and married with 11 children of which 9 are in school as she takes care of her siblings. She is a business lady involved in the sale of agricultural produce from Lweru subcounty and supplier to market vendors in Lugazi and Jinja for 20 years. Sarah says that there is a lot of competition among people in the same business hence reducing the prices. However she is happy that the loans have managed to keep her standing even in the worst of times, by having quality produce. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier of agricultural produce so that she can be able to earn much. She needs a loan to help buy more agricultural produce for resale as well as paying school fees for some of her children.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Total A Nasinjo Betty Group

texts.en: N. Betty is the representative of Total A group. She is thirty-two years old, married with five children who go to school, and has six dependents who also go to school. She has been in the poultry business since 2004. She is requesting this loan to purchase more chicks, feed, drugs, etc. for her business, which she will use strategically during festive season, when people will be purchasing more chicken. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to obtain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, feed, drugs, etc. for her business

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante M. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 39 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Dante owns and operates a motorcycle service business. Dante has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Dante joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dante is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and accessories. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and accessories

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet A. is from the village of Silanga, Tangub City. She is 34 years old and is single. Juliet owns and operates a fish pond business, selling crabs and fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish and crabs to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish and crabs to sell

loans.name: Good Family Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Good Family Group who are all small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan from SMT/Kiva for the first time. Each is requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 to improve his or her business and consequently to improve his or her standard of living.

Ibrahim C. in the middle of the photo is the leader of this group. He was born in Magburaka town about thirty-seven years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children. One of his children is in Junior Secondary School I and the others are in primary school III and V; the youngest is not of school going age.

Ibrahim sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans and rice. He has been in this business for over ten years now. He will invest this loan in his business by buying more gallons of palm-oil and bags of beans and rice.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm-oil and bags of rice and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To carry out plowing and buy fertilizers for the soil

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is from the village of Owaon. She is 41 years old. Susan is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP average per month for these activities.

In 2007, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Susan is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Susan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina C.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. Lina has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Lina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Lina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Mr. Lem Lay and his wife, Mrs. Sarun H., live along National Road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1986 and have three children: a daughter, who is a garment factory worker, and two sons, one who is married and lives in separate home and the other who is a mason. Lem is not in the photo; his wife is pictured instead. 

Lem and his wife have been farming since 1986. In addition, Lem is also a fisherman. He has already received one Kiva loan through Maxima. He now is requesting his second loan of $1,000 to purchase pesticides, seeds and fertilizer to continue expanding his farm.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Mrs. Nun K. lives in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province and is 38 years old. She owns a general store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Sim Sor, is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land where he cultivates rice to support his family. They have some problems with the rice field because they did not have enough money to buy rice seed. Also, the soil is infertile, it is far from the irrigation system and there are a lot of insects. To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Nun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, fuel and pesticide. With the remainder of the loan she would like to hire laborers to plow their field. 

She is the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, fuel, pesticide and to hire laborers

loans.name: Abasaruzi Group

texts.en:
Esther is 24 years old and she is still single.  Esther is the president of a group called 'Abasaruzi' and this group is widely known in the business of selling second-hand clothes.  They operate their business in the Rwamagana market, a region of Kibungo situated in the eastern province of Rwanda.  Their business hours are from 8 AM until late in the evening hours.

Esther and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their business through purchasing a variety of additional clothing styles.  Through the use of this loan, Esther and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will be used in the further reinvestment in their business.  The savings from additional profits which are not reinvested in their business will allow them to build a secure future for their families.

loans.use: Additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Luisa Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Señora Luisa del Pilar T. Pérez , es profesora de primaria en la escuela Fran Cortez, es madre soltera vive con sus dos hijos en el barrio el calvario 
La señora Luisa del Pilar T.,  es primera vez que solicito crédito para realizar unas mejoras en su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Luisa is an elementary school teacher in the Fran Cortez School. She is a single mother and lives with her two children in the Calvario neighborhood. This will be her first loan, which she needs in order to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building supplies

loans.name: Nilpha

texts.en:
Nilpha D. is a 32-year-old married woman who supports her family through her general store and electronic reloading businesses.  She lives in Poblacion, Bacong, Negros Oriental with her 38-year-old husband, Jeffrey, who helps his wife in catering services. They have 2 children who are 10 and 3 years old.

Nilpha has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and electronic reloading business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Nilpha is now borrowing Php 12,000 so that she can expand her general store and electronic reloading businesses. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 12,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nilpha aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
Mrs. Khy L. lives in Kor village in Kandal province and she is 33 years old. She is a farmer who owns 2-hectares (5-acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband is a furniture maker in the local village who is able to earn a low income. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

The couple try to work hard but still are able to earn less income than needed. So they want to start a new business but they do not have money to do so. Thus, Mrs. Khy L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a sow for breeding. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy a wood-cutting machine.

Mrs. Khy L. is the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in a garment factory, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a sow to breed

loans.name: Mercie

texts.en:
Mercie C. is from the village of Bonifacio. She is 40 years old. Mercie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, some food for snacks, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Mercie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately PHP 10,000 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mercie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercie has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC. Mercie is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mercie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tagaynazar

texts.ru: Хасанов Тагайназар проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 53 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сын занимается животноводством, а дочь работает в магазине. Сам Тагайназар имеет средне - специальное образование, "Водитель". По профессии работает более 20 лет. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Tagaynazar H. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 53 years old, married and has 4 children. His son is involved in animal husbandry, and a daughter works at a store. Tagaynazar has a secondary-specialized education as a driver. He has been working in his profession for over 20 years. Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry. He breeds livestock at home. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Rebelita

texts.en: Rebelita G. is from Barangay Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Rebelita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rebelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Rebelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama D. est un homme marié de 38 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de  Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, Monsieur Adama D. tenta plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente d’habits, de chaussures, de tasses, etc, mais sans réussite. Il finit par apprendre auprès de son grand frère les activités  d’achat et de vente de divers articles pour  boutique. Avec plus de 2 années d’expérience, il maitrise son activité et est très sollicité.
 Pour améliorer son activité, Monsieur Adama D. décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique.
Il est à son troisième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédent ont été correctement remboursés.  
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 500 FCFA.
 Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique et assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr Adama D. is 38 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 3 children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougoni. Having never attended school, Mr Adama Kiallo has tried several income-generating activities such as selling clothes, shoes, cups etc but without success. He ended up learning from his grandfather how to buy and sell various articles and run his own shop. With more than 2 years experience, he is mastering this business and his service is in high demand. To further improve his business, Mr Adama D. decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to buy various articles for his shop. This is his third individual loan and he has diligently repaid all his previous loans. He sources his products from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and his clientele is the local population. With this loan Mr Adam D. hopes to generate a monthly profit of 60 500FCFA, with which he intends to make his shop larger and to cover all his family's expenses.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers pour boutique.

loans.name: Divine

texts.en:
Divine E. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 34 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Divine owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Divine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Divine joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Divine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Divine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
Jose Eduardo G. I. tiene 41 años. Estado unión libre y vive con su esposa, no tiene hijos, en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
 
Jose  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jose   se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembrado cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la misma comunidad sus productos los vende en el Cantón Bucal.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en le cultivo de cacao. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener más producción  y tener una casa para su familia. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades. 

Le gusta pasear en la moto.
texts.en:
Jose Eduardo G. I. is 42 years old. He lives with his common-law wife (they have no children) in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar. Jose is a member of the "Rey de Reyes" rural community bank that is about and hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members all together, and the majority make a living through agriculture. This is their first loan request through Cooperativa San Jose. Jose makes a living farming cacao. He makes his monthly purchases in the community and sells his products in the canton of Bucal. He is requesting a loan to invest in cacao farming. He feels that the loan in a chance to get ahead. He dreams with increasing production to have a house for his family. He is faces challenges such as plagues and diseases. He likes to ride his motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in cacao farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase planting materials such as urea and insecticides

loans.name: Shairkul's Group

texts.en: The first half of 2010 was marked by significant changes in the political sphere of the Kyrgyz Republic. More particularly, there was the revolution that happened on the 7th of April and interethnic conflict in the southern part of the Kyrgyz Republic. These events changed the situation in the Kyrgyz Republic in all of its aspects: social, economic, political, etc. While the government is working towards stabilizing the situation, ordinary people are trying to return to their normal way of life. So are Shairkul D., the leader of this group, and all the members of her group. Shairkul is married and has four children. She works as a cook in the hospital and earns 1,400 soms monthly. She and her husband are representative of traditional Kyrgyz families: they live together with her husband’s parents and breed cattle. They are almost fifteen years into their cattle breeding business. They started their business with an initial investment of 15,000 soms and it now brings 11,500 soms monthly. Now, they have bought a car for her husband and he is working as a taxi driver with an income of 10,000 soms. Shairkul and her husband realize the crucial role of education and want to give to their elder daughter an opportunity to study at an institution of higher education. Thus, they are asking for a loan of which the most part will go for the payment of the tuition fee for their daughter’s education and the another part will go to the purchase of hay for their cattle in order to continue their cattle breeding business. The other group members: Kului S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 49 and married with two sons: her elder son lives independently; her second son is 16 and is going to graduate from school this year. Kului works as a cook in the hospital and receives 1,800 soms monthly. Her husband is mainly involved in their family cattle-breeding business but also makes some money as a builder. They started their family cattle breeding business nine years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 soms. Now, they have significantly increased their livestock population and their business brings them 7,800 soms monthly. Together they have built a house for their elder son and he lives there with his wife. Now, their daughter is planning to get married. With the loan, Kului is planning to buy a dowry for her daughter. Azamat S. is 27 years old and is single. He works as a masseur in the hospital and receives 2,000 soms monthly. He bought an area of 0.7 hectares (1.75 acres) under crops. He started his business seven years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms and it now brings 5,100 soms monthly. Azamat wants to have a beloved wife and many children. Still, before getting married, he wants to build a house where he will live his happy married life with his family. He is asking for a loan which will help him to buy construction materials to build a house and his future. Nurzat A. is 40 and married. She is a nurse at the central hospital and receives 3,200 soms monthly. She has two daughters: her elder daughter is 16 and is going to graduate this year and her youngest daughter is 13 and goes to school. Nurzat’s husband is a farmer and their family business gives them 11,000 soms monthly. As with other mothers, she wants to give the best to her daughters. Thus, she is applying for a loan in order to pay the tuition fee of the institution of higher education so that her daughter has an opportunity to study and become a qualified specialist in the future. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's tuition fee and to purchase hay for her cattle

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le L., 54 years old, owns a small shop next to her house along a big road where she sells porridge to people who eat it for breakfast. She typically makes around $2 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She was married but her husband died of senility. She has four children, all of whom are married and help carry the responsibility for family by working at different occupations. 

Le L. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has reached a low point due to insufficient financial capital. Le L. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: La señora Domitila tiene 42 años y vive en la zona de Huaycan, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales aun está a cargo de 1, ya lleva 3 años trabajando con Edaprospo en el grupo  “Las Violetas” el cual lo conforman 8 miembros. Domitila trabaja en su bar desde hace ya un año al cual los vecinos le han llamado “El Hueco” pues es donde se refugian del sol después de jugar al futbol, su pareja trabaja en la moto taxi que pudieron comprarse con sus ahorros  y en el futuro tiene planeado poner un restaurante en su casa, pero para eso necesita que Edaprospo haga más habilitaciones.
texts.en:
Ms. Domitila is 42 years old and lives in the Huayacan area. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children, one of whom is still in her care. She has been working with EDAPROSPO for three years, with her group, "Las Violetas" ["The Violets"], which is made up of eight members. For a year, Domitila has worked in her bar, which her neighbors have called "El Hueco" ["The Alcove"] because it is where they take refuge from the sun after playing soccer. Her partner works in the motorcycle taxi that he bought with their savings. In the future, she plans to put a restaurant in her house, but in order to do so, she will need EDAPROSPO to make more loans to her.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and supplies

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa V. is 47 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Talisayan within Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Leonisa is a tailor who provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Leonisa has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Leonisa joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric and materials

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Angelina tiene 57 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de ropa, negocio que actualmente le va muy bien. Es así que su tiempo lo tiene bien administrado, por la mañanas se encargan de las labores domesticas y en las tardes se dirige a visitar a sus clientes y amigos que le compran la mercadería que ofrece. Con ganancias ayuda a cubrir los gastos educativos y de su hogar, pero su meta es construir la segunda planta de su casa, es por ello y en compañía de su esposo trabajan en lo posible para concretar este objetivo.  Por el momento necesitan construir una escalera y cercar el perímetro de una planta, para luego construir varias habitaciones, de esa manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. Esta muy contenta con lo que hace, ya que tiene en mente alquilar el primer nivel de su casa;  como local comercial, puesto que la zona donde vive hay mucha afluencia de gente. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que el dinero que necesita, será muy beneficioso para seguir edificando su casa. Por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales de construcción como: cemento, fierros, y ladrillos, para llevar adelante su propósito.
texts.en:
Angelina, 57, lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  She is a clothing merchant and does quite well.  She allots her time very well.  In the morning she takes care of domestic chores and in the afternoons she visits her customers and friends who buy the merchandise she has on offer.  Profits are used to help cover educational and household expenses but her goal is to build a second story on her house and both she and her husband work hard towards this end.

At the moment they need to build a staircase and the exterior walls and then later build the bedrooms to improve the quality of life of themselves and their children.

She is very happy with what she does since she is planning to lease the ground floor of her house as a commercial space because many people are moving into her neighborhood.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She knows that the money she needs will be very beneficial in order to continue building her house.  Therefore, she commits to repaying on time.

With the requested funds she will buy building materials and supplies, like: cement, iron rods and bricks to carry out her project.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies, like: cement, bricks and iron rods.

loans.name: Juan Arsecio

texts.es:
Juan Arsecio Y. T. tiene 45 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Juan  pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa, carro y terrenos para tener sus animales.
Le gusta caminar con la familia y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Juan Arsecio Y. T. is 45 years old, married and lives with this wife and 3 children, they live in the area of Guaranda in the Province of Bolívar.

Juan belongs to the Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba located half an hour from Guaranda. It is a group that dedicates themselves to agriculture and stock breeding like dairy cows and pigs, the group has 20 members.

Juan grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes and breeds dairy cows. He buys in Guaranda and sells to a wholesale market in the same city.

He needs the loan to buy merchandize to grow corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and animals to fatten up and later sell. The loan will help him financially to meet his families’ needs. His dream is to be able to buy a home, car and fields to have his animals.

Juan likes to walk with his family and to listen to music.

loans.use: To buy merchandize to grow corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and animals to fatten up and later sell.

loans.name: Abasolo San Juan Jicayan Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama  “Abasolo” y su representante se llama Edna B. M., el nombre del grupo se le atribuye en honor a la calle donD. habitan las integrantes del mismo, ubicado en la localidad D. San Juan Jicayan, es una población, ubicada a 45 minutos al norte D. Pinotepa nacional, Oaxaca, y su población es D. su totalidad indígena mixteco, la mayoría D. L. pobladores se dedican al trabajo artesanal y del campo, dentro D. L. trabajos artesanales se encuentran el tallado en jícara, la elaboración D. textiles, como la naguas y L. huipiles, que forman parte D. la indumentaria tradicional, la magia D. esta población radica en sus tradiciones y costumbres, pero desgraciadamente han estado sufriendo cambios D. modificación tal es el caso D. la patente D. la elaboración D. huipiles que fue desplazada por maquinas extranjeras y que les han robado el legado D. la simbología, en esta población impera la pobreza y el abandono por parte D. las autoridades, eso ha dado por consecuencia la emigración D. sus pobladores a L. estados unidos y otra parte lejos D. sus comunidades, la ignorancia y la falta D. educación son ingredientes que mezclan la desigualdad que se viven en la mayoría D. L. puebL. indígenas D. esa región. Al final D. la historia veremos el nombre D. cada una D. las integrantes del grupo y sus actividades productivas para la obtención D. recursos. 
En  esta ocasión hagamos un espacio para hablar un poco D. la vida  D. una miembro D. este grupo ella es la señora Julia Dionicio Hernández, tiene 32 años D. edad, esta casada con Félix  D. 36 años, quien toda su vida la ha dedicado al trabajo en el campo, la señora Julia, lleva 15 años D. casada, tiene 5 hijos, que actualmente están estudiando, elL. son: Miguel D. 15, estudia el tercero D. secundaria, Adelina D. 13 cursa el primero D. secundaria, Florentino D. 10, Juana D. 8 y Félix D. 7 años que cursan quinto, tercero y segundo año D. primaria, todos elL. hablan el mixteco y su madre apenas si habla un poco el español.
Julia desD. la edad D. 10 años, se ha dedicado a la elaboración D. prendas para la vestimenta tradicional mismos que actualmente se conocen como artesanías, como son; naguas, telares D. cintura, huipiles, servilletas y la elaboración D. hiL. artesanales, esto  ha sido parte D. un legado que ha trascendido D. generación en generación y que también aporta recursos al sustento familiar, como ya lo mencionamos lleva toda su vida en la elaboración D. textiles artesanales, denominado telar D. cintura, pero, ¿Qué es telar D. cintura y que se elabora con esa técnica?, hablemos un poco mas del telar D. cintura o conocido como “saahma tavi”, esta técnica es D. tiempos muy remotos podemos señalar que es D. épocas prehispánicas y tienen un gran valor y estilo propio, se utilizan materiales rústicos hechos D. madera únicas y bajo un acabado único, se elaboran prendas como las naguas en mixteco “chee”, huipiles  para cubrirse la espalda y telares para la elaboración D. huipiles en forma D. vestidos, llamados “shicu lestu”, en la elaboración D. estas prendas también el tintado son D. orígenes muy ancestrales , ya que se tintan a base D. caracol marino conocido como el caracol púrpura en el cual se obtienen colores como el guinda, morado y púrpura, así también se utiliza el añil, la grana cochinilla y el árbol D. caracol, en realidad estas prendas no comparan con las creaciones D. una maquina industrial.
 Julia se integro a un grupo D. crédito, por la necesidad D. un préstamo, mismo que utilizo para la adquisición D. material necesario para la elaboración D. sus trabajos, con este dinero ella  va poder comprar el siguiente material: hiL. D. algodón para el hilado D. huipiles, hiL. rústicos para telar D. cintura, hilo tintado D. caracol para la elaboración D. naguas, hiL. D. hiL. D. diferentes colores para la elaboración D. servilletas y manteles, hiL. para bordar, estambres y listones en varios colores. 
Uno D. L. más anhelados sueños D. Julia es tener una organización D. mujeres artesanas, en el cual preservar y enseñar las valiosas técnicas D. este arte, así como la difusión y promoción D. esta indumentaria, que ha estado siendo desplazada por tendencias modernistas D. la moda.
