Married and a mother of four children, this courageous woman also cares for three other children. Almost all of the costs of the hosehold rest on her husband, who does not have a fixed source of income. She seeks to improve iher activity and to have an income with which she can met the needs for her family Mrs. A. requests a financial support of an amount of $750 to widen her trade. The credit which she requests will be used to make a stock of bean, of gari and palm oil. That will enable her to satisfy all her customers and to have an acceptable income to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Farron Blanc, a Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ama est née à Tabligbo le 30 Mai 1970. Issue d’une famille pauvre, elle a connu beaucoup de difficultés, ce qui l’obligea à abandonner très tôt les études pour se lancer dans la vente du haricot préparé. C’est un aliment que les habitants de sa localité aiment bien, ce qui fait qu’elle reçoit quotidiennement beaucoup de clients dans son mini restaurant. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, cette courageuse femme a encore à sa charge trois (03) autres enfants. La quasi-totalité des charges du ménage reposent sur elle son mari n’a pas une source de revenu fixe. Malgré son ardeur et sa bonne foi, elle est anéantie par les charges du ménage. Elle cherche alors à améliorer son activité et avoir un revenu qui soit à la hauteur des besoins de sa famille Mme A. sollicite un appui financier d’un montant de $750 pour élargir son commerce. Le crédit qu’elle demande va servir à faire un stock du haricot, de gari et d’huile de palme. Cela lui permettra de satisfaire tous ses clients et d’avoir un revenu acceptable pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: make a stock of bean, gari and palm oil.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
This 37-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village. He is married and has 2 children.
Azer has run this business for 8 years. This car is his own.
He transports loads in his own car.
Having borrowed $600 he bought 2 wheels and 1 accumulator. Now he needs a loan of $800 to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Armandina

texts.en:
Mrs. Armandina is married and has two children who go to school. Her husband is a blue-collar worker and his salary is quite low and it’s not enough to cover all of the needs of the family; due to this situation, Armandina decided to start her own business of selling snacks seven years ago. She refitted her own home, and little by little the number of clients has increased.

In order to keep growing up until now, Armandina needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to be able to offer a bigger variety of products to her clients, she plans to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. Your help means a lot to this family, they are grateful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Armandina es casada y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, su esposo trabaja como obrero pero recibe un salario muy bajo y no alcanza a cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ante esta situación Armandina decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de snack hace siete años, inició en un lugar que acondicionó en su propio hogar, poco a poco se han incrementado su número de clientes.

Ahora para continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, Armandina requiere de un préstamo por $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mejora variedad a sus clientes, ella está dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú ayuda será de gran utilidad para esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao's family has four members. The two children are in school and their parents work as day laborers. Their average income is $11 per month per person. Now Dao wants to borrow $ 75 to raise pigs. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: raising pigs

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang P., 28, lives in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband, 38, and their three children who are all students. Mrs. Sang P. is a vendor selling rice-crops, while her husband currently works as a farmer and earns US$1 a day. She intends to use the loan of US$600 to buy a horse and a cart, so that her husband can start a business of transporting people from the village, thereby earning important additional income for the P. family.

loans.use: Purchase of a horse and a cart to operate a business

loans.name: Wiliemina

texts.en:
WILIEMINA, age 36, lives with her husband and 2 girls (ages 13 and 15). While her husband works as a traffic controller at the airport, Wiliemina decided to start her own business. Three years ago, she began selling fabrics on the street and from door-to-door. She feels very happy to be working.

Twice a month, Wiliemina travels to purchase the fabrics in Kigoma, a town that is a two-day train ride away, costing almost $60. In Kigoma, Wiliemina buys 50-60 pieces of fabric for around $18 per piece, which she will sell in Dar es Salaam for $22-27 each.

Wiliemina hopes to take out a loan to increase her stock. She belongs to the group Airport (due to their location near the national airport), which consists of 17 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Sepi

texts.en:
Sepi is a widow, 36 years old, with 10 children. In addition, she cares for 2 orphans. If you have read some of my other stories about the people in the village of Kiyinde, you know I can’t stop talking about all the babies. Within the last three stories I have a baby head count of 30 babies amongst 3 families. What’s going on in Kiyinde? I do have a theory. These remote villages are very family oriented. The joy of children is quite evident. There is not a lot to do and the men are out fishing all day. What I notice are the women all look after each other in a special way. Caring for babies unites them. Since there are few or no jobs, women have plenty of time to visit as they watch after each others' babies. The land is fertile so food is plentiful and easy to grow, so you do not have to worry about getting food, and the lake provides ample fish.

Sepi has a small retail store in Kiyinde. She sells cooking oil, sugar, maize flour, bread, beans and cosmetics. She will use her loan to buy supplies for her store. She dreams of buying a plot of land to build a house and hopes to educate her children so they can go to the university.

loans.use: Sepi plans to use her loan to buy more dry staples in bulk.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor has a business selling agrochemicals in Bellavista, San Martin.  Bellavista is the largest town in a rural area surrounded by large and small farms so her products are always in high demand.  She says that her store is special because she has products that aren’t as harmful to the environment.  The land in the area has been overworked and is contaminated, so crops don’t grow as well as they used to.  She has many clients that come to her store because they know her products will help prevent further damage to their land.

Flor is 35 years old and married.  She doesn’t have any children but has nine siblings and many nephews and nieces.  Her husband is very supportive and helps her with most of the manual labor.  She loves her business and is happy she is able to help the rest of her family who aren’t as fortunate.  Flor is also happy with all the people she’s helped and friends she’s made through her business.

A member of the community bank Mujeres del Futuro, Flor is requesting a loan of S/ 2500, that will pay in 6 months.  With the loan she would like to buy herbicides, fertilizer, and medicines for livestock.  These products are in high demand and she is running low.

loans.use: Buy herbicides, fertilizer and medicines for livestock

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a thirty-five-year-old single mom, raising her six children on her own. Josefina owns and operates a general store which people in the neighborhood visit to get a large variety of goods such as rice, beans, fresh vegetables, milk, eggs, rum, beer and so forth. Josefina operates the business in a rented locale but she wants to have her own house so that her family can live at ease.

With her loan, Josefina will replenish her store since supplies are running low.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of many goods to replenish her general store

loans.name: Maritza's Group

texts.es:
Maritza, Carmen and Maribel belong to the Women Entrepreneurs Community Bank since 1 year.

Maritzia is 25 years old; she is a single mother and has a 5 months old son. Maritzia is a school teacher and since 2 years, she sells ceviche (form of citrus marinated seafood salad) at the Pérez de Cuellar Park during the weekends. Moreover, Maritzia also works as a cashier at a nightclub.

Carmen is 26 years old and she is single. She sells salchipollo (typical Peruvian food prepared with potatoes and chicken) at her home’s doorway. Besides, Carmen works as an apprentice at a tailoring workshop.

Maribel is 20 years old and she is single. She breeds small animals in her home and sells them at the Ayacucho city’s markets or upon direct request from her clients.

Maritza, Carmen y Maribel request a loan of 400 soles each (140USD aprox.) to invest buying fish, lemons, onions, corn, rice, oil and sucking pigs.

They all have dreams. For instance, Maritzia whishes to have her own stand to sell ceviche and to continue working as a teacher and Carmen would like to buy sewing machines and to install her own tailoring shop. Maritzia, Carmen and Maribel want their businesses to thrive.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza es madre soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo de 5 meses, de profesión profesora, Maritza los fines de semanas vende cebiche en el parque Pérez de Cuellar, actividad que realiza hace 2 años. Además Maritza trabaja por las noches en una discoteca como cajera.

Por otro lado Carmen es soltera y tiene 26 años, Carmen vende salchipollo (comida preparada con papa y pollo fritos), en la puerta de su casa. Además Carmen trabaja como ayudante en un taller de confección de prendas de vestir.

Mientras que Maribel es soltera y tiene 20 años, Maribel se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, actividad que realiza en su casa, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y a pedido de sus clientes.

Maritza, Carmen y Maribel necesitan préstamos de 400 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado, limón, cebolla, maíz, papa, arroz, aceite y lechones.

Los sueños de Maritza, Carmen y Maribel son tener una cebichería en un local estable, ejercer su carrera, comprar sus maquinarias e implementar su propio taller y que sus negocios sean prósperos.

loans.use: Maritza, Carmen y Maribel request a loan of 400 soles each (140USD aprox.) to invest buying fish, lemons, onions, corn, rice, oil and sucking pigs.

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
Doña Fátima G. is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Her husband makes a living by painting and doing body work on cars. Both work very hard to pay for their home's expenses.

Fátima started her business by selling fruits and vegetables. She now also sells food and beverages. Her business is set up in her home, and she usually sells her food by delivering orders. She has been progressing her business for 13 years. She hopes that her business can grow in the future so she can leave a good inheritance to her children and a decent home with better comforts.

She needs this loan to buy sand and cement to finish constructing a room in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Fátima G. es una señora de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos que están en edad escolar. Su esposo se dedica al enderezado y pintura de vehículos. Ambos trabajan arduamente para sufragar los gastos del hogar.

La señora inició su negocio con la venta de frutas y verduras, ahora también se dedica a vender comidas y refrescos, el negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa de habitación y la comida la vende generalmente por encargos, ya tiene 13 años llevando adelante su pequeño negocio. Ella espera que en un futuro su negocio pueda crecer para dejarle un buen patrimonio a sus hijos, una vivienda digna y con mejores comodidades.

Requiere del préstamo para comprar arena y cemento para terminar de construir un cuarto en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To purchase sand and cement to finish constructing a room in her house.

loans.name: Sulochana

texts.en:
Mrs. Sulochana K. is a 40 year’s old lady who lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses like grocery.  Her son works in his own grocery store and her daughter works in a private office. 
Mrs. K. makes different varieties of pickles. She took 3 months training for this job. She sells her product in grocery stores and department stores. 
Now she is requesting for her first loan of $150 to buy food material for her work.

loans.use: To buy food material for her work

loans.name: Jahangir

texts.en: Jahangir N., 31 years old, breeds calves in the internally displaced people (IDP) settlement in the Bilasuvar region. He has nine years of experience in this field. In addition to the breeding business, Jahangir works as a taxi driver and receives social support from the government in the amount of  $70 US per month. Local people are very poor and use taxi services very rarely. So the main source of income in Jahangir's family is calf breeding. He is applying for $1200 US to purchase four calves.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Ciriaca C., I am 43 years old, I am a single mom. I have a son who is older and independent, sometimes he helps me at home.  I work selling dairy, my business is located in the main market of the community, I have good clients who like the quality of my products and above all, its hygiene.  At this time, I need to increase the inventory to sell more and get ahead with my business, which is the only thing generating income for my home.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.
hola mi nombre es Ciriaca C. tengo 43 años de edad, soy madre soltera, tengo un hijo que ya esta grande y es independiente y en algunos casos me ayuda en mi hogar.
me dedico a venta de lacteos, tengo mi negocio en el mercado municipal de esta comunidad, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta la calidad de mi producto y sobre todo lo higienico que es , en estos momentos necesito surtir mas mi negocio, para poder vender mas y asi salir adelante con mi negocio que es lo unico que me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase dairy products.

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanaham....30 yea..old. She ..married with two children, ag..3 and 5. She h..been a soap and oil seller since 2007. She wor..at her busin.. each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 (..Dollars) in sales.

Mwanaham..hop..for a loan to buy more soap and oil for her busin...

loans.use: To buy more soap and oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and improve his fishing business by purchasing a fishing boat and fishing tools (e.g., nets and fishing lines)

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Alejo es carpintero, realiza muebles, puertas y ventanas a pedido. Tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son sus ayudantes, el negocio le permite mantener dignamente a la familia, su esposa esta a cargo del hogar y no trabaja. La familia paga alquileres de una casa ubicada en la zona Franz Tamayo de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (madera). Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejo is a carpenter. He makes furniture, doors and windows by order. He has 4 children, two of which are his helpers. The business allows him to support his family with dignity. His wife is in charge of the home and does not work. The family pays rent for a home located in the zone of Franz Tamayo in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase materials such as wood. This is his first loan with Impro; the evaluation conducted qualified him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Ni Made Suartini

texts.id: Kehidupan keluarga Ni Made Suartini sangat sederhana, suaminya yang bekerja sebagai seorang petani dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu terkadang tidak mencukupi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari mereka, namun hal ini tidak membuat Ni Made Suartini patah semangat, sebagai seorang istri  ia berusaha untuk membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dengan beternak babi. Saat ini  Ni Made Suartini memelihara 1 ekor babi  penggemukan dengan periode pemeliharaan selama 5 bulan dan keuntungan yan didapat sekitar Rp. 300.000,-. Dalam menjalankan usaha Ni Made Suartini mengaku sangat sulit untuk mengembangkan usahanya karena kekurangan modal untuk membeli pakan dan menambah bibit penggemukan serta pengobatan apabila babinya sakit. Melalui program DINARI, Ni Made Suartini mendapat pembinaan dan pinjaman modal usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- yang di pergunakan untuk membeli bibit penggemukan dan pakan untuk mengembangkan usahanya agar bisa meningkatkan penghasilan keluarganya.nNi Made Suartini saat ini sangat senang dan berterimakasih kapada DINARI yang mau memberikan pendampingan serta pinjaman modal usaha  dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6  bulan serta pembayarannya dilakukan di akhir periode pinjaman. n
texts.en:
Ni Made Suartini's family lives a simple life. Her husband works as a seasonal labor at local farming industry. She wants to help the family's economy by raising pigs.

At the moment she is raising a breeding pig for a 5 month period. She is hoping to be able to earn a net profit of IDR 300 thousand (around USD 28) from this. She got the capital from DINARI in the form of working capital loan of IDR 5 million (around USD 475). She is very grateful to DINARI who also provides continuous support such as training and consulting to her.

She will repay the loan to DINARI at the end of her 6 month loan program.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy breeding pig (Membeli anak babi untuk penggemukkan)

loans.name: Ean

texts.en: Mr. Ean K. is 51 years old and lives in Moeun Tom Rang village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. His wife, Mrs. Koeut Hum, is a construction worker. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn insufficient income to support their household. Thus, Mr. Ean K. is seeking a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business; he plans to use the remainder of the loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. He is married and has four children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas la Triunfo” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300, compró insumos para su negocio de reparto de mazamorra. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que trabaja repartiendo mazamorra por las mañana y además hace un año es socia de la farmacia donde trabaja. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, aumentará el stock de medicamentos de su farmacia y comprará más insumos para su negocio de reparto de mazamorra.
Bertha desea continuar trabajando para aumentar las ganancias tanto en su farmacia como en su negocio de mazamorra.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha is a member of the Women United in Triumph (“Mujeres Unidas la Triunfo”) Community Bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 29 years old and is single.

With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought supplies for her business of delivering mazamorra (corn porridge). She has worked with the Community Bank for almost a year. She delivers mazamorra in the morning and has also worked at a pharmacy for a year.

With this loan of 1,300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will increase her stock of medicines in her pharmacy and will buy more supplies for her mazamorra delivery business.

Bertha wants to continue working to increase her earnings in her pharmacy as well as in her mazamorra business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy medicines and supplies to make mazamorra (corn porridge)

loans.name: Zarnishan

texts.en:
Zarnishan Z. is 48 years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. For the last 7 years, Zarnishan has sold jewelry in the local market. Gradually, her business has expanded and, currently, Zarnishan has earned 1000 USD from her work.

Zarnishan sells jewelry in the oriental style. The traditional earrings, rings, and bracelets are very beautiful and popular in Azerbaijan. Every woman has at least one set of jewelry, probably inherited from her grandmother. Zarnishan has a lot of customers and her business is rather successful and generates a stable income for the family.

Today, Zarnishan is requesting 1200 USD for a 15-month term. She is going to purchase new items of jewelry to increase the range of goods that she sells. She thanks you for all your support and promises to pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: To purchase new jewelry items for re-sale

loans.name: Mansab Mai Imtiaz Hussain Group

texts.en:
Mansab mai baji is a 31year old married lady and a citizen in a city called Multan, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Her husband, I. H. is a farmer. Mansab baji helps him by sowing seeds in the field for the different crops that they grow. They both have been doing this work for 15 years. Mansab baji has one daughter who is in the 6th grade. 

Mansab baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. 

She is the leader of a loan group consisting of herself and another lady. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Maura es casada, tiene 59 años y 8 hijos, Maura tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, también elabora gelatinas, chupetes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos.
Maura necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, atun, fideo, leche, azúcar.
Maura sueña con ampliar su tienda y que sus últimos 2 hijos obtengan sus títulos.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Community Bank “Los Claveles.” She is 59 years old, married, and has 8 children. She has a store in her home where she sells general grocery items, fruits and vegetables. She also makes jello and suckers that her husband and kids help her with. Maura is asking for 1,000 soles that she will use to buy cooking oil, tuna, pasta, milk and sugar. Maura dreams of expanding her store and also hopes to see her 2 youngest children earn their degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cooking oil, tuna, pasta, milk and sugar

loans.name: Uilaemotasi

texts.en: Uilaemotasi S., 19, is single with two children.  She has two years of experience in the coconut oil business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (~229 USD).  SPBD loans are Uilaemotasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used mainly for her business; buying an electric machine used to squeeze the oil, which is faster than using your hands to squeeze it, and buying a load of coconuts.

loans.use: To purchase a load of coconuts and an electric machine used to squeeze the oil.

loans.name: Apauline

texts.fr:
A. Apauline est née vers 1966; elle est de nationalité togolaise ( le Togo est un pays frontalier au Bénin). Apauline est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants tous scolarisés; seulement deux (2) enfants sont encore à sa charge. Apauline réside au quartier Gbégamey; et c'est dans le marché de ce quartier qu'elle vend. Depuis dix huit, Apauline vend des céréales et des condiments pour préparer la sauce. Apauline se rend dans les petits marchés locaux du Bénin pour acheter les céréales qu'elle revient vendre au marché de Gbégamey. En ce qui concerne les condiments pour la sauce, c'est dans le marché international du Bénin que Apauline s'approvisionne. Apauline a déjà eu deux prêts de la part de ALIDé. Ces deux prêts lui ont permis d'élever le niveau de son activité. Toutefois, Apauline veut continuer de développer son commerce; c'est pourquoi elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Apauline A. was born around 1966. She is Togolese (Togo is a border country of Benin). Apauline is married and the mother of 3 children, all in school. Only two of the children are still her responsibility. Apauline lives in the Gbégamey neighborhood and she does her selling in the market of that district.

For 10 years, Apauline has been selling cereals and condiments for sauces. Apauline goes to the little local markets in Benin to buy the cereals that she re-sells at the market of Gbégamey. As for condiments for sauces, Apauline buys her supplies in the international market of Benin. She has already had two loans through ALIDé. These two loans have permitted her to expand her business. However, Apauline wants to continue to develop her business; that is why she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to reinforce her working capital so as to better satisfy her clientele. The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor. Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigeria; the GDP of its inhabitants stands at US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable persons, and it is in a group which will soon be offering a micro health insurance program for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize and rice, and condiments for sauces

loans.name: Mirsa Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Mirsa Elizabeth Gutiérrez, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, desde hace siete años, el cual inicio con ayuda de su mama, tiene 30 años, reside en el barrio Sabana Grande, tiene dos hijos de de 6 años que estudian la primaria, con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de perfumenes y cosméticos, para agrandar su inventario y aumentar sus ventas, este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic que se ha beneficiado para mantener su familia, su negocio y espera seguir mejorando económicamente para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirsa Elizabeth Gutiérrez has been selling clothes, shoes, and cosmetics for seven years. She started her business with her mother’s help. She is 30, and she lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood. She has two children, 6 years old, who attend primary school. She wants to use this loan to purchase perfume and cosmetics to have more inventory and increase sales. This is her fifth loan cycle with Afodenic, which has been beneficial in providing for her family and sustaining her business. She hopes to keep improving economically for the well being of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Juneper

texts.en: Juneper F. is 27 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and child in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City.  He is a motorcycle driver and his wife manages their variety store. Juneper is working hard to save money for their child's education. He has decided to improve his variety store by purchasing more stock to sell. He is applying for the loan program offered by HSPFI, a KIVA partner. According to Juneper, if his loan is granted, it will be of great help to his business and to his family. He is looking forward to a positive response to his request.

loans.use: To purchase addtional stock for his variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Marisol es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Marisol realiza trabajos artesanales como carteras, correas, Marisol es la presidenta de una Asociación Civil de Mujeres Artesanas Cabuya, el cual cuenta con 10 socias, sus productos los venden a diferentes tiendas de la capital y también se exportan a través de intermediarios.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una maquina aparadora de cueros.
Los sueños de Marisol son tener tiendas de exposición en diferentes departamentos y exportar directamente sus productos.
texts.en:
Marisol is an associate of the Communal Bank Corri Ayulla which means Family of Gold. Marisol is married, is 35 years old and has 3 children. Marisol makes a living as an artesian. She works making purses and sashes. Marisol is the president of the Civil Association of Artisan Women, which has 10 associates that sell their products to different stores in the capital and also they export their good through intermediaries. Marisol needs a loan of $1025 that will be invested in the purchase of a sewing machine for leather. The dreams of Marisol are to have stores in different neighborhoods and to be able to directly export her goods.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for leather

loans.name: Mahamed

texts.en:
Mahamed B. is currently in the business of selling water tanks and pipes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. Mahamed is 20 years old and is married with a husband that is a Southern Sudan television news reader. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To increase stock of water tanks and pipes

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia V. is 50 years old and is married to Francisco V. Jr. The couple were blessed with four children. Their youngest child is still studying in high school,  but the eldest only finished elementary school while the second and third attended some high school. Letecia considered this a failure for herself but according to her she had no options then. She and her husband were just laborers and had a very small income. They didn't even have capital to start up a business. 

In 2007, Letecia heard about ASHI. Her dream of having a stable life with stable house and stable future of her children was rekindled, despite her chidlren's educational attainment. When she received her first and succeeding loans from ASHI, shestarted her own business of buying and selling vegetables. It has been two years that she has had this kind of business. Buying and selling vegetables has been a great help to Letecia and her family.  However, the demand of her family grows as years goes by, so  she aspires to have more business that can add  to her present income so she will have bigger profits and savings. 

Letecia thought of raising pigs (hog-fattening) in her backyard to be sold after four months. With this kind of business, she can still manage her previous business, because either her children or husband can feed the pigs at home when she's away selling her vegetables. Letecia's loan is intended for this. Someday, as her income increases, she wants her hog fattening business to grow. She plans to sell her pigs during market day in the town's public market.

loans.use: purchases needed for a hog-fattening business, such as 2 piglets, feed, immunizations, and also to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Petronalo

texts.en:
Petronalo is a 47-year-old widow from Kisumu, Kenya. She buys small fish (called omena) from Lake Victoria and sells them at a market in town. Petronalo wants to expand her business to include larger fish such as tilapia and mud fish. Her dream is to have a large fish company that exports fish all over the country.

Petronalo explains that she finds life difficult. Her husband passed away, and she suffers from asthma. This business is all she has to help feed her four children and one grandchild.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes N. sells cloths in Hohoe. Agnes did not receive any form of formal education.  She is married and has 4 dependants .Her husband is a trader whose earns a little for a living. Agnes has been selling cloths since 2005. She is responsible for feeding and clothing the children. Her loan will be used to buy ladies bags and shoes on large quantity and sell. She hopes to save the new profit from her business to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy ladies bags and shoes on large quantity and sell.

loans.name: Miguel Atanacio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, el señor Miguel Atanacio R. se dedica a brindar el servicio de audio y grabación para toda ocasión el cual los clientes le solicitan que elabore algunas viñetas o anuncios para estos luego publicarlos en diversos fines ya sea para anuncios en las calles o grabaciones de discos musicales para celebraciones.

La razón por la que acudió a Ceprodel es para solicitar el crédito oportuno para la compra de una computadora ya que la que posee necesita mayores capacidades para así continuar con sus grabaciones y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio y de alta calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon, Miguel Atanacio Ruis is an audio and recording services provider. He produces vignettes and announcements that will later be used in different venues, such as public announcements to be broadcast in the streets or the production of music CDs for special occasions.

He has approached Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to purchase a computer. He has seen the need to have one because it will permit him to produce larger quantities of his product, and to keep up the recording services. He wishes to provide a better quality of service to his clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Teresa de Jesus I. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, dicho negocio esta creciendo ya que esta ubicado en una zona muy buena, tiene muchos clientes, sus precios son muy bajos y su producto es de buena calidad, esto hace que tenga muchos clientes, ademas ella vive en una zona de recursos economicos bajos y por eso tiene que vender su producto a un precio que sea bueno para todos los habitantes de dicha zona.
Maria necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, desea surtir mas su negocio para poder cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
su meta es poder acondicionar mejor su negocio para tener una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa sells popular consumer products from a small store in her own home. Her business is growing, since it is located in a very good location, has many customers, and the prices are low and the products of good quality. One reason she has so many customers is that people in her neighborhood have limited economic resources, and for that reason she has to sell her products at a good price for the inhabitants of the zone. Teresa needs this loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale to better supply her business and cover all her customers' demands. Her goal is to prepare her store to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SOFT DRINKS, SNACKS, LARD, PILLS, SOAP, SALSA, PASTA, COOKIES, AND CONDIMENTS

loans.name: Aida Patricia

texts.es: Aida Patricia Hernández Méndez tiene 24 años. Es una madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo ello asisten a un colegio público ya que Aida no tiene los suficientes recursos para costear los gastos de un colegio privado. Su actividad económica es la venta de leña. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, y dio inicio por la necesidad de mantener a su familia además Aida no término sus estudios ya que sus padres no pudieron brindarles esta oportunidad, pero esto no le impidió salir adelante con esta humilde actividad. Ella es una joven muy trabajadora y disfruta mucho de su trabajo, porque todos sus clientes gratifican su valor porque a pesar de ser muy joven ha logrado salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra leña. Su mayor sueño es obtener otro negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She sells VCDs and she also sells rechargeable phone cards to make a living. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more VCDs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en: Emanuel O. is a Tanzanian business man.  He runs a business where he sells home products at the Kariakoo city shopping center. He purchases goods from wholesale and retail shops and resells to customers. He has been in the business for four years. He is not yet married. The business income is used to provide capital for the business and meet his daily needs. He is requesting a loan of TSZ 600,000 to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more products.

loans.name: Fanice Imali

texts.en:
Fanice is 51 years old and widowed with one son. She sells cereals, rice, beans, millet, soya beans, cassava, sorghum, and groundnuts to walk-in customers and local residents. She has been running her business for the last 18 years and it has helped her to care for her family and educate her son. Fanice describes herself as respectful and attentive to her customers' needs. Her main business challenges are insecurity leading to her goods being stolen at night, destruction of her goods by the rains, and the poor road transport network for distributing her goods.

Fanice is requesting a loan of 85,000 KES to buy cereals, maize, beans and groundnuts. In the future, she wants to expand her business, build a permanent stall, and own a hotel.

loans.use: To buy cereals, maize, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is 43 years old, married with 6 children. Her husband is a fashion designer. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

Clementina sells soup ingredients at retail prices to her customers. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of the family. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more soup ingredients to sell. She says thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Sergio Vasco

texts.pt:
Sérgio Vasco B. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 27 anos de idade, casado e pai de 1 filho de 4 anos de idade. Fez somente 5ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 4 irmãos que vivem com ele.

 Nunca mudou de cidade continua a viver em Boane desde a infância, tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 10 anos e não possui nenhum empregado. Aprendeu esta actividade com os pais e faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia, onde vende mais cerveja, refrescos e vinho. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt por semana, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrigerantes, vinhos e outros) para aumentar o volume e diversificar a sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.000.00mt para mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para adquirir uma viatura como forma de facilitar o transporte da sua mercadoria e ainda para aplicar no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Sérgio Vasco was born in the District of Boane, in the Maputo Province, in the South of Mozambique. He is 27 years old, married and the father of a 4-year old. He only went to school until the 5th grade due to his parents lack of financial resources. He owns the house where he lives with his family and 4 siblings he also supports.

He has lived in Boane since his childhood and has never lived anywhere else. He has had his own business for over 10 years and has no employees. He learned the businees from his parents and works around 10 hours a day. He sells mostly beer, sodas and wine. He makes around 2.000.00mt a week which goes towards house expenses and his savings account.

He has never had loans from other banks. He came to know about Hluvuku through his neighbor who is also a member. This loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, is his second. He intends to purchase supplies (beer, sodas, wine and others) to increase and diversify his inventory. The previous loan was for 7.000.00mt used for the same purpose.

In the future, he would like to request more loans to buy a car to make transporting his inventory easier and to invest in his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (beer, sodas and others)

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta S. J. comes from Jala-jala, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is a 53-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of an only child, Jomar S. J.. For her age, Crisanta is seen as strong and determined to improve their standard of living.

Crisanta operates a passenger jeepney (a small bus) and tends to a fishing business at the same time. She started these businesses only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The businesses are a big help for the family in covering their expenses and to set aside savings for the future.

The couple is requesting a loan of PhP 40,000 to pay for a radiator, brake drum, signal lights, wheels and other spare parts for the jeepney. The proceeds of her business give her money to support the immediate and basic needs of her family.

Crisanta hopes that her business will become successful someday. Along with the business success she is dreaming about, is the hope to see the graduation of her only son at college level and to see him find a stable job. She also still dreams of having a durable and concrete house of her own and to save for her family’s future.

Crisanta wants to thank ASHI and Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. That is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her goals.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her jeepney

loans.name: Baryaly Norya Group

texts.en:
This is the BaryA. Norya group. There are five members in this group. The group leader is Naqebullah, and he is a married man. He lives with his family and he wants to take a loan for his business of general store. He has to work hard and earn money for the completion of house expenses. He wants to purchase additional materials for his shop and make it vast.

Norya is a tailor and works hard to earn money for the completion of her family’s requirements. She needs to buy a new sewing machine for her shop because she has lots of problems with the old one she has. Besides, she wants to hire a student to support this business and to enlarge the business. Shokorya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of car-part selling shop. He wants to expand and develop his business. BaryA. wants to take a loan for his business of painting. He paints houses according to the desire of the owner. He needs the money because he wants to improve for his business. And the other member, Najebullah, wants to take a loan for his business of video shop. He would like to expand his business.

They are all thankful to the Kiva lenders from their support.

loans.use: to expand their businesses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther D. is from the city of P_3 Gango Ozamiz City. She is 55 years old. Esther is married and has 4 adult children. Esther owns & operates a service business. She provides funeral services to the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Esther is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair a vehicle used in her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esther from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es: Miriam es una joven de 29 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos, que trabaja mucho para poder sobresalir adelante y poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos.  Solo cuenta con el apoyo de su madre el cual la impulso para que trabajara independiente y pudiera cuidar de sus hijos. Al comienzo palmeaba tortilla ya que su mama tenía un puesto, luego comenzó a comprar productos de cosméticos, ropa y vendía ambulante por las calle de Managua, con las ganancias comenzó hacer nacatamales, vigoron, vaho los fines de semana. Luego opto por financiamiento que logro invertir mas en ropa, zapatos, cosmético en su casa de habitación y con sus ganancia esta haciendo comida, desayuno para la personas que trabajan en zona franca y los fines de semana la venta de nacatamales. Con este préstamo comprara ropa para dama, niños y caballeros, productos cosméticos para seguir aumentando su inventario como mejorar las ganancias ya que solo depende de sus ventas para alimentar  a sus pequeños hijos. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su pequeña casa ya que falta repellar las paredes, embaldosar para una mejor higiene, cambiar puerta es por eso da las gracias ala institución por hacer posible esta inversión.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 29-year-old single mother with 3 children. She works arduously to get ahead so that she can provide her children with a good education. She receives support solely from her mother, who compelled her to be self-employed so that she can take care of her children.

At first, she used to make handmade tortillas because her mother had a tortilla stand. Later, she started selling cosmetics and apparel as a street vendor in Managua. With the profits she earned, she started making nacatamales (Central American tamales), vigoron (traditional Nicaraguan fast food), and vaho (a mix of meat, green plantains and yuca cooked in banana leaves) on weekends. She then opted to take out a loan and invested it in purchasing more apparel, footwear, and cosmetics to sell them from home. With those profits, she started making breakfast and lunch for the people who work in the Free Trade Zone. On weekends, she sells nacatamales.

With this loan, she will purchase more beauty products, as well as clothing for men, women and children so that she can keep increasing her inventory and profits because she depends on this money to be able to feed her young children.

She plans on making household repairs because she needs to have the walls plastered, lay down tile for added hygiene, and replace the doors of her small house. She gives thanks to the institute for making this investment possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and apparel

loans.name: Pakita

texts.en:
Pakita M., age 49, is married with four grown children. She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband, Secero, works a carpenter. To supply additional income for her family, Pakita is starting a business direct selling of Avon products and rice in the neighborhood.  She is ambitious and determined to launch a successful business venture of her own.

Pakita would like to receive a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase an inventory of lotion, Windscape, cologne, lipstick, underwear, powder, and supplies of rice. A dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Pakita is thankful for secured access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Her long-term goals are to build a sustainable business, fund her children’s college education, and to construct a more durable home that can withstand the flooding so common in her town. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

About ASHI: 

Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of lotion, Windscape, cologne, lipstick, underwear, powder, and supplies of rice

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 37 years old and is married with four children who are 4, 8, 11 and 13 years old. Marie is known in the business of selling new clothes, mainly children’s clothes. She has been in this business for about five years and the hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Marie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through adding a variety of styles such as men’s and women’s clothes. With this loan, she has a vision of wholesaling and retailing at the same time so that her revenue can be highly increased.

If successful, Marie hopes to continue building a secure future for her family and, additionally, she will help the people from her community by employing them.

loans.use: To add the sale of men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Mr. Tong T., 58, lives in Boeng Kraom village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sarum Pen, are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their field is ready to plant so Mr. Tong T. is asking for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds to grow. The farm supports seven children, three of whom help their parents in farming, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy corn seed and bean seed to grow

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en:
Gombo H., 70, lives with his wife and son in Hovd province, Mongolia. He operates a grocery store in his yard. He has been operating his business since 2003 and has built a stable operation over the past seven years. His grocery store has an excellent location.

Gombo's wife, Avirmed, is retired and helps with her husband's business. Their son is a 32-year-old professional photographer, and is currently living at home due to a headache disorder.

Gombo is a very hardworking and decisive person who has taken responsibility for his family. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more food products for his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for his grocery store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen es una cliente antigua de la institución, anteriormente trabajó con un grupo solidario llamado "Madrugadores", ahora trabaja individualmente, ella se dedica a la confección de trajes para dama, vestidos de fiesta y pantalones maternales, es un señora muy conocida en la zona de Pampahasi que donde ella vive, tiene sus hijos que ya son independientes pero siempre están al pendiente de su mamá, el crédito que solicita ahora es para la compra de tela para la confección de pantalones, ya que tiene muchos  pedidos por estas epocas ya que se acerca el dia de la Madre. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is a former member of our institution. Previously she was a member of a community group called “Madrugadores” (Early Risers), but now she works on her own. She makes women’s clothing such as dresses for special occasions and maternity pants. Carmen is well known in the Pampahasi area where she lives. Her children are independent but they are still close to their mother. This loan will be used to buy material to make pants as there are currently many orders for the upcoming Mothers Day. Carmen is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda B. is from the village of Christine, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Yolanda is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be Yolanda's fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Christine Village, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabe

loans.name: Luka

texts.en: Luka A. M. is forty-three years old, married, and has seven children aged between 2 & 18 years old. His business is located in a residential area in Kakamega, in the western region of Kenya. It is well known as the sugar belt region for its production of sugarcane. For the last twelve years, he has been selling items such as rice, flour, oil, detergents, and soft drinks, among others, to the local people. He says that this business is profitable, and his major challenge is debtors not paying as per their agreements. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy more general items to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future, and to give his children a quality education. He describes himself as very hardworking, honest and humble.

loans.use: to buy more general items to expand his business

loans.name: Phoeurk

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeurk S., a 33 year-old mother of a young child attending school, sells a little grocery inventory out of her home to help meet the needs of her family. She has been operating this business for four years and earns approximately $3.50 per day. To help support the family, her husband cultivates rice and vegetable crops.

Hoping to enlarge her business, Phoeurk S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to accumulate a larger number of grocery items to sell and to purchase some needed inputs for their farm field, measures that will allow her to increase her income and enable her family to attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger number of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Melva Pilar

texts.es:
Melva Pilar T. C. tiene 26 años. Es separada y vive con sus 3 hijos de 8,10 y 11 y media años, en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Melva es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Melva trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz, y cacao. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cuando hay cacao (semanal) y cada 6 meses para maíz y arroz.

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar maíz y arroz: comprar insumos, semillas, y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a seguir adelante y quedar bien para tener más crédito después. Su sueño es seguir adelante, que las cosas sean mejor en el futuro y que los niños no tienen enfermedades. Enfrente plagas en los cultivos.

Le gusta jugar con sus niños y jugar fútbol con mujeres.
texts.en:
Melva Pilar T. C. is 26 years old, separated from her husband, and has three children (ages 8, 10, and 11½). She lives in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Melva is a member of the Recinto San Ramón Communal Bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramos, 12km outside of Ventanas. The group consists of 20 members who engage in short cycle agriculture (growing crops that can be harvested in six months). They are requesting their first loan from Cooperativa San José.

Melva is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and cacao. She sells cacao in Ventanas on a weekly basis. The corn and rice are sold every six months.

She is requesting a loan for growing corn and rice. Melva plans to buy supplies, seeds, and composts. She believes this loan will help her move forward and become eligible for subsequent loans. Her dream is to be successful, acquire nicer things in the future, and prevent her children from getting sick. She still has to confront diseases that affect her crops.

Melva enjoys playing with her children and playing women’s soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies, seeds, and compost for planting rice and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For Avon products, perfumes, creams, make-up.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her cakes

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita D. is from the village of Soyung Echague. She is 58 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert R. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 32 years old and single. To make a living, Robert buys and sells bananas in the local community. Robert has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Robert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which he used to purchase additional bananas to sell. Robert is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be his third loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary L. is currently in the business of selling cassava flour and local alcohol. She is requesting a loan to stock more cassava flour to sell.  Mary is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 4 children and 1 of her children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Melvin Jose

texts.es: El señor Melvin Jose R. M., es casado su esposa realiza las tareas del hogar, tienen 1 hijo de 4 añitos, ellos habitan en el Barrio Medardo Andino, el señor es conductor y el proveedor del sustento económico del hogar de los R., ellos son una familia muy humilde que su hogar se ha visto amenazado y deteriorado por las fuertes lluvias del invierno, es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales que le permitan edificar una pared en la sala de su vivenda y que es de urgencia para la protección de su pequeño  y su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Melvin Jose R. M. is married and has a four year old child. His wife handles the household chores. They live in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. Melvin works as a driver and provides financial support for his family. They are a very modest family and their home is threatened by decay resulting from the strong winter rains.

Therefore, Melvin is requesting a loan to buy materials for building a wall in the living room of his home. It is urgent that he provide protection for his wife and young child.

loans.use: Purchase materials for building a wall

loans.name: Wilber Alexander

texts.es:
Wilber de 27 años de edad, reside en San Jorge departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 4 meses, se dedica a la filmación de videos y fotografías, inicio su negocio cuando termino de recibir un curso de fotografías, trabaja solo y no tiene horario fijo atendiendo este negocio desde hace 8 años.
El quiere comprar una cámara de video y para realizar esta compra solicita un préstamo ya que con esta cámara podrá cubrir mas eventos sociales ayudando de esta manera a que su hogar reciba más ingresos para solventar las necesidades diarias.
El sueño de Wilber es tener un local de fotografías mas grande, aumentar los clientes, y mantener en buenas condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilber, age 27, lives in San Jorge, department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife and 4 month old son. He is in the business of making videos and taking photographs. He began his business when he completed a photography course. He works alone and does not have a fixed schedule. He has had the business for 8 years.

He wants to buy a video camera, and, in order to accomplish this purchase, he has applied for a loan. With this camera he will be able to cover more social events. In this way he will help his household to receive more income in order to pay for daily necessities. Wilber’s dream is to have a larger photography shop, add customers, and maintain good conditions for his family.

loans.use: Purchase of a video camera.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
el señor Santos M. P. tiene 48 años de edad, es soltero tiene a su cargo dos personas. Santos vive en Jicaro Galan desde hace unos 25 años, su negocio a sido siempre la venta de refrescos y agua.
actualmente tiene un pequeño deposito de refrescos donde vende al por mayor y al detalle.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cajas de refrescos al por mayor, ya se aproxima la navidad y es la epoca del año donde se venden mas refrescos.

su mayor deseo en esta ocasión es que las ventas mejoren ya que debido a la epoca muy lluviosa que a atravesado el pais las ventas han bajado.
texts.en:
Señor Santos M. P. is 48 years old, single, and is providing for two people.  He lives in Jicaro Galan and for the past 25 years he has owned a business which sells soft drinks and juices.  He has a small stand where he sells them both wholesale and retail.

The loan will be used to purchase cases of soft drinks, as they tend to sell more of these around Christmas.

At this point, his greatest desire is for his sales to increase, as they have recently gone down due to the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks in various sizes: 12 OZ, 1/2 liter, 1 liter, 1.5 liters, 2 liters, 2.5 liters and 3 liters.

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Бердиев Дилмурод проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 32 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Жена работает в колхозе. Сам Дилмурод имеет среднее образование. Уже год как занимается торговлей. Он продает в оптом рис. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Dilmurod B. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 32 years old, married, and has three children. His wife works on a collective farm.  Dilmurod has a high school.  He has been working in sales for a year.  He sells rice wholesale.  He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo M. tiene 41 años de edad, oriundo de la ciudad de Acahay,  está casado  con Sra. Felicia de 38 años de edad, tienen 2 hijos, uno en edad escolar y el otro esta cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de análisis de sistema en una universidad de la zona.   
El Sr. Hugo es comerciante se dedica en la venta de electrodoméstico hace mas de 15 años, recorre  todas las ciudades en busca de clientes. Gracias a su esfuerzo y a esta actividad pudo construirse su casa propia en el centro mismo de la ciudad en un terreno que heredó de su padre.
Cabe destacar que aprovechó la ubicación de su casa y montó una librería, el cual le genera un ingreso agregado muy importante. Este crédito solicita para aprovechar la temporada, pues, como los años lectivos han culminado puede aprovechar para conseguir lotes de mercaderías mucho mas barato.
texts.en:
Hugo M. is 41 years old.  He is originally from the city of Acahay.  He is married to 38 year-old Felicia and they have two children.  One of their children is school age and the other is in the fourth year of his Systems Analysis degree at a local university.

Hugo is a salesman who has been selling electrical appliances for more than 15 years.  He goes from town to town looking for customers.  Thanks to his hard work and his business, he has been able to build his own home in the very center of the city on a plot of land that he inherited from his father.

Hugo took advantage of the location of his home and set up a book store there which generates him a very important additional income.  He will use this loan to take advantage of the season since the school year is over and he can take advantage of this fact and acquire batches of books much more cheaply.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as exercise books, paper and writing supplies in general

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna es  una pequeña comerciante, con su propio negocio que inicio hace ocho años, primeramente inicio con poca mercadería dinero que provino de su trabajo anterior en sastrería, y ahorro que su esposo dio.

 Ahora hoy en día, con AFODENIC sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías con precios más competitivos. Ya que atreves del financiamiento pudo lograr el objetivo de captar clientes.

Con este nuevo crédito invertirá en productos de consumo en granos básicos quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, bidón de aceite, caja de jabón, cereales, golosinas, productos lácteos y cosméticos.  Lo que espera seguir aumentando su nivel de ventas para bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Reyna is a small merchant with her own business that she started eight years ago. She initially began with little merchandise and money that came from her previous job as a tailor, as well as savings that her husband gave her.

Now, with AFODENIC, her sales levels increased upon offering more varied merchandise at more competitive prices because through the loan, she was able to achieve her goal of attracting customers.

With this new loan, she will invest in groceries such as basic grains, 100-pound bags of rice, beans, sugar, corn, cans of oil, boxes of soap, cereals, sweets, dairy products, and cosmetics. What she hopes is to continue increasing her level of sales for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To invest in basic grains and cosmetics, increasing sales for higher income

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is 64 years old, married and a father of five children.

He has a long experience in the trade business so he opened his mini-market. Hamid has gained a good reputation throughout the years in his business and is well known in his area.

He requested a $2,400 loan to set up a proper window for his store and buy more inventories. He aims to expand his business by providing a larger variety of products and eventually increase his income in the long run.

loans.use: To set up a proper window for his store and buy more inventories

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene R. is from Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. Charlene owns and operates a business providing transportation services.

In 2007, Charlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Charlene is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Charlene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 56 years old, married and supports her family by operating two business ventures:  raising hogs and operating a general store. She lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. Mercedita is borrowing PHP 20,000 to fund operations. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mercedita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Funds for business operations

loans.name: Iris Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Iris Esperanza L. M. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia en el negocio de servicio de trasporte ella brinda el servicio en la zona de San Rafael del sur y Managua tiene cinco  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de Repuestos Automotrices para darle mantenimiento a sus medios de trasporte  y así   invertirle a su negocio y mejorar la condición de  su servicio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iris Esperanza L. M. is self-employed and is in the transport business. She offers trips in the area around San Rafael del Sur and Managua. She has had this business for five years. She has received five loans from CEPRODEL and each loan has been used to purchase auto parts to maintain her vehicles. These investmants in her business have been of great benefit and have allowed her to improve the quality of her family's life. 

ella

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts to repair vehicle for transportation business.

loans.name: Jazmin 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is one of our enterprising women, like the others in this group dedicated to selling miscellaneous products like: cosmetics, clothing, home use items, beauty supplies, among other. Elizabeth sells goods for daily consumption, in her little food store. Products like rice, beans, sugar, oil, bread, canned meals and many other, will be found in her little store. This loan will be used to increase her inventory. She is mother of  two children and is a married woman. 

She is a member of the Jazmin 1, 2 & 3, group which is composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs from north Santo Domingo. Elizabeth is getting her 1st loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has managed to strengthen her business and make good investments. She has had her business for around four years and she started it after she took out a loan from a neighbor who is involved in the lending activity.   She will reinvest profits into her business. Thank you for your support!

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Nubia R. C. es la propietaria de variedades Nuby, ubicado en el barrio Chiquinquirá en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias; allí vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 12 años. Esta actividad la inició Nubia con la ayuda de su marido quien le aportó un capital proveniente de su liquidación, con el fin de ayudarla a desarrollar su potencial además de generar ingresos alternativos para su hogar y teniendo en cuenta lo estacionario de su trabajo.  Esta actividad ha llenado de mucha satisfacción a Nubia porque cada día ve como crece su capital y como es de útil para responde a gastos de su familia; este es el segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; con su credikiva comprará mercancías como perfumes, artículos de cacharrerías y variedades que promocionará entre su buenos clientes teniendo en cuenta que su negocio esta ubicado en un punto de alta circulación  y esto lo hace muy estratégico para su venta. Su sueño es ampliarlo y generar utilidades para aportarlas a la adquisición de una vivienda y ayudar a terminar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Nubia R. C. is the owner of Variedades Nuby, located in the Chiquinquirá neighborhood in the city of Cartagena de Indias. She lives with her partner and two children of 11 and 12 years of age.
