Nubia began her work with her husband’s help who gave her the capital from his severance pay to help her develop her potential as well as earning extra income for their home being aware of its stability. Nubia’s work has given her a lot of satisfaction because she sees how each day her income increases and how she helps meet her families’ expenses. This is her second loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation (Kiva’s field partner) and with the loan she will buy merchandize like perfumes, items in crockery shops as well as miscellaneous items that she will promote among her good customers. Her business is located in a well trafficked area which makes it very strategic for her sales. Nubia’s dream is to expand her business and to have profits to use in acquiring a home and to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: buy merchandize like perfumes, items in crockery shops as well as miscellaneous items

loans.name: Umarali

texts.en:
Umarali is a hard-working man who has two children. His wife is a housewife. He lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He works in the market in Vahdat city. Umarali sells household goods such as perfume, sweets, drinks and etc. Umarali requested a loan of 4500 Somoni for the purchase of additional goods and to increase his working capital, which will allow him to expand his business. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy additional goods

loans.name: Tuzamurane Nº2 / Rsz Group

texts.fr: Aphrodis Ntakirutimana est agriculteur de riz, membre de groupe Tuzamurane 2, et client d’ACB depuis 2011.  Il a 38 ans, il est marie, et il a 7 enfants entre 1 mois et 16 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Aphrodis est ne au Rwanda, et il a fini 8 ans d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des matériels pour son activité d’agriculture de riz.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir une bonne récolte, et il voudrait devenir un grand agriculteur dans le secteur de Rusizi.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Aphrodis Ntakirutimana is a rice farmer and a member of the group Tuzamurane 2. He has been a client of ACB since 2011. He is 38 years old and married, and he has seven children, aged 1 month to 16 years. Three of this children go to school. Aphrodis was born in Rwanda. He has completed eight years of primary schooling. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use it to buy supplies and equipment for his work in growing rice. His strategy for business growth is to achieve a good harvest. And he would like to become a major grower in the Rusizi district. As for his family, he would like to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 19 años, vive en compañía de sus padres y en la propiedad de ellos. Desde su niñez ha trabajado en el camal (lugar donde matan los animales, entre ellos ovinos, vacuno, porcinos) apoyando de esta manera a sus padres. Con el tiempo vio una mejor opción que el tener un puesto de carnicería. Es así que vende carne, por considerarlo más rentable. De esta manera se establece su economía, actualmente cuenta con 4 toros que esta por vender su carne. Ahora su mayor prioridad es tener más animales para así subir sus ganancias. Es su primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy agradecido por la confianza depositada en su persona que le permite crecer un poco más en su negocio de la cual se siente satisfecho y comprometido en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un toro más.
texts.en: Raul is 19 years old and he lives with his parents in their house. He has worked in a slaughter house since he was a boy (location where livestock are killed, including sheep, cattle, and pigs). And this is how he helps his parents. With time he saw an opportunity to have a butcher shop. So he sells meats and he considers it to be more profitable. This has helped to establish his finances. He has 4 beef cattle and he plans on selling the meat. His greatest priority now is to have more livestock to increase his earnings. This is the first time he has acquired a loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is very thankful for the trust imparted on him. It will help him further develop his business, with which he feels satisfied. He is committed to be on time with his payments. Witt the loan that he requests he will invest in the purchase of a beef cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Agueda De Jesus

texts.es: Agueda De Jesús tiene 56 años, su actividad es la venta de leña y tiste, tiene más 13 años en su negocio. Ella tiene varios créditos con Fundación León 2000, se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad que le han brindado para salir adelante con su negocio, siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer a sus clientes un servicio muy dedicado. La necesidad de proveer a su familia ingreso ha hecho que inicia con este negocio es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de leña, tiste ya que quiere obtener algo de ganancias para pagar las cuotas y comer diariamente.
texts.en: Agueda De Jesús is 56 years old.  Her business is selling firewood and 'tiste' (a traditional drink).  She has more than 13 years experience in her business.  She has received several loans from Fundación Leon 2000 and feels very happy with the opportunity that they have given her to get ahead in her business.  Agueda has always been noted for offering her customers a very dedicated service.  She started this business because she needed to provide income for her family.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying firewood and 'tiste' since she would like to make profits with which to pay back her loan and eat every day.

loans.use: to buy firewood and 'tiste'

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years of age and a married woman. She is presently residing at Buenavista Santiago. She is grateful because she is blessed with three children and all are pretty much in their adult years. Marilyn has been engaged in a hog raising business for almost 16 years while her motorcycle transport business is now 6 years in operation. With her strong determination in life, she is able to make her business grow so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

Marilyn would like to make her business more productive; that's why she's doing her best to increase the profit she generates. She would like to take out a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase hogs to raise and feed for them. Marilyn hopes that she will be granted this loan amount to improve her businesses and uplift their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hogs to raise and feed for the hogs.

loans.name: Metaksi

texts.en: Metaksi is from the town of Artik in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with a high school education.  Metaksi has been engaged in farming her land for the past twenty years.  She considers herself a hardworking, honest person.  In addition to supporting her family Metaksi helps her relatives with agricultural products from the family farm.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  Metaksi expects this investment to increase her income by ten percent.  She is generally pleased with the services and terms of microfinance.  Metaksi would like to continue growing her business.  She has lived her whole life in Artik near family and friends and also plans to retire there.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es: Bertha Adilia tiene 55 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Actualmente tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. Ella realiza esta actividad hace 6 años, cuando empezó a vender por la razón de que ella se encontraba sin un trabajo estable y por medio de sus propios esfuerzos logro establecer el negocio, el cual está ubicado en su vivienda en donde tiene muchos clientes. Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, enlatados, sopas,  frutas y papel higiénico. Bertha desea que todos los esfuerzos ha realizado no sean en vanos y sus hijos puedan continuar con el negocio.
texts.en: Bertha Adilia, 55, has a grocery store.  She has three adult children.  She’s been in business six years.   She started selling because she did not have a steady job and through her own efforts managed to establish the business which is located in her home where she has many customers.  She is asking for the loan to buy basic grains, snacks, beverages, canned goods, soups, fruit and toilet paper.  Bertha hopes that all the effort she's expended has not been in vain and that her children will be able to carry on with the business.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, ao sul de Mocambique viuva e mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 7 a 17 anos de idade. Fez a 5ª classe e parou para ir ao lar e nunca mais conseguiu voltar a estudar. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, apenas mudou de casa quando foi ao lar. É negociante permanente ha 8 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez da mobilização feita na sua zona por agentes desta instituição, e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 23.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar MATERIAL DE CONSTRUCAO para aumentar a sua CASA.

Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio e aumentar a sua casa para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia,e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and the mother of three children with ages ranging from seven to 17-years-old.  She completed five years of schooling but stopped to spend time at home and was never able to return to her studies.  Gloria lives in her own home with her family and is not responsible for anyone else.  She never left Maputo and only changed houses when she stopped her schooling to go home.  She has been a businesswoman for eight years and has a monthly salary of 5.000 meticais (Mozambique currency) which she uses for the household expenses and saves some of in her bank account.

Gloria has never taken out loans with other banks.  She heard of Hluvuku through a mobilization movement done in her region by agents of this institution and this is her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 23,000 meticais.  She intends to use it to buy construction material to expand her merchandise.  

She dreams of expanding her business and adding on to her house to offer greater comfort to her family and to do this she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone, and other materials.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 47 years old and is married. She has three children aged 21, 18 and 13. She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with her family.

Celia is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops and raises chickens. She also has coconut trees planted on her land. Celia earns about 8,000 PHP per month doing these activities.

Celia would like to request a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Celia hopes to have a steady income that can support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem, 63 years old, is selling food and sweets. Her husband is a motorbike repairer, their income is $6 per day. She has three children, all of them are working earning a combined $10 per day for all. 

Every month, Nem spends $80 on food, $10 on electricity, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy material for repairing her house because it is now not in good condition to live. In the future, she hopes to run her current career well and be better than before. She hopes that she can make a better income to repair her house again to live in good standard.

loans.use: to buy material for repairing her house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 52-year-old widower with two children.

To earn a living, he makes and repairs shoes. He has been in this business for one year. He also sells groceries for additional income. Previously, he owned and operated a retail shop. He has been able to improve his business operations through financial support from Faulu Kenya.

He hopes to fully establish his business within five years. He has requested a loan in the amount of 9,000 KES to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Judeline

texts.en:
Judeline works hard to support her family. Judeline is married and has a fruit (banana) business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell in her stall.

Judeline has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Judeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36 years old and married. She has four children. Two are going to school, while the others are too young to attend school. She raises hogs to sell to butchers who come into their village. She usually earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for each hog sold. The minimal profit earned is just enough to cover all their expenses – especially what her children might need for daily allowances. 

Marites is now asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins to ensure good growth and proper nutrition of her hogs. In the future, she wants to enhance her hog-raising business and make it more profitable. She also wants to save enough capital to construct a convenient pigpen for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to ensure good growth and proper nutrition of hogs.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 31 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Tuyabang Alto,Oroquieta City. She has a general store and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month from her business. Julie has been a member of PMPC for five years.

Julie is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is widow with three children, of whom two are currently enrolled in school. Mupa operates a juicer and grocery business from her home. She's worked in this business for over 10 years and her primary customers are neighbors and townspeople. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mupa's other source of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be availability of chickens and her largest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mupa will use this 20,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan to purchase groceries and other inventory. Mupa aspires to expand her business operations in the future. She joined Yehu because they practice openness.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other inventory.

loans.name: Kilo

texts.en:
Kilo is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to providing the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Kilo has operated a retail shop for the past six years. In addition, she runs a vegetable grocery. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from point of purchase to her shop. She dreams of opening a cereal shop in the future. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of their fair policies.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 56 years old, a retired teacher,  widowed with three children who are adults. Jane practices rabbit keeping in the area of Mwiki, Nairobi where there is good flow of customers. She has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to use to buy rabbit pellets and building materials for rental houses. She will use the anticipated profit to construct the rental houses.

Jane hopes to have her own rental houses and also improve her rabbit keeping and keep birds that produce eggs for sale. She is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy rabbit pellets and start constructing a rental house.

loans.name: Elenn Rosario

texts.es:
La Sra. Elenn, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, con 48 años D. edad, tiene  03 hijos D. los cuales sólo la hija menor está estudiando el nivel secundario.
Como familia desD. años atrás vienen emprendiendo negocios familiares que les ayuda a salir adelante, hace 8 años decidió entrar al negocio D. venta D. productos Reno Ware hasta la actualidad, pero el negocio que viene emprendiendo y al que le dedica mayor tiempo se inició  hace un año y seis meses, cuando vió la oportunidad D. ingresar a este negocio, con un nuevo producto Gano Derma – Café DXN, del cual hace cuatro meses aperturó  una oficina D. distribución a nivel Regional en su domicilio y al verse en la necesidad D. contar con personal para el negocio, dió oportunidad a su hijo y esposo D. participar en él , demostrando D. esta manera que la familia es un buen equipo D. trabajo, para salir adelante.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00,  comprará Café DXN, para su posterior distribución a las diferentes Provincias D. la Región.
La señora Elenn es una mujer creativa y emprendedora,  su meta es continuar incrementando la cantidad distribuida D. productos  y D. esta manera seguir creciendo como empresa familiar y llegar a conocer las instalaciones D. la planta Procesadora D. Gano Derma en Malasia, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Elenn belongs to the “Virgen D. la Inmaculada” communal bank in Tarapoto District, San Martín Province and Department.  She’s 48 years old, married and has three children.  Only her youngest daughter is in secondary school.

As a family, they’ve been running family businesses for several years now that help them get ahead.  Eight years ago she decided to start selling Reno Ware products and is still doing so but the business she’s been focusing the most for the last year and a half when she got the opportunity to go into it is a new product: Gano Derma-DXN Coffee which four months ago opened a regional distribution office in her house.  Needing staff for this business, she gave her son and her husband the opportunity to participate in it thus demonstrating that the family is a good work team to get ahead.

She will use this 3000 sol loan to buy DXN Coffee to then sell in the various regional provinces.  Elenn is a very creative, enterprising woman.  Her goal is to continue to increase the amount of product sold to continue growing as a family business and eventually get to visit the Gano Derma processing plant in Malaysia.  She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing opportunities for women like her to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Dedicación

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos para carros,ella vende repuestos para llantas,parabrisas y timones,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de repuestos para carros.La socia solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para carros al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member sells repair parts, such as tires, windshields, and steering wheels, for automobiles.  She works from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm and moves her children ahead in life through this business.  She wants to expand her business and buy parts in quantity.

She is grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in quantity.

loans.name: Ramon Abel

texts.es:
Ramón, solicita otro préstamo, ya que necesita aplicar más dinero al negocio, comprando lubricantes, aceites, solución de frenos, cables de bujillas, entre otros productos que son muy necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes.
Él ha mejorado su condición y en estos meses fue papá, ya que su esposa dio  a luz, por lo que su vida esta mejorando.
texts.en:
Ramón is asking for another loan. He needs to apply more money to the business, buying lubricant, oils, break fluid, spark plug cables, among other products that are necessary to offer to customers.

He has improved his situation and in these months he became a new dad, as his wife gave birth, and so his life is getting better.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, oils, break fluid, spark plug cablesCompra lubricantes, aceites, solución de frenos, cables de bujillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the purchase of food (such as rice, sugar, noodles, and wheat), and products (such as Christmas pastries, milk, and chocolate for Christmas parties).

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga  de 69 años de edad  tiene 2 hijos y es una mujer dedicada a la preparación y venta de dulces en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Las principales líneas de productos son los dulces de coco y de ajonjolí, el cual inició desde la década del 60 con su esposo quien dejó la fámula a Olga y a su hijo. Para luego en el año 1990  dar nacimiento a su microempresa que lleva su propio nombre atendiendo un mercado diferente al de su esposo, en el que se ha posicionado en la ciudad. Su negocio tiene un gran potencial de crecimiento y su mercado también creciente le plantea permanentemente la necesidad de aplicarle capital de trabajo, por eso está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donde ha recibido 9 financiamientos que le han permitido aumentar su bienestar , donde se ha capacitado,  porque ella es una muy participativa de los programas de esta organización; con su credikiva, décimo crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará materia prima como panela, azúcar, con el fin de aumentar su producción en la época de mayor demanda del año, las navidades y el recibimiento del nuevo año. Su mayor desafío es tener una máquina especializada que le permita tecnificar sus procesos y a futuro se prepara para adquirirla.
texts.en: Olga, 69, is a mother of two that makes and sells sweets in the city of Barranquilla. Her main product lines are coconut and sesame seed sweets, which she started back in the 1960s with her husband, who later left the factory to Olga and their son. Later in 1990 she formed her microenterprise and gave it her own name. Her microenterprise serves a different market than her husband's and is well positioned in the city. Her business has a great growth potential and there is also a growing market. Both factors continuously create the need to inject working capital to her business. That is why she works with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, where she has so far received 9 credits that have allowed her to expand her well-being. She has also been trained and likes to participate in the institution's programs. With her credikiva, the 10th loan she will obtain from this institution, she will purchase supplies such as compacted molasses (panela) and sugar, which will help her expand her production during the highest demand season, i.e., Christmas and New Year. Her greatest challenge is to have specialized equipment in order to have a more automatized production  and she is getting ready to purchase it in the future.

loans.use: purchasing supplies such as sugar and molasses

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado San Roque es de la ciudad de Concepción, cuenta con diez y siete integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña activada a la cual se dedique por mas pequeña que sea  las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias.
Mercedes en una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y nos comenta que al principio empezó desde muy abajo, es decir, solo hacia ventas pequeñas, pero después fue creciendo y ahora ya tiene una clientela bien definida. Su meta es seguir trabajando de la misma forma en lo ha estado haciendo para poder seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, como ser bermudas, camisillas, vestidos, soleritas y demás prendas, con las cuales podrá surtirse.
texts.en:
The San Roque committee has seventeen members in the city of Concepción and all have a small business.  Despite being small businesses the women are very excited about them and help each other.  They are persevering and inspire the others to continue struggling for their families.

Mercedes is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who sells clothing.  She tells us that she started very small with only a few sales but then it began growing and now she has a good customer base.  Her goal is to continue working in the same way that she has been doing to be able to continue expanding.
She requests a loan to supply her business with summer clothing such as Bermuda shorts, shirts, dresses, skirts, and other clothing.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to sell later

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 30 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda.  A married mother of two children, both of whom are currently in school, Gladys has been working hard for the past two years to manage her business, which sells charcoal and raw food.

To help expand her enterprise, Gladys has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to acquire more sacks of charcoal and raw food to sell. This will help her to generate greater profits and increase her patronage. She hopes in the future to develop a cattle farm that will supply milk to the whole town. 

Gladys is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential goods to sell

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: In the frontier village Khashtarak village of Tavush region lives Gevorg with his wife and three years old daughter, who attends kinder garden. Gevorg now is contractual serviceman and also takes care of his farm and wine-yard. Gevorgs in his farm has a cow, pigs and also 100 chickens. He sells meat (pork and poultry) and a lot of eggs. His garden’s grape is of the best sort and of the highest quality and he profitable sells it to wine making factories. With coming of New Year’s holidays it is especially profitable the sale of pork and with this aim Gevorg asks a loan of 400.000 Armenian drams in order to buy several piglets and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Abidé

texts.en:
Abidé S., about 50 years old, is married and the mother of four children. She employs two children as domestic help. Having retired two years ago, she started a business preparing and selling «tchoukoutou», a local beer made from sorghum. Her husband is also retired and has no income aside from his pension. Income is a real problem for the family. Thanks to this business selling tchoukoutou, the family is arduously managing to make ends meet. Mrs. S. provides a level of quality that has won her a large customer base. She realizes that increasing her production will improve her income very much. For this reason, she is requesting financial support in the amount of $900 as capital to buy and stock sorghum, as well as some firewood, for the purposes of preparing tchoukoutou in sizeable quantities. Her business is named «Cabaret de la Joie».

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 50 ans environ, Madame S. Abidé est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle emploie deux enfants comme domestique. Admise à la retraite il y a 2 ans, elle s’est lancée dans la préparation et la vente de « Tchoukoutou », une boisson locale préparée à base de sorgho. Son mari aussi admis à la retraite n’a aucun revenu à part sa pension. Il se pose alors un réel problème de revenu pour la famille. Grâce à cette activité de vente de « Tchoukoutou », la famille arrive à s’en sortir péniblement. La qualité du service qu’elle offre lui procure une clientèle importante. Mme S. se rend compte que l’augmentation de sa production améliorera pour beaucoup son revenu. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un appui financier d’un montant de $900 qui va servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et le stockage du sorgho, du bois de chauffe en vue de la préparation en quantité du « tchoukoutchou ».

loans.use: To buy and stock sorghum

loans.name: German

texts.en:
Mr. Lopez is a married father of four, and two of his children work for him at his carpentry shop. The loan will be used to buy tools like hammers, electric saws, etc. that will allow him to complete clients' orders faster and at a higher quality. Another part he plans to invest on reparing his workshop and enlarging it a little, which will allow him to hire another assistant. This is important because it would generate a source of employment in a country where the unemployment rate is very high.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. L. es casado y padre de 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales laboran con el en su taller de carpintería, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas (Martillo, sierras eléctricas, etc.) que le permitirán entregar los pedidos de los clientes en menos tiempo y a la vez con una mayor calidad. Otra parte del crédito la piensa invertir en el acondicionamiento de su taller, piensa agrandarlo un poco y contratar los servicios de otro ayudante, lo cual es muy importante ya que generaría una fuente de empleo en un país donde el índice de desempleo es muy alto.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy tools (hammer, electric saws, etc.) that will permit Mr. Lopez to complete clients' orders faster and at a higher quality at his workshop.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai is 52. Her husband, a wounded soldier who cannot work as a laborer, is 56 years old. They have a son and a daughter aged 18 and 25, who left school to help with the family farming. They have 0.6 hectares of land for growing rice but their income from rice crops isn’t enough for them to support themselves due to poor soil and spreading insects. Mrs. Hai focuses on running a grocery store to improve the family income. Their income is $10 per person/month. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to operate her grocery store. Mrs. Hai will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To operate the grocery store.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Mr. Pedro C. is 74 years old, is married and has 3 children, all grown. The oldest works at Camping 44, a weapons retailer store. The other two work together selling pharmaceuticals. His wife, Leónida Rosa, works with him and they both are in the trade of “carbon” (a kind of charcoal, frequently used as cooking fuel because it is cheaper than natural gas). They employ one other person in their work place as well as have one of their nieces helps them out too.

Mr. C. has been in the trade for almost 29 years now. They both work from their residence and, as a matter of fact, they built their residence with their job in mind. That is, their yard is built in such a way to make the work easier and to accommodate the tools necessary for his job.

They started off with very little, with 500 kg of charcoal, and they grew to such a point that now they are handling over 6000 kg of charcoal weekly. They have a regular set of customers who come to their workplace to pick up the charcoal. They deliver as well with the help of a vehicle which they were able to purchase with help of previous loans. They are the ones who supply charcoal to most convenience stores in the city.

They require the loan to restock themselves with more charcoal because they were confronting difficulties lately due to the fact that there was a charcoal shortage. Charcoal is really sought good during winter, the current season, because of its use as a fuel for fire as well as for cooking. Due to the lack of charcoal during this season, they were forced to reduce their price to be more appealing to the customers and to be able to fight off the competition.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina is a 27 year old mother of two children aged 8 and 3. She sells clothes on credit and some fabrics. She always goes around door to door to get customers, and collects the payments at the end of each month. She can earn $16 - $17 per week. Her husband is a driver in Jakarta and sends his wife some of his earnings, once a week. Nina is a member of MBK and asks for a $100 loan to expand her business, and earn more income for her children's education. She willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua owns a cloth stall in the central Kumasi market. She inherited the shop after working there for 10 years. Her first year of ownership was difficult as she had no capital to expand the shop. So Akua decided to use her extra time selling food on the streets. With the extra money she earned, the shop slowly expanded. Now, 5 years later, she carries not only cotton cloth, but also blankets, towels, and polyester cloth.

Akua needs a loan to expand her shop even more by selling “lace cloth”. Lace cloth is very popular for making the elegant Ghanaian dresses (called “kaba and sliht” in Twi) that women wear for formal occasions. Akua believes a wider variety of cloth will attract more customers. This will also increase business for the seamstresses in the market.

Back at home, she hopes her son will graduate from high school this year. If he does, she will use the extra income to help send him to university

(*Photo Note: Ekua is on the left wearing "kaba and sliht.")

loans.use: To expand her shop by purchasing 30 pieces of lace cloth and polyester cloth

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret O. is a 49-year-old entrepreneur and mother of six school-aged children.  
She lives with her husband in Kisumu, Kenya.  She began her current business of selling second-hand clothes in the year 2000.  She specializes in selling women's dresses, mosquito nets, towels, men’s shirts, casual wear and bed sheets.  She periodically travels to Nairobi, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices.  The prime location of her business on a busy street, her many years in business and her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good client base.  Margaret plans to expand her business with her next loan of US $800.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ni Wayan Suarmi

texts.id:
Eventhough Ni Wayan Suarmi husband, I Ketut Suada, is a public servant; she determines to help her husband by opening a kiosk in front of her house. She sells almost all daily groceries in her kiosk. Besides running the kiosk, she also raises pigs at her backyard. Started with Rp. 1 million she bought 4 piggies for fattening which now only left one pig after selling the other three. Suarmi feeds her pigs with paddy shell and oat/wheat powder, and banana leaf and trunk. After 4 months, her pigs are ready for sale with profit Rp. 200,000 each. The money is used for her family daily expenses. She plans to buy piggy and breeder as well.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada, Kiva Volunteer

Walaupun sebagai istri seorang Pegawai Negeri, Ni Wayan Suarmi tetap ingin membantu suaminya, I Ketut Suada. Suarmi membuka usaha warung didepan rumahnya. Segala kebutuhan sehari-hari ada di warungnya. Disamping usaha warung Suarmi juga memelihara babi dibelakang rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Suarmi membeli 4 ekor bibit babi dan dipelihara sebagai penggemukan. Sekarang babinya sudah dijual dan tinggal 1 ekor babi penggemukan. Disamping memberi dedak padi dan dedak gandum, Suarmi juga memberikan daun-daunan seperti daun pisang , daun talas, dan batang pisang. Setelah dipelihara 4 bulan babinya siap dijual. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.200.00,- per ekor. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya. Suarmi berencana membeli bibit babi lagi dan juga induk

loans.use: To buy piggy and breeder

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosalina G. is a very enterprising person. For four years she has earned her living preparing and selling delicious tortillas in her home in the city of León - in the village of El Sauce, to be exact. It's important to stress that Rosalina is a widowed mother of 2 children. She carries full responsibility for offering them an education since she fulfills the role of both father and mother in her household.

SInce she started her business preparing and selling tortillas she has been investing in the education of her children, supporting them in their needs and providing them with a decent home in which to live.

Rosalina has been receiving loans from Ceprodel for a year. The loans have been of tremendous benefit, since she has purchased her raw material (firewood and corn) with which to prepare delicious tortillas in the village of El Sauce in León.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosalina G. es una persona muy esforzada, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas tortillas en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de León específicamente en el pueblo El Sauce. Es importante recalcar que la señora Rosalina es madre viuda y con 2 hijos de los cuales tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles educación ya que hace el papel de padre y madre en su hogar.

Desde que inició el negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas ha venido invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos apoyándolos en sus necesidades y brindándoles un techo digno donde vivir.

Desde hace un año, ha realizado prestamos en Ceprodel los cuales le han beneficiado grandemente por el hecho de que ha adquirido su materia prima (leña y maíz) para la elaboración de las deliciosas tortillas en el pueblo de El Sauce en León.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
B. Farhod is 37 years old. He is married with three children. Farhod runs a farm. On the part of his plot, he is grows onion and maize. Farhod is an experienced farmer; he has worked the land for the last 10 years. The business is stable and generates his main income. 

However, this business requires lots of effort and supplies. So, now Farhod needs to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel. He also needs funds to pay the salaries of seasonal workers. That is why Farhod is requesting 2000.00 Somoni ($600.00 USD) for the term of 7 months. Farhod thanks all for supporting him, and throughout the term of this, his first loan, he promises to be accurate when paying the loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and fuel, and to pay the salaries of seasonal workers.

loans.name: Ceneida

texts.es:
Ceneida is a woman who arduously pushes her business daily so that it can progress. She is a mother of 3 children ages 11, 8, and 5. She, alongside her husband, is in charge of supporting her children and covering the household expenses.

She has been running her general store for 4 years, and at present, she sells practically everything. She and her husband previously used to sell clothing at a stand in a market, where they managed to establish their business, which operated for 8 years. Nevertheless, she felt the need to be closer to her children, who were still young at that time. For this reason, she decided to hand the clothing store over to her sister-in-law. While her husband went to work outside of Lima, she decided to open a general store in her home.

Lately, Ceneida has been planning to return to clothing sales, since she now has the help of a niece who would be in charge of minding her general store. This time, however, she would like to sell clothing door-to-door because she claims that it is more amusing this way.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ceneida es una mujer que, con arduo esfuerzo, empuja a diario su negocio para que avance hacia adelante. Ella es madre de tres niños quienes tienen 11, 8 y 5 años. Junto a su esposo, se encarga de mantener a sus hijos y los gastos de la casa.

Hace cuatro años que trabaja en su bodega y, hoy en día, vende prácticamente, de todo. Anteriormente a este trabajo, ella y su esposo se dedicaban a vender ropa en un puesto dentro de un mercado, donde lograron establecerse y en el cual paso ocho años. Sin embargo, ella sintió necesario estar mas cerca de sus hijos que en esa época estaban muy pequeños aun. Es por ello que decidió darle a su cuñada la tienda de ropa y mientras que su esposo se fue a trabajar fuera de Lima ella se animó a abrir una bodega en su casa.

Últimamente, Ceneida planea volver al negocio de venta de ropa, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de una sobrina quien se encargaría de atender su bodega. Pero esta vez vendería ropa por reparto, ofreciéndolas casa por casa; ella dice que es mas divertido hacerlo de este modo.

loans.use: Invest in a new clothing business

loans.name: Komi Gaston

texts.fr:
Mr. Komi Gaston A. was born on 31 December 1982 in Tékponou in the prefecture of VO. He is married and has two (2) children. In 2000, he started a business buying and selling shoes in the Hédzranawoé market. He buys from his suppliers who are at the Port. The business of selling shoes is flourishing for Mr. A., and he would like to increase his stock by buying fifty (50) pairs of shoes with this loan, his first.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Komi Gaston est né le 31 décembre 1982 à Tékponou dans la préfecture de VO. Il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. En 2000, il a mis sur pieds, une activité d'achat et de vente de chaussures dans le marché de Hédzranawoé. Il achète auprès de ses fournisseurs qui sont au Port autonome. La vente de chaussures devient de plus en plus florissante pour Monsieur A. et il désire augmenter son stock par l'achat de cinquante (50) paires de chaussures avec son premier crédit qu’il sollicite

loans.use: To buy and sell shoes

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es:
Nilton is a young entrepreneur who, day after day, performs his work with excellence in an agricultural project near his home. After three years of academic preparation he now applies his knowledge to the agricultural project as well as to his own cultivated land. He wishes to support his communal land with an agricultural consultant's office where he can work daily to achieve success. He yearns to improve their harvests with his technical knowledge and is asking for a loan to achieve each of his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Nilton, es un joven emprendedor que día a día ejerce su profesión con calidad en un proyecto agrícola cercano a su localidad y es así que después de 3 años de preparación académica hoy aplica estos conocimientos en su trabajo y en sus propias tierras de cultivo con el deseo de apoyar a su propia comunidad con asesoría agrícola es así que el diariamente trabaja para lograr éxito, su anhelo es mejorar sus cosechas con sus conocimientos técnicos y solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo cada uno de sus planes.

loans.use: Capital to improve harvests on communal land

loans.name: Daniela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Daniela del Carmen is a woman who, at 37, feels satisfied with her life. She's finished her education and now earns a living teaching school, something for which she feels great love and to which she's dedicated because it's thrillling for her to pass along knowledge to her students.

Daniela is married and has a 12-year old son. Her husband works as a manager of a bodega and helps her with family expenses. She lives in the Ticuantepe neighborhood where she has a small house which she's improving so that it's more habitable for her son. She will use the loan to extend a bedroom and replace the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Daniela del Carmen es una mujer que a sus 37 años se siente satisfecha con su vida, ha podido terminar sus estudios y ahora se dedica a la profesión de la docencia, la cual dice que ejerce con mucho amor y dedicación ya que le encanta poder llevar un poco de conocimiento a sus alumnos.

Daniela es casada, y tiene un hijo de 12 años. Su esposo trabaja como Responsable de Bodega, y apoya a su esposa con los gastos de la familia. Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, y es ahí donde ella tiene su pequeña casa de habitación a la cual les está haciendo mejoras para poder darles mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, el préstamo lo usará para ampliar un cuarto de habitación y cambiar techo.

loans.use: Ampliar cuarto de habitación y cambio de techo

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana is a member of the Comunal Azucenas Bank.

Sebastiana is married, 48 years-old and has 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Santa Elena and sells vegetables wholesale and also by means of a moving cart which she uses to do business in the market in the city of Ayacucho. She buys the vegetables directly from the producers. In addition, Sebastiana has a grain mill in her home where she offers milling services. She buys cereals from the fair of the Americas and processes the flour which is later sold in the markets in Ayacucho city.

Sebastiana needs a loan of 1500 soles (approximately 525 US dollars) to invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, corn, and other grains.

Sebastiana dreams of being able to produce more products, to make further progress with her business, and to be able to provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Sebastiana es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Sebastiana es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Sebastiana vive en el barrio de Santa Elena y vende verduras al por mayor y menor de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, las verduras los compra de los productores. Además Sebastiana tiene un molino de granos en su casa donde brinda servicios de molienda. También compra cereales de la feria las Américas y luego lo procesa en harina que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Sebastiana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, quinua, cebada, maíz.

Los sueños de Sebastián son ampliar sus negocios, que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y producir más productos.

loans.use: Sebastiana needs a loan of 1500 soles (approximately 525 US dollars) to invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, corn, and other grains.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 33-year-old mother of two school-going children.  She lives in Likoni Mombasa, Kenya. She is the proprietor of a food kiosk which she initiated in 2007. The business is situated along the busy street off to Likoni ferry. She serves over 200 customers a day and makes Kshs 3000 in daily income. She requires US$ 500 to enable her to move to a more spacious location.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam P., 52, is one of the vendors who sells many kinds of vegetables, fish, and grocery items in her village. She lives with three of her children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. She has been selling since 2007 to earn a living and is able to make around US$1 of profit each day. Before 2007, she worked with her husband growing rice but she changed to her business to help double the family income. Her husband, Chhet Bou, 55, still works on his rice field and normally he makes less than US$1 each day. He said planting rice is just to support the family members.

Normally, people in the village grow rice two times each year. In the dry season, they grow a kind of rice that bears during 3-4 months and in the rainy season, they grow another kind of rice that can bear during 6-7 months. But both seasons the farmers need enough water or the crop will be damaged. Rice plants are easily spoilt if there is too much or too little water.

Soam Pun is requesting a loan of US$625 to purchase a motorbike to transport her vegetables and grocery items to sell in the village.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Nyikira Kikajjo Group

texts.en: Halima N. is a proud member of the Nyikira group and has a tailoring business in Namasuba. She has been in this business for five years now, making ladies' and children's clothes of all kinds for a fee. She buys the materials and people come in to book, buy so that their orders are made to their satisfaction. She needs a loan to help her buy more clothing materials, threads and scissors for her business, since the profits she gets help her to repay back her loans as well as to cater for her four children plus pay their school fees. She has a dream of one day owning more sewing machines to expand her business, as well as starting a tailoring school.

loans.use: Halima Nakawooya will buy clothing materials, threads and scissors.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is a new member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Antique Southwest Branch. She has had a very difficult life, growing up without enough food to eat.  She was forced to help her parents at a young age. Instead of playing with other children, she worked very hard under the sun to earn income for her family's food. She attended school only up to Grade 2.  Because of her many absences and insufficient school materials, she stopped studying and cannot read or write.  As an adult, she has worked as a housemaid.

She and her husband are blessed with a baby girl. They live in a very small dilapidated “nipa hut”.  At first, her husband didn't want to join ASHI because they were afraid of the weekly responsibility, but the development officer convinced them to join. Teresita found the training very difficult because of her illiteracy, but she was very happy when the staff taught her to write her signature. 

Presently, she is very proud to be an ASHI member.  She hopes that the institution can help her achieve her greatest dream:  to send her daughter to school through college and to establish a habitable house. She aspires to have a loan of Php 5,000.00 (USD $125) to finance their boat, which will be used by her husband in fishing.

loans.use: To finance a fishing boat

loans.name: Karolina

texts.es: Karolina, casada,  de 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 3 años, solicita su 2do credito para realizarle mejoras a un pequeño cuarto que construyó en un terreno que le dio la Alcaldia. Ella trabaja como domestica, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como lavador de vehiculos en un taller de autolavado. Karolina y su esposo han ido ahorrando y ya tienen comprado algunos materiales para la mejora que va a realizar, como es el techo de su humilde vivienda. El mayor de Karolina es poder construir poco a poco su vivienda con las condiciones necesarias para su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Karolina is married, 23 years old, and has a three year old son. She is seeking her 2nd loan in order to make improvements to a small room that she built on a plot of land the village gave her. She works as a domestic employee, and depends on the support of her husband who works as a washer in a car wash. Karolina and her husband have been saving and now they have bought some materials to make the improvements, such as the roof of their humble home. Karolina’s primary goal is to be able to, little by little, construct their home in order to provide adequate shelter for their small son.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Kouy

texts.en: Mrs. Kouy M. lives in Prey Ta Loem village in Kampong Speu village in Kampong Speu province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Bou Sophea, is an assistant village chief who earns a small salary to support the family. Even though they try to work hard, they still do not have much money to provide a better life for their family. Thus, Mrs. Kouy M. is requesting a loan to buy rice. She is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice so her family has sufficient rice to eat

loans.name: Afusat

texts.en: Afusat I. is 29 years old and single. She sells clothes, bags and shoes. She started this business in 2005. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan B. was born in 1961 and she now lives in Tadock Pong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a widow with a child who sells bread in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so Mrs. Phan B. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy motorbike for her child to transport bread to sell door-to-door. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Faasaveve

texts.en: Faasaveve T., 35, is married with 5 children.  She has many years of experience in the design and making of traditional baskets,  bracelets and lava-lava. She sells to the villagers and public 5 days a week. She has 2 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Faasaveve’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to buy carving equipment, paints, elei board and other material for her business.

loans.use: Buy varnish, paints, elei board and carving equipment used in making handicrafts.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur S. is twenty-eight years old and a trader who sells different kinds of products in the local bazaar. He sells home products, women's and children's clothing, sweets, beverages and other goods. He has three years of experience in this field. Originally, Elnur was an accountant, but it was very hard to provide for his wife and two children on the salary he was receiving, so he decided to start his own business. His knowledge of accounting helps him in the success of his current business and will make him successful in the future. Elnur applied for a $1200 loan to increase the amount of goods he sells, especially in the clothing line, because these products are in high demand.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
MARGARITA A. D. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS”, tiene 58 años D. edad, 6 hijos, y su pareja es pensionista (venta D. alimentos).

La señora Margarita se dedica a la venta D. pasamanería.  Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró productos para abastecer su negocio.

Actualmente el negocio ha mejorado, tiene más productos que ofrecer a su clientela.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa invertirlo en la  ampliación D. su local y en la compara D. 1 docena D. hilos, 1 paquete D. cintas para decoración, etc.

“Doy gracias a Manuela Ramos por confiar en nosotras que no podemos acceder a otros prestamos y sobre todo nos anima a seguir adelante pese a las diferentes dificultades que pasamos”.
texts.en:
Margarita A. D. L. belongs to the “Mujeres Shipibas” community bank. She is 58 and has 6 children. Her partner receives a pension (food sales). Margarita sells ornamental trimmings. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought products to stock her business. The business has improved. She has more products to offer her customers. With this loan of 3,000 PEN she plans to invest in expanding her location, buying a dozen threads, a package of ribbons for decoration, etc. “I am thankful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence in those of us who do not have access to other loans. Above all, Manuela Ramos encourages us to keep going forward in spite of the different difficulties we have.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business location.  Buy threads and ribbons for decoration.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort E. is forty-four years old. She is married with five children; three are currently in school. She lives with her family at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells "banku" with fried fish. "Banku" is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

Comfort has many customers since that dish is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to pay for her children’s education. She has been in business for two years now and she belongs to the village bank called ‘Power and might’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Anelyn S. M., 31 years old, is a resident of Labo, Ozamiz City. She is married and blessed with two children, both of whom are still minor dependents. Her husband is a heavy equipment operator and a cocoland laborer (harvester). Because of the economic crisis they have encountered, she decided to engage in business herself. She registered herself as a dealer of JTY Products, a direct selling company with main products of ready-to-wear clothes, home decor items, and home accessories. She has skills for this kind of business because she has had experience in direct selling since the age of 16. Her business is stable.

As a new member of PAGLAUM MPC, she is applying to us for a loan in the amount of P20,000.00 under the regular loan program to add to her capital from her direct selling business, and the remaining amount will be used for full payment of a lot they acquired.

Her future plan is to provide a better future for her family through her continuing support. She believes that this dream in life will have fulfillment someday through the help of PMPC and Kiva.

loans.use: Additional capital for her direct selling business as well as for full payment of a newly acquired lot

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
A good future for their two children is Estelita L. and her husband’s main goal in life. They are very used to laboring hard to reach their dream. That is why the couple is trying to elevate their living through a venture in rice farming. They are able to manage their small business very well and they credit this to God and their years of experience as full-time farmers. 

Estelita is an active member of the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She is asking for a Php 15,000 loan that will greatly help in the expansion of their business.

Since the day she joined CEVI, Estelita has benefited a lot from the institution. One of the best things she learned from their group devotional is the power of faith. There is no such thing as “impossible” to a person who believes. Thus, paired with hard work and faith, Estelita is very hopeful that her family’s goal is at hand.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia C. is from the village of Purok 9B Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Gaudencia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gaudencia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling barbecue or grilled chicken and pork meat in the local community. Gaudencia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos (about $21 US) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gaudencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gaudencia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gaudencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Уктам

texts.ru: Уктам 1958 года рождения, женат имеет пятерых детей. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Так же Уктам работает на вода-насосной станции Сумчака. Жена помогает ему ухаживать со скотом. После откормки скот продается на скотном рынке. Уктам кредитуется в нашей организации более 3 года. Он успешно закончил предыдущих займов и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Он планирует увеличить количество поголовье своего скота и тем самым увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ему очень нравятся условия нашего кредитования и он рад, что есть такие организации поддерживающие общество.

loans.use: на закупку несколько голов крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience G. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high.

Patience sells a variety of provision in Hohoe, which she has done since 2004. She uses her income in helping her husband to pay the housekeeping expenses.

Patience will use the loan to purchase more of the provisions and other food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en: Asenati M. (0) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Matautu-Lefaga. She is married and has one school-aged child. Asenati owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 330 WST a month. In 2009, Asenati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 35 year old father of two who operates his butcher shop in Nairobi. He has been in this business for the last ten years after previous employment in a quarry. He desires to diversify into water vending and thus he is requesting a first loan of Kes. 50,000 to enable him acquire two hand carts to transport water. He hopes to become a meat distributor, own rental units and educate his children to the highest levels. He describes himself as focussed, hardworking and determined.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy two hand carts

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is thirty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children and in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Martha is a trader. She trades in maize. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Martha also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: K. Sarah is a business lady managing two businesses: a poultry business and a business selling fruits and vegetables in the city centre in Kampala. She is a hardworking devoted married lady with ten children and six dependants. Sarah has been operating the businesses for a very long time, except the fruit selling business which is the most recent one. She is grateful for her loans because she has been able to educate all her children through university and most of them are now bank managers and accountants. Sarah needs a loan to buy more feed and chicks for farm expansion, as well as to buy more fruit for resale. Sarah is the leader of her lending group in Nansana.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feed and chicks for farm expansion

loans.name: Gilda Arlindo

texts.pt:
Gilda Arlindo B., nasceu em Mangunze, distrito de Manjacaze, província de Gaza, tem 38 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 02 filhos com 18 e 13 anos de idade, a ultima vai a escola. Fez a 7ªclasse, parou de estudar por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria na cidade de Maputo e para alem dos filhos sustenta também um neto que vive com ela.

Em 1998 saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo com seu marido a procura de emprego, primeiramente viviam numa casa arrendada e pouco tempo depois construíram a própria residência onde vivem ate hoje. É comerciante há 03 anos faz 12 horas diárias e não tem empregado. Aprendeu o negócio com o pai ainda jovem, que também faz a mesma actividade. Vende mais os produtos de 1ª necessidade e tem um rendimento de 500.00mt por dia, consegue poupar 50.00mt diários através de sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique).

Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua Vizinha. Este é o 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mais produtos (arroz, farinha, óleo de cozinha e outros) para satisfazer ainda mais a sua clientela.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais empréstimos no futuro e evoluir ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Gilda Arlindo B. was born in Mangunze, Majacaze District, Mozambique. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of two children ages 18 and 13, the younger one goes to school. She finished 7th grade but had to drop it because of her parent's financial difficulties. She lives at her own house and besides her children she also supports a grandson that lives with them. In 1998 she left Manjacaze with her husband to look for work in Maputo. They lived at a rented house at first, and later on they built their own house where they live to this day. She's been a saleswoman for the past 3 years, works 12 hours days and has no employees. She learned the business with her father who also did that for a living. She sells first necessity products and makes around 500.00MT per day. She's able to save 50.00MT per day. She's never had loans with other institutions and heard of Hluvuku from a neighbor. This is her first loan in the amount of 15.000,00MT (U$525) which she'll use to buy more food products (rice, flour, cooking oil and others) to satisfy the demand and attract more customers. She's committed to pay the loan back on time so she can make other loans in the future and improve her business even more.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products for reselling

loans.name: Hofiadé A. Rosine

texts.fr: T. Hofiadé A. Rosine est née le 21 Mars 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rosine vit depuis 30 ans à Ayélawadjè à Cotonou. Mariée à ZOUMENOU Gilbert, Rosine est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Rosine supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Rosine vend depuis près de 12 ans des mèches et des produits pour cheveux. C'est une coiffeuse qui a son atelier à Ayélawadjè. Rosine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Rosine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. C'est dans l'optique d'augmenter ses produits et de satisfaire plus la demande de la clientèle que Rosine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
T. Hofiadé A. Rosine was born on March 21, 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For 30 years, she has been living in Ayélawadjè in Cotonou. Married to ZOUMENOU Gilbert, she is the mother of two children who are both in school. Rosine along with her husband supports the family. Rosine has sold hair extensions and hair products for nearly 12 years. She is a hairdresser who has her own salon in Ayélawadjè. She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who has already obtained three loans, which were repaid. With regard to augmenting her merchandise and satisfying customer demand further, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair products and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Komisa

texts.en:
Komisa J. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste in a market and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and maize flour to sell. Komisa is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase beans and maize flour

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: Mr. Huon S. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is an ice cream seller. Since his business is doing well, he needs some more money to buy a motorbike to transport the ice cream to sell. He hopes to increase his income and improve his business with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Chet Rith, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Huon S. is 29 years old and the father of two children who are just 5 and 3 years old. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Lormel

texts.en:
Lormel E. is from the village of PANDUMA, TUKURAN ZAMBOANGA DEL SUR. She is 33 years old. Lormel is married and has 4 school-aged children. Lormel owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling coffee (sachet), sugar, salt, candies, shampoo and canned goods in the local community. Lormel has been involved in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Lormel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lormel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lormel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita R. D., 55, is making sure that her children have enough provisions for their daily needs. Now living as a single mother, she was married to Melonio D. until he passed away, leaving Melita with their three children. In order for her family to survive, Melita has been managing her own parlor business for ten years.

Melita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy equipment and haircare products for her parlor business.

Now, with your help, Melita would like to obtain a PHP 30,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying assorted haircare and grooming products for her parlor business.

Aside from good family relationships, Melita dreams of a better life for her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy assorted haircare and grooming products for her parlor business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah M. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married and has one infant child. To make a living, Leah owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling daily use products such as candies, snack food, sugar, salt, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Leah has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan Leah has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Diénabou Messin

texts.fr: Diénabou Messin S. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 6 ans et demi et a eu à y recevoir 13 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement.
