Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme, elle achète sa marchandise en grande quantité pour revendre au détaille dans son quartier et au marchés hebdomadaires. Ses bénéfices lui permettent d'assurer la dépense quotidienne de la famille, de prendre en charge ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Diénabou Messin S. is a 34-year-old divorced woman who lives with and takes care of her 3 children. She has been a member of the community bank of Vélingara Foulbé for the past 6 and a half years, and she received 13 loans that she managed well and reimbursed properly. Diénabou is a seller of palm oil. She purchases her merchandise in large quantities to resell it afterward in her neighborhood and in the weekly markets. Her profits allow her to take care of her family's daily expenses, of the needs of her children, as well as of her own.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidée J. O. tiene 53 años y vive en el barrio Carrizal de Barranquilla, descrito por Aidé como un barrio muy alegre donde en cada esquina, es escuchada la música con ritmos champetas a través de enormes y resonantes  cajas de maderas llamados pickup, que al ser escuchadas en esta zona,   hace que niños y adultos se muevan al son de la música.  
Aidé vive con su esposo y tiene 9 hijos entre los 25 y 39 años;  se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y algunas veces vende mercancía,  negocio  en el que  quiere incursionar  gradualmente, cambiando poco a poco  su actividad de vender almuerzos y es justamente su gran desafío; esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un crédito por valor de $1.000.000 para comprar sabanas toallas, vestidos  para niños  ropa y calzado.
Inició su negocio con la ayuda de un amigo que tenía la experiencia de comprar mercancía en el  departamento de la Guajira   con muy  buena acogida de sus clientes, pero luego  Aidé  realizó sus propios viajes, comprando electrodomésticos, ropas, toallas, con buenos resultados.  Ella aún recuerda, cuando llegó de 9 años a Barranquilla desde Arenal, en el departamento de  Bolívar   y no pudo  terminar sus estudios de bachiller por muchas dificultades, por eso se dedicó a la venta de mercancías  y posteriormente a la venta de almuerzos  entre los vecinos de su barrio  y de     sectores aledaños a su negocio. En la actualidad los hijos la apoyan, este es precisamente uno de sus logros: el  haberlos sacado adelante, porque han realizado carreras técnicas y ahora son su gran soporte.
Para Aidé tener un negocio  ha sido su mejor empleo, este es su segundo créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la acogió, cuando en otras había sido rechazada porque su edad no se ajustaba a los parámetros establecidos por esas empresas;   su negocio ha progresado pero sueña con ser exitosa en la venta de mercancías, actividad que conoce por su propia experiencia.
texts.en:
Aidée J. O. is 53 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Carrizal in Barranquilla. She describes her neighborhood as being cheerful on every corner. One can hear the music containing rhythms of “champeta” that resonate from wooden boxes called “pickup” throughout the area. Children and adults can’t help but move to the sound of the music.

Aidée lives with her husband and has nine children between the ages of 25 and 39. She sells lunches and occasionally merchandise. She wants to gradually transition into her second business and is trying to make changes gradually away from selling lunches, but this process has been a great challenge. For this reason, she is applying for a loan worth 1,000,000 COP to purchase bed sheets, towels, children’s clothing, and shoes.

Aidée started her business with the help of a friend who has experience in buying merchandise from the Department of Guajira. These products were well-received by her customers, but later Aidée started traveling on her own to acquire appliances, clothing, and towels with good results. She still remembers moving to Barranquilla at the age of 9 from Arenal, in the Department of Bolivar. Aidée was not able to finish high school due to several difficulties, so she decided to sell merchandise and eventually lunches to people in her neighborhood and from the surrounding areas. Her children currently help her since they represent one of her successes. She helped them get ahead since they were able to earn technical degrees and are now a great support.

For Aidée, having a business is the best form of employment. This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that welcomed her when others rejected her because her age was not consistent with the parameters they established for these types of enterprises. She has made progress in her business, but she still dreams of being successful in her merchandise sales because she knows she has the experience.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets, towels, children’s clothing, and shoes

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en: Najma is a wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan.  Her husband operates a tailoring center in the community. He can sew designer and non designer clothes. He earns approximately Pak Rs. 10,000 on monthly basis. Najma is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her husband so he completes the order on time and earns good profit.

loans.use: To buy an automatic sewing machine

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn K. lives in Ta Daol Bei village in Kandal province and she is 56 years-old. She owns a general store in the local village. Although she tries to work hard, she earns insufficient income. She decided to start a new business but she did not have enough money to begin. Therefore, Mrs. Khorn K. is asking for a loan to buy ten pigs for breeding. She is a widow with four children, two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the other two attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy ten pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Kirrinkai Ole

texts.en:
Kirrinkai Ole T. is 45-years-old, married to Noorparaki T., and the father of four children. A cash crop wheat farmer who has been in the farming business for the last ten years, he learned about KADET from a friend who was already a registered KADET client. This will be his fourth loan, with which he is planning to plant twenty acres of wheat, a crop that has proven to grow very well in this area. With the profits Kirrinka hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production and buy some livestock.

His future goal is to buy a bigger piece of land upon which he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes and keep more sheep.

loans.use: To prepare the land for wheat planting

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento:  VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Palmira, ubicado en la calle Las Ameritas, el B.E. esta en su 3er ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas, Se fundo el  19 de Junio  del 2009, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras.

Como PRESIDENTA tenemos a la señora Cinthia , TESORERA la  Sra. Francisca y SECRETARIA la Sra. Fabiola, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la  venta de  panadería ,jugos de frutas, abarrotes, ropa, dulces asaditos ,empanadas comida, ropas, albañilería y otros. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los días jueves a horas  en la casa de la señora Cristina. Los nuevos clientes están conforme de trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro de la capacitación del  B.E. VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE  ,se les estableció una proyección de sus ahorros a la finalización  del ciclo  en la cual  aprenderán a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 días.

La Sra. CINTHIA (Presidenta) vende Cosmeticos de manera ambulante  en diferentes mercados populares, a parte de esta actividad se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos en sus tiempos libres y  le va bien el negocio. En el banco comunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona, siente útil con lo que le enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño de la señora  Cinthia  es tener su propia vitrina de cosméticos, y progresar en la vida con su negocio, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Guadalupe Communal Bank is located in the Palmira neighborhood on Las Ameritas street. The communal bank is in its third cycle. There are ten people in this communal bank. It was founded by a group of women on June 19th, 2009. Cinthia is the president, Francisca is the treasurer, and Fabiola is the secretary. There are women in the group who sell baked goods, fruit juices, groceries, clothes, sweets, grilled meats, empanadas, food, or other things. Some work as bricklayers. Meetings take place on Thursdays at Cristina’s house. The new clients are happy to work with Emprender as they learn how to save and share with their friends every 14 days. Cinthia (the president) sells cosmetics as a street vendor at the different popular fairs. Aside from this activity, she devotes herself to taking care of her children in her free time. The business is going well for her. She feels that what they teach in the trainings is useful. Cinthia’s dream is to have her own cosmetic display case. She will use the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mercandise

loans.name: Umut's Group

texts.en:
Umut K. is the leader of the group. She is 52 years old and a widow. She has raised a son and two daughters. Her son works as a mechanic and the daughters are married and live separately with their families. A year ago Umut's children suggested she open a kiosk and sell convenience goods. The profits from her business have allowed Umut  to purchase a vehicle for her son. Umut also breeds livestock and with money received from this  loan she wants to purchase some sheep and convenience goods to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she plans to expand the business and increase the number of livestock.

Mairamkul I. 63, is a widow. She has raised four daughters and a son. All the children are married and live separately with their families, except the son, who lives with Mairamkul. The son provides excavator services and his wife helps Mairamkul with her business. They take orders and sew traditional clothes. Mairamkul has applied for a loan because she needs money to purchase a variety of fabrics.

Zhursun U. 48, is the treasurer of the group. Her husband works as a taxi driver. They have two sons and three daughters. The older daughter is married and lives separately with her family. The second daughter works in Bishkek and the other children go to school. Three years ago Zhursun began to breed cattle. She also sells milk to make money.  Zhursun wants to get a loan to purchase some sheep for breeding.

Maksat T. is 24. Four years ago he got a loan and  with that money he bought a mini bus and began to provide transportation services. With the profit from his business it became possible for him to purchase a house. With money received from this loan Maksat plans to purchase building materials to start the construction of the kitchen.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase some sheep for breeding

loans.name: Nshumi_Twimukye Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
29-year-old, happily married A. Syson operates her clothing sells business making 700,000 shillings monthly. With this, this delightful woman has taken all her family responsibilities in her stride. All her three kids are in school. She has done all this under the umbrella of her boutique business which she has operated for the last seven years in Kizinda, Bushenyi.

Syson’s dream of owning this clothing sells business materialized on the back of the accumulation of her small group savings money. She started off as a retailer but later decided to open up a boutique instead. With this loan, she reckons she will be in a strong financial position to purchase more clothes for her boutique, clothes that she will later resell.

Syson has a dream of increasing her business stock as well as having all her children put in good schools till they complete studies. She sees an increase in her business capital and meeting her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Fernando Muroi

texts.pt:
Fernando Muroi G., nasceu na Provincia da Beira Capital Sofala Centro de Moçambique, é casado pai de 4 filhos de 5, 14 e 20 anos, todos vão a escola. Fez a 10ª classe não concluiu porque teve que ir a tropa. Vive na casa própria com sua familia e responsabiliza se pelas suas duas irmãs que vivem com ele.


Sai da Beira quando é recrutado, e durante 6 anos cumpriu serviço militar obrigatório, é desmobilizado e de seguida faz o curso de professorado. E funcionário permante com a categoria de Director da escola ha mais de 27 anos, auferindo 7.750.00mt mensal que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Inicia uma obra com o empréstimo que obteve no BIM, não concluida, aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando empréstimo para dar continuidade da mesma. 



Este é o segundo empréstimo de Fernando na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e chapas de zinco) para dar continuidade da sua obra. O anterior no valor de 10.000.00mt foi usado para a mesma finalidade.

 Esta  confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construção de uma cerámica.
texts.en:
Fernando Muroi was born in the Province Beira Capital Sofala, in central Mozambique. He is married and father to 4 children who are 5, 14 and 20 years old. All children go to school. He studied until the 10th grade but didn't finish school because he was drafted. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports two sisters who live with him. He left Beira when he was drafted and was in mandatory military service during 6 years. After leaving the service he took teacher's training. He has had a permanent job with Principal's level for more than 27 years. He makes 7,750 meticais per month, which is used for household expenses. He has started construction with a loan obtained from BIM. He has not finished construction and now comes to Hluvuku to request a loan to continue it. This is Fernando's second loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva, in the amount of 20,000 meticais. He intends to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, sand and zinc sheets) to continue construction. His previous loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticais, was used for the same goal. He is confident he will pay the loan back ahead of schedule and request another loan to build a pottery/brick factory.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, iron, sand and zinc sheets)

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 70 años, ella tiene su medio de trabajo que es la venta y elaboración de tortillas y frijoles cocidos. Hace más de 31 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, pues sus inicios fueron muy difíciles, ya que no tenía el capital suficiente para salir adelante con su negocio, pues poco a poco es que ha ido creciendo con su actividad. No es la primera vez que realiza este financiamiento por lo que se siente muy contenta con tener esta oportunidad nuevamente. El  financiamiento que solicita es para la compra maíz, leña, frijoles entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Concepción is 70 years old and works making and selling tortillas and beans. She had a difficult time starting out because she didn’t have the necessary capital, but she’s had this business now for more than 31 years and has grown it little by little. This is not the first time that she’s gotten a loan and she is very happy to have this opportunity once more. She will use the money from this loan to buy firewood, beans, and other things. She dreams of improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying anklets, panties, boxers, t-shirts, aprons, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Bendetta

texts.en: Bendetta S. is a 47-year-old married mother of eight children. She lives in Mshomoroni, Mombasa with her family and has been operating a retail shop for the past three years. Bendetta is requesting her first loan from KADET in order to purchase sugar, rice, and maize flour for her retail shop. Her main clients are the area residents. In the future, she hopes to own  a big wholesale shop in Mombasa.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, and maize flour.

loans.name: Rodrigo A.

texts.en:
Rodrigo A. M. is from Mayor's Village, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 57 years old, separated from his spouse, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Rodrigo owns and operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Rodrigo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide a better service. This loan will be his fifth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of twenty-three people, located in Toul Tnaot village in Kandal province. Mr. Kong S., born in 1971 and a married man, was selected as the village bank president by the members of this village bank loan. The members will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Kong S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land that he uses to cultivate vegetables for a living. He faces a problem because he does not have enough money to support his farm. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow crops. His wife, Mrs. Chea Solom, is 38 years old and works as a seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small salary to support her famiL.. This couple has four childrE.: Two are seamstresses in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow crops

loans.name: Amangeldi

texts.en:
Amangeldi A. is a 69 years-old farmer. He has had a happy marriage with his wife, Taalaybubu for 50 years and has ten grown children. All Amangeldi’s life was closely connected with agriculture - he worked as a tractor driver for a long time. Now he and his wife are on pension and have a farm with three milk cows, whose daily milk yield of 20 liters is sold at the local market. Also, this couple is engaged in cultivating wheat, beets and clover and work hard to get a good harvest. These activities allow them to make some savings for their old age and support their grandchildren. 

Amangeldi plans to use the loan of 60,000 KGS to expand his farm by buying two milk cows, which will allow increased milk sales, and also buy forage for the cattle. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle.

Amangeldi is a very attentive grandfather who loves children’s voices ringing in his house and does all his best to provide their prosperous future. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar vive en la localidad de el torno, en el barrio Nuevo Amanecer desde hace 1 año, su actividad es la costura de ropa, se dedica a esta actividad hace 7 años, el destino del crédito es para comprar una maquina de coser, su esposa con la cual tiene un hijo le ayuda en el taller, hace 15 año que se vino a vivir al departamento, buscando mejores oportunidades detrabajo para el y su familia es nacido en la ciudad de Sucre la ciudad de los cuatro nombre, capital de Bolivia, es un joven trabajador . Se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le dio, ya que es su primera vez que solicita financiamiento de capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Señor Oscar has lived in the locality of el Torno, in the Nuevo Amanecer neighborhood, for 1 year.  His activity is sewing clothing.  He has been dedicated to this activity for 7 years.  The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine.  His wife, with whom he has a son, helps him in the workshop.  At age 15 he came to live in the area, looking for better work opportunities for him and his family.  He was born in the city of Sucre, the city of the four names, capital of Bolivia.  He is a hard working youth.  He is thankful to the institution for the support they have given him.  This is the first time he has requested financing for working capital.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Adimdin Group

texts.en:
Abu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. He was born in Masorie village, in Northern Sierra Leone about 58 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has five children who are attending both primary and secondary schools. Abu is a farmer and has been a farmer for over 35 years now. He is requesting this loan in order to invest in his farm. With this loan, Abu is going to pay for labor to help him plough the land and will use the remainder to buy agricultural produce.

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To pay for labor and buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Edith Miriam

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, ella es soltera; y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de carne en el mercado de san Sebastián desde hace 8 años, la socia compra carne de  los proveedores a un precio mayorista, La socia desea comprar carne para aumentar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y D. mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the communal bank “LOS DIAMANTES."  This communal bank is located in the Huanchac district which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Edith is 45 years old, single, and has one child.  She has had a business buying and selling meat in the San Sebastian market for 8 years.  She buys meat from the suppliers at a wholesale price.  Edith wants to buy meat to increase her business.  She requests a loan to buy meat.

Edith appreciates and values the loan granted through these means, and so is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: She wants to buy meat to increase her business.

loans.name: Morris Kioko

texts.en:
Morris Kioko is a single businessman aged 25 years. He runs a retail shop in the very busy Bissil market. His customers are mostly livestock traders. He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer.

Morris has been running his business for four years and his monthly profit is KES 16,000. This is his second loan from KADET, having repaid the first loan well and on time. He plans to use the loan as follows: KES 20,000 to buy sugar, KES 20,000 to buy rice, and KES 32,000 to purchase flour and snacks for sale. If this loan boosts the business, Morris plans to expand it to a wholesale store. Morris describes himself as hardworking and ambitious; he dreams of becoming a big wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To increase stocks of rice, sugar, flour and snacks

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 38 years old and is married with three children between the ages 4 and 12 years old.  Theoneste owns a small cafe. Theoneste works hard in order to improve his economic situation. The hours of his business are from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening everyday, and his cafe has been open for four years.

Theoneste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more beans, coffee and other foodstuffs, which can help him attract more customers. He would like to build a house and save for the future with any profits he makes.

loans.use: To purchase more food for his cafe.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima Fegaui is 27 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. Maima has 2 years of experience in this business. Maima needs a loan of 1500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Maima joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Maima's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Gladys Verónica

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladys Verónica Rodríguez T., actualmente se dedica  atender su negocio  que es  juegos de entretenimiento (billar) ubicado en la ciudad de León, su esposo la apoya en el cuido de dicho lugar tienen una hija. Llevan dedicándose a esta labor desde  hace 7 años.
La Sra. Rodríguez tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda para brindarle una mejor condición de vida a su familia así como a su negocio, debido a que se encuentra  en mal estado, es por eso que se  motivó a visitar  a nuestra institución para solicitar crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: zinc, perlin, pintura anticorrosiva,  golosos, agua crema.  Con este material cambia el techo de su vivienda y parte del negocio. Para iniciar  cambio de techo.
texts.en:
Gladys Verónica Rodríguez T. currently works in her games business (pool / snooker) which is located in the city of León.  Her husband supports her in looking after the business.  They have one daughter and have been in their business for 7 years.

Mrs Rodríguez needs to improve her home and her business in order to provide her family with better living conditions since it is in a bad state of repair.  For this reason, she visited our institution to request a loan so that she could buy building supplies such as corrugated metal roofing, roofing beams, anti-rust paint and bolts.  She will use these supplies to replace her house roof and to begin replacing the roof on her business.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal roofing, roofing beams, anti-rust paint and bolts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and one school-age child. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as a products transporter since 2008. He sticks with multiple projects and his mission consists of delivering products from the company to the project area. He is the only income source in the family.  Today he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to register his van and sign the required official papers to make his transportation more secure and legal.

loans.use: To register his van

loans.name: Marjohn

texts.en:
Marjohn C. is from the village of Damayohan, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 22 years old. Marjohn is single. To make a living, Marjohn owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal (taxi) services to local community members. Marjohn has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marjohn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjohn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marjohn is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Marjohn from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the transportation service

loans.name: Ayatkan's Group

texts.en:
Ayatkan T., 57, is the leader of this group.  She is the resident of Balykchi, a small nice town in Isykul region.  Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension in amount of 2,600 KGS.  Together they bring up three daughters and a son.  The first daughter studies at university and the other children are in school.  

In order to earn additional money to cover family expenses, three years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS, the family started to breed cattle.  Reselling cattle after fattening they earn an additional 3,000 KGS per month.  With money received from the loan Ayatkan wants to purchase a horse for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for breeding.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijos.  La señora tiene estudios de educación secundaria. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de mallas y  leñas.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará mil quinientos paquetes de leña para luego venderlos.  Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, pero solo en ocasiones debido a que trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es comprar una máquina bordadora para prendas de vestir como: casacas, gorros, etc.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el intercambio de palabras con las socias y lo que gana su ahorro.
texts.en:
Leticia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Lujan” which is located in the District of Tinicachi, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Leticia has a high school education.

She started working with Manuela Ramos five years ago. Her first loan of 300 PEN was invested in her business of selling nets and firewood.

With this loan of 3000 PEN, she will buy 1500 parcels of firewood for eventual resale. Her husband helps with the business, but there are occasions when she works alone because he is called away on construction jobs.

Her dream is to buy an embroidery machine for designing garments such as jackets, hats, and other items. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the meetings, the conversations with the other members, and having the ability to save.

loans.use: To purchase 1500 parcels of firewood.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es: Leopoldo, de 57 años, es un hombre muy responsable. Es separado, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hija, su yerno y sus 2 nietos. Hace 16 años Leopoldo, se dedica en la venta de artículos  decorativos para parabrisas de carros y moto taxis. Siendo su punto de venta en una avenida concurrida y céntrica de la ciudad, a una hora en carro de su casa. El trabajo que desempeña le gusta mucho, ya que su creatividad y su buen gusto en los detalles, le han permitido ganar muchos clientes, que hacen que su negocio le sea rentable; sin mucha inversión. Solo ahora aumentaron personas del mismo oficio y a menor precio. Por ello le urge comprarse  cintas decorativas, micas y espejos al por mayor y, de ese modo competir con la competencia. Pero algunos de sus clientes siempre le prefieren, por lo se siente motivado de seguir trabajando en este oficio. Más adelante piensa instalar un restaurante, un  local alquilado a las periferias de su casa y del mercado, en sociedad con su hija. En su 16avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete seguir pagando con la misma responsabilidad. Con el crédito que solicita comprará, cintas adhesivas, espejos y micas, para desarrollar su trabajo.
texts.en:
57 year-old Leopoldo is a very responsible man.  He is separated and lives in his own home together with his daughter, his son-in-law and his two grandchildren.  Leopoldo has been selling decals for car and motorcycle taxi windshields for 16 years.  His sales location is in a busy central avenue in the city, one hour by car from his home.  He really enjoys his work since his creativity and his good eye for detail have enabled him to attract many customers which means his business is profitable and he hasn't needed to make much investment.  However, the number of people in the same trade who offer their products more cheaply has increased.  For this reason, Leopoldo needs to buy some decals, crystals and mirrors wholesale so that he can compete effectively against them.  Leopoldo does have some loyal customers who always prefer to buy from him which gives him the motivation he needs to continue working in this business.  In the future, he plans to set up a restaurant.  He plans to rent premises outside his house and the market and go into business with his daughter.

This is Leopoldo's 16th loan with MFP and he pledges to continue making his loan repayments with the same responsibility.  He will use his loan to buy  decals, mirrors and crystals so that he can carry out his work.

loans.use: to buy mirrors, decals and crystals

loans.name: Dalmas

texts.en:
Dalmas is a married man with 5 children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. He has operated a goat meat business for the past 5 years. His potential customers are community members and butchers.

With the 20,000 KES he is requesting, Dalmas wants to purchase 10 goats to sell for meat. Dalmas decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 goats

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with one child who graduated from school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the electricity bill.

For the past eight years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Saumu not only operates a charcoal selling business but also owns real estate, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 60,000 loan request, she wants to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo temporalmente en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 6 años ofrece el servicio de construcción, como casas u obras públicas, de acuerdo como le requiera el cliente que le contrata, su pasión por el trabajo es tratar en lo posible de terminarlo en el menor tiempo para así cumplir con el cliente. Dispone de sus propias herramientas de trabajo que le permiten ofrecer un servicio de calidad y por ello es que lo conocen en su comunidad, como el mejor maestro de obras. En estos últimos meses ha estado con muchos contratos y eso le favorece en sus ganancias ya que puede así sostener a su familia y continuar en la construcción de su propia casa que es uno de sus grandes anhelos. El tiempo que experiencia y las buenas referencias de su trabajo son las mejores garantías para ofrecer su servicio y ha visto a lo largo de los años que es esencial tener herramientas más sofisticadas por lo que espera que le ayuden con el préstamo que le darán para concretar sus planes.  Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, en todo este tiempo de trabajo dentro de su banco comunal ha visto unidad en su grupo y siente que puede tener confianza con los demás integrantes de que seguirán siendo puntuales en su crédito que actualmente solicitan, por su parte se compromete  a seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la renovación de nuevas herramientas que necesita para optimizar su trabajo.
texts.en: Javier is 36 years old and he lives with his wife and son, temporarily at his parents' house. He has been a construction contractor for more than 6 years, for private homes or for public works. He is hired according to what the client requires. His passion for his work moves him to try to finish in less time to please the client. He has his own work tools which permit him to provide quality service and this is why he is known in his community as a master contractor. Over the last months he has had many contracts and this has increased his earnings. He is able to support his family and to continue working on building their own house. It is one of his greatest goals. The length of his experience and good work references are the best guarantees for his business and he has seen throughout the years ant it is essential to have more sophisticated tools. He plans on settling his plans with the help of the loan. It is his second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and during all this time he has seen the unity in his group and he feels that he can trust the other members to be on time with their loan. For his part he is committed to keep being responsible with his payments. With the loan that he requests he will invest in the purchase of new tools that he needs to optimize his work.

loans.use: to purchase new tools to improve the quality of his work.

loans.name: Julio Daniel

texts.es:
Julio de 29 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Esta casado y tiene 2 hijas que estudian en colegio fiscales. Su actividad es taxista.

Empezó hace un tiempo atrás trabajando con su padre en la venta de boyas inflables y de duchas para los turista luego empezó su propio negocio de criadero de pollos lo cual lo tenia en su domicilio y con un préstamo que realizo pudo comprarse un carro para prestar servicios de taxi publico. Labora desde muy temprano realiza expreso a unos niños que viven por el sector para llevarlos a sus respectivos colegios y después recorre por toda la ciudad de playas trayendo y llevando pasajeros hasta las 10 de la noche. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea hacer mantenimiento al carro llantas y pintadas todo para un buen servicios para su clientes. La meta de el es terminar su casa y comprar un terreno para poner criadero de pollo a para costear el estudios de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Julio is 29 years old.  He lives in a canton called Playas which is one of Ecuador's tourist spots and boasts a wide variety of seafood.  Julio is married and has two daughters who are attending high school.  He is a taxi driver.

Julio started out some time ago, working with his father, selling inflatable floats and showers to tourists.  He then started his own business raising chickens at home.  With a loan that he took out, he was able to buy a car and start providing a public taxi service.  He starts work very early in the morning, driving children who live in the sector to their schools.  Afterwards, he drives all over the city of Playas, transporting passengers until 10.00pm.  With the help of this loan, Julio would like to have some work done on his car: tires and paintwork, so that he can provide a good service to his customers.  His goal is to finish building his home and to buy a plot of land where he can set up a chicken farm so that he can pay for his daughters' education.

loans.use: to have work done on his car - tires and paintwork

loans.name: Kotognogontala  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à FACHORIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de KABOILA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec ABI 2ème à droite position debout.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Kotognogontala 3 group are married women averaging 38 years of age with four children and living mainly in polygamous families in Fachoribougou, a village in the commune of Kaboila in the prefecture of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the success of their agricultural activities during the winter season.
They are on their eighth loan with the institution. The previous loans have been duly repaid.

They cultivate tomatoes and jakatou [a vegetable from the eggplant family]--as for example, Abi (second from right standing) does.

With her loan, she plans to pay the costs of labor, buy agricultural inputs and seeds to work 2 hectares [ 5 acres[ of land.
After harvesting, the produce is sold at their village and at the Sikasso market, to a customer base composed of both women and men.
She plans to earn an average monthly income of 65,500 West African franks per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en: Gegham lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the city of Gyumri.  He is married and the proud father of four children – a thirty-two-year-old daughter and three sons (sixteen, twenty-nine and thirty-three years old).  Gegham has a college education with a degree in agriculture and has been working in his field as a private entrepreneur for over twenty-two years.  He is looking for a loan to purchase additional livestock and fertilizer.  Gegham expects the family income to increase by twenty-five percent with the investment.  He would like to continuing growing his business as well as saving money for his youngest son’s college education.  Gegham also provides support to some of his relatives.  He is pleased with the services and terms of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizer

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El Sr. Pastor es de la ciudad de Santani, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Vicencia con 38 años de edad. Actualmente tienen 4 Hijos, todos mayores de edad, trabajan independiente.
El Sr. Pastor posee una despensa hace ya varios años. El ya cuenta con una clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales.El se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, toda su vida ha trabajado y no tiene miedo a seguir haciéndolo. Por medio de su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a todos sus hijos, por lo cual se siente muy orgulloso.
El solicita el credito para el abastecimiento de su local con comestible, bebidas, embutidos y demás, ya que su stock de mercaderías esta y un poco reducido y sabe que con mas productos podrá atraer nueva clientela. El tiene las esperanzas puestas en su credito ya que sabe que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Pastor is from the city of Santani, he is 46 years old and is married to Vicencia who is 38 years old.  They have 4 children, all of whom are adults and work independently.  Pastor has owned a grocery store for several years now, he relies on an established clientele, good income, good commercial and personal references.  He defines himself as a hard-working and fighting man.  He has worked all of his life and is not afraid to continue doing so.  Through his work he has been able to get his kids ahead which makes him very proud.
He solicits the loan to restock his store with groceries, drinks, sausages, and more since his current stock has been reduced.  Pastor knows that with more products he could attract new customers.  He has his hopes set on this loan because he knows it would be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, drinks, and sausages

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol; la socia tiene 26 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijos, de 1 y 5 meses;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista la socia viaja a Juliaca y trae artefactos para la venta al por menor, la socia trae radios que son las más cotizadas, también televisores, licuadoras, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de artefactos, para esto la socia viajar a la Ciudad de Puno y al distrito de Juliaca que es considerada la capital comercial de Perú aquí se fabrican todo tipo de artefactos y de ropa hecha en la misma ciudad y también repuestos y motores de autos como mismas copias fieles de los originales. L a socia desea viajar y comprar artefactos a bajo costo para traerlos al poblado de Yungaqui a venderlos a precios accesibles para los bolsillos de los pobladores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artefactos.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Marisol is a member of the Communal Bank “Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui” which is located in the District of Yungaqui, Anta Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 26 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has a child who is 17 months old. Marisol is an informal merchant who travels to Juliaca and brings back appliances to sell at retail. Radios are the most requested items, but she also brings back televisions and blenders. Marisol wants a loan to invest in the purchase of appliances. She plans to travel to the city of Puno and the District of Juliaca, which is considered to be the commercial capital of Peru. All types of appliances and clothing are manufactured here, as well as automobile replacement engines and spare parts that are just as good as the originals. Marisol wants to travel so that she can buy appliances at low cost and bring them to the town of Yungaqui to sell at prices that are affordable for the pocketbooks of the local residents. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these appliances.

Marisol is very pleased with and appreciative of the loan that has been provided. She promises to complete her loan payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase appliances.

loans.name: Muharramhon's Group

texts.en:
Muharramhon is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married to a builder, whose monthly salary is 5000 soms. In order to earn money, Muharramhon provides sewing services. Eleven years ago her parents presented her with a sewing machine and since that time she has been sewing dresses. In the beginning she was working at home, but then when the number of clients increased, Muharramhon started to teach sewing to more girls. Those girls help her in running the business. 

At the moment they rent a place in the Central Market and take orders for sewing dresses there. Muharramhon’s monthly profit is 4800 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing fabrics and materials. She also wants to use some part of the loan on the purchase of a washing machine. In the future, Muharramhon wants to expand her business and wishes to open her own store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua is a married man with six children; four attend school while two are too young. He lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a restaurant business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. In addition, he sells fresh water for a further source of income.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, Mutua wants to purchase a hand cart for water distribution and food stock for the restaurant. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a hand cart for water distribution and food stock for his restaurant.

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is a married woman with eight children. Three of her children attend school, while five have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a poultry business. Specifically, she sells poultry to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a vegetable-selling business, which provides supplemental income. She faces a major challenge due to poultry disease outbreaks in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase additional chicks and poultry feed. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are for food.

For the past year, she has operated a shop kiosk selling to neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is competition with other shop sellers. She dreams of having her own retail shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan she wants to purchase bags of sugar, loaves of bread, and dry fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loan funding.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sugar, loaves of bread, and dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Rebecca has been sustaining her business with the assistance of 20 previous loans from NWTF. 

Rebecca is requesting a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients to make and sell food. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Barry Van

texts.en:
Barry Van is 23 years old and lives in Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte. He is married with two children. 

Barry Van has a lumber business and earns approximately 10,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase trees for lumber purposes. Barry Van has been a member of PMPC for 4 months.

loans.use: to purchase trees for lumber purposes

loans.name: Sara De Jesus

texts.es:
Sara, vive con su familia, su esposo y una hija; Sara administra una tienda D. productos domésticos, este surgió por iniciativa propia, para tener ingresos y sin salir D. casa, atendiendo todo el día tanto los quehaceres del hogar como el negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, maíz, frijoles, café, para tener a disponibilidad D. los clientes, esta inversión le aumentara la disponibilidad en el negocio para atender la demanda.
La aspiración D. Sara es crecer en el negocio, ser buen cliente, y proveer para su familia ingresos que solventen necesidades.
texts.en:
Sara lives with her family, her husband and a daughter.  She runs a store selling household products.  This business came about through her own initiative as she wanted to make income without leaving the house so that she could spend the day carrying out her household chores as well as running her business. 

Sara is currently requesting a loan to buy rice, corn, beans and coffee to have these products available for her customers.  This investment will increase her availability of products so that she can meet demand.

Sara's aspiration is to grow her business, be a good client and proviD. her family with income to cover their needs.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, beans and coffee

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married and blessed with one child. He has been selling electronic goods such as mobile phones and computer accessories to make a living. He has employed one person to assist him to run the business. Previously, he was employed elsewhere. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Francis is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy a laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is married and has two children. He lives in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a poultry farmer, a trade he has done for the last two years. He is also a dairy farmer.

He is applying for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more chicks and chicken marsh, and building materials to expand the rearing space. He has set his goals at acquiring more space to breed more chickens, and from this income he will be able to purchase a pickup to assist in distribution and meet the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, chicken feed, and building materials.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La Sra. Matilde pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, del Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba y Departamento de San Martín. Es madre soltera de 45 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son independientes y una está a su cargo de 17 años de edad, estudiante de 5to  año del nivel secundario.
Empezó a trabajar con  la venta de asados, chupetes (helado de hielo) y gelatinas en las afueras de su casa; dejó esta actividad por el cansancio que demanda esta actividad de esta manera  se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de su localidad. Inicia éste negocio con un capital de  S/. 300. 00 nuevos soles. Actualmente vende  su menú todos los días al público en general, sus clientes la prefieren por su sazón y buen trato que les brinda.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00 nuevos soles, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar; pollos, huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos, aceites en docenas, verduras y frutas regionales; asimismo utensilios como: ollas, platos, vasos, mesas y sillas plásticas.  
Matilde es una mujer muy trabajadora, su sueño es incursionar en el negocio de la venta de prendas de vestir.  Lo que le gusta de su banco comunal son los bajos intereses y el compartir con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Matilde belongs to the "Amor y Paz" (Love and Peace) Community Bank in the Moyobamba district of the Moyobamba province in the San Martín department. She is 45 year old single mother of three children; two of them are independent, and the third, age 17, is in her care and a fifth-year high school student. 

Matilde started to work by selling barbecue, popsicles and gelatin desserts in the outskirts of her home; however she quit this type of activity because of the weariness it caused. 

In this way she turned to selling food in the town market. She is starting this business with a capital of 300 nuevos soles. Currently she sells her menu every day to the general public; her clients prefer her for her seasonings and the good service she gives them. 

With a loan of 1,300 nuevos soles, she will buy consumable goods for her menu, such as bags of rice and sugar, chickens, crates of eggs, bunches of plantains, pasta, bottles of oil by the dozen, regional fruits and vegetables, as well as kitchen utensils like pots, plates, glasses, tables and plastic chairs. 

Matilde is a very hard working woman. Her dream is to transition into clothing sales. She likes her communal bank because the interest rates are low and she likes sharing with the other members.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods like bags of rice and sugar, chickens, crates of eggs, and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Josefina, La socia tiene 62 años D. edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 1 hijo , la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. deposito D. cerveza y tambien tiene su negocio D. restaurant donD. venD. desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desD. las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar le ngeocio D. venta D. cerveza y negocio D. restaurant . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras y tambien para comprar cerveza al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Josefina is 62 years old, is married and has a son.  She sells beer and also has a restaurant where she sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and works from 10:00 am to 8:00 pm.  She wants to expand her businesses and is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables.  She also wants to buy beer in quantity.

She is grateful for the support given her and she promises to be disciplined about making her payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora concepción cuenta con 50 años de edad, está casada con el señor modesto quien es campesino, tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales solo Arturo y Amalia segundo y tercer año de prepa, ya que los 2 mayores están casados, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa típica como blusas, vestidos, batas y camisas, desde hace mas de 15 años.
Dice que inicio con esta actividad, ya que quería poyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, también para mejorar un poco su nivel de vida y contar con una solvencia económica más estable, y así poder vivir cómodamente, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas material como son: manta, telas, hilos encajes, listones etc. 
El sueño más grande que tiene doña concepción es el de poder hacer crecer aun mas su negocio, y ampliarlo, para así tener una mejor producción y surtido puesto que así incrementara un poco mas sus ganancias. 
Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatarios de kiva, por toda la ayuda y la confianza que le están ofreciendo, ya que gracias al apoyo recibido su vida ha cambiado mucho al igual que su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Concepción is 50 years old and is married to Señor Modesto who is a farmer. They have four children: Arturo and Amalia who are in the second and third year of high school and the oldest two who are married. For more than 15 years, she has worked at making and selling typical clothing such as blouses, dresses, robes and shirts. 

She says she started this business activity as she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children. She also wanted to improve their standard of living a little and to be more stable economically and thus be able to live comfortably. She is going to use the loan to buy more materials such as "manta" (coarse cotton cloth), fabrics, threads, lace and ribbons.

Concepción's biggest dream is to be able to grow her business even more and extend it so that she produces more and has a greater variety, thus increasing her profits a little. 

She is very grateful to Kiva Field Partner, Fundación Realidad, and all the Kiva lenders, for all the help and trust they are offering her. It is thanks to the support she has received that her life has changed a lot, as well as her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as "manta", fabrics, threads, lace and ribbons.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
María trabaja en el sector limpieza de la municipalidad de lima hace aproximadamente 7 años, ella tiene 43 años,  muchas veces se siente cansada debido a que su trabajo es muy sacrificado por ser  nocturno, María tiene una niña especial que padece una enfermedad  y necesita muchos cuidados que a veces ella no puede darle debido a su trabajo  por eso dejara de trabajar para dedicarse a ella,  los  ingresos de su trabajo  los utiliza para  mejorar su vivienda sobretodo las habitaciones que tiene en alquiler lo cual le genera ingresos adicionales esta vez con el dinero de su préstamo colocara pisos a uno de los cuartos, por otro lado quiere tener su negocio propio y está pensando en una tienda de abarrotes ella es la presidenta del grupo “ MUJERES VIRTUOSAS” y lo conforman 07 socias.


 * La Sra Maria esta parada y viste polo marron
texts.en:
María has worked in the cleaning division of the Lima municipality for approximately seven years.  She is 43 years old.  Many times she feels tired; her work is very self-sacrificing because she works at night.

María’s daughter is special; she suffers from an illness and needs a lot of care.  At times María cannot care for her because of her work.  That is why she will stop working in order to devote herself to her daughter.

She uses the income from her work to improve her house, especially the rooms that she rents.  This generates additional income.  This time she will use the loan to install flooring in the rooms.

She wants to have her own business, and she is thinking about a grocery store.

She is the president of the Mujeres Virtuosas communal bank, which is comprised of seven members.

*María is standing, and she is wearing a brown shirt.

loans.use: to install flooring in the rooms that she rents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of two children, Analie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Analie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Approximately 37 years old, Mrs. Rose B. is married and a mother of six children. She sells sponges in order to contribute to the cost of their home. For the last five years her husband has been retired, and she has struggled to feed and education their children. This is very hard as the needs of the children grow as the children themselves grow up. The retirement pension they receive is not nearly enough to cover his needs. Active and courageous, Mrs. B. is hoping to find a place in the big Lomé marketplace in order to enlarge her business. This requires a bit more money than she has. Therfore, she is asking for an $850 loan which would allow her to rent a place in the large market area and would give her base money to buy and sell sponges.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 37 ans environ, Madame B. Rose est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des éponges en filet pour contribuer aux charges de son foyer. Depuis 5 ans que son mari est admis à la retraite, elle se bat pour nourrir et scolariser ses enfants. Ce qui n’est pas facile car les besoins deviennent de plus en plus importants au fur et à mesure que les enfants grandissent. La petite pension de retraite de son mari ne suffit en rien pour ces besoins. Active et courageuse, Madame B. se propose de trouver une place au grand marché de Lomé pour agrandir son commerce. Ce qui demande un peu plus moyens dont elle ne dispose pas. Elle sollicite alors un financement de $850 qui lui permettra de louer une place au grand marcher et disposer d’un fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des éponges en filet

loans.use: Finding a location and buying and selling sponges

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Two years ago, Patricia began to sell home decoration products so she could support her family, since her husband's income was not enough to cover the family's expenditures. Patricia is a hard-working and active woman, and she would like to offer her children a better quality of life. One of her daughters is currently attending college, so Patricia's income goes to her college expenses.

Lately, Patricia has seen an increase in her number of clients, and she needs a $200 loan to buy merchandise so she can provide a greater variety of products for her clients. It is in your hands to help Patricia, don't hesitate any longer, she'll be sincerely thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Patricia inició con la venta de productos decorativos para el hogar desde hace dos años, como una manera de apoyar a su familia porque el ingreso que recibía su esposo resultaba insuficiente para todos los gastos familiares. Patricia es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, y quiere ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, actualmente una de sus hijas estudia en la universidad y con el ingreso que Paty obtiene le ayuda a pagar sus colegiaturas.

Últimamente se han incrementado los clientes de Patricia y ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 dólares que planea utilizar para la compra de mercancía, y poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. En tus manos está el poder ayudar, no lo dudes más, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Sunayah

texts.en: Sunayah is a 35 year old mother and is married with three children. Two of them are girls and the third child is a boy. Her husband, Sueb raises fish and sells them at 5 cent/kg every three months. To supplement her husband's income, Sunayah sells household goods such as vegetables, rice, snacks, kerosene and various beverages at her small kiosk. From this business, she can earn about $30 in a day as an income.  Sunayah needs a loan of $100. With this loan she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her children's education to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
I am a widow and I live by myself, but I work all day long. The problem I have is that in my house I don't have a window in the kitchen, and thus it seals in a lot of heat. I'd like to tear down part of the wall and put in a window as well as a grating. I request $1,000 to put in a window with its grille.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Yo soy viuda y vivo sola pero trabajo todo el día, el problema que tengo en mi vivienda es que no tengo ventana en la cocina así es que se encierra mucho el calor, me gustaría tumbar una parte de la pared y poner una ventana así como tambien la reja”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner una ventana con su reja.

loans.use: Put in a window and grille - Poner ventana y reja

loans.name: Simah

texts.en: Simah is 45 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and all her children are grown and married. She sells snacks, candies, beverages, cigarettes, and other similar items. In the morning, she sells coconut milk rice and fried snacks together with her husband, earning $22.50 per day. She requests a $50 loan to complete her business and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To complete her store

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix owns a car that he uses as a radio taxi. The car is used as a inter-city public transport between La Paz and El Alto. His wife has a snack bar (tea, coffee, sandwich) which generates income that's used to cover costs like providing for his son. They live in the area of Los Andes in the city of El Alto.

The requested loan will be used to increase the amount of merchandise in his wife's snack bar, which will ultimately bring in greater income for the family. This is his fifth loan with IMPRO. A completed credit evaluation qualifies Félix for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Félix tiene su movilidad propia que trabaja de radio taxi - transporte publico inter ciudad La Paz - El Alto. Su esposa tiene una snack de refrigerios (té, café, sándwich) con cuyos ingresos alcanzan a cubrir los gastos de mantenimiento propios como los de su hijo; vive en la Zona Los Andes de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito solicitado será utilizado para incrementar la mercadería en su snack e incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el quinto crédito con IMPRO y la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitada por Felix.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his wife's snack bar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his shop business.

loans.name: Sulaimanov

texts.en: Sulaimanov B. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children.  He has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007.  Sulaimanov B. from the first days showed himself as the reliable client. The business stability and income increase helped him to return his previous loan. Mr. Sulaimanov B. is experienced in business (about 10 years) and has the appropriate knowledge in  livestock because he has worked with  bovine animals from his early years. He helped his father on the farm as the stock keeper and further in  livestock raising and selling and  milk production. It was the family business. Now he is the master in the railway station but he still is engaged in livestock raising and selling because he dreamed of having a large flock and to open a business in the meat products making. He has the appropriate knowledge that he has used in practice. In time he dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow  for  further meat and milk goods production. Now Mr. Sulaimanov B. requests a loan of $475 for business development and the  horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increase significantly the family income and permit him to plan further business development.

loans.use: for business development and a horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rosa N. is a young, habitant of the community of Villanueva located in the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua. She works for herself in her business selling of stationary products. She has been doing this for the last 5 years and she operates her business out of her house. It is important to mention that the income that she generates through her business allows her to provide for her family and to support her elderly parents, who really need her help.

She is in need of more products for her stationary store and because of this she has come to Ceprodel for a loan. With the loan she will be able to invest more money in her business, and improve the way she and her beloved parents live.

She presently has a history of 4 loans through Ceprodel. Each loan has been paid back on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Rosa N. es una joven habitante del pueblo Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de librería desde hace 5 años en su casa de habitación. Es necesario señalar que con su actividad logra suplir las necesidades de su hogar y mantener a sus ancianos padres que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.

Su necesidad actualmente es la compra de los productos de librería y para ello acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan invertir en el negocio y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de vida y el de sus queridos padres.

Actualmente su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo estipulado.

loans.use: Buy products for her stationary store

loans.name: Jamila's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Jamila is 46 years old and is a married woman with three children; they are 32, 20 and 11 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other elderly person who is 80 years old.

Jamila owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns an average monthly profit of $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en: Manju G. 40 year’s old lady lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming and small business like grocery store. Mrs. G. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her older son works in private office and younger son are studying in grade 11.  Mrs. G. and her husband Mr. Shiddhi Bahadur G. open their poultry farm 4 years ago. They sell chickens to the chicken dealers. They also sell chicken in retail price in local market. They are running their business successfully and they are happy with their income. Now Mrs. G. is requesting for the third loan of Rs 20000.00 to expand her business to buy small chickens for her farm. They also want to expand the capacity of her farm.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda O. is single and 23 years old. She has sold drinks, clothes and coolers since 2005. She is a LAPO client. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She is in need of a loan of $450 to buy more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all those who will make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and drinks to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. sells bulk fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient enough for Grace and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
