Hilda used to practice agriculture in the provinces, but she decided to move to Lima and start a new business. It was thus that she put a bodega in her house ten years ago. Hilda offers a large variety of products to her neighbors, who know her. She will use the loan she is requesting to stock her store with products. She would like to convert her bodega into a mini-market.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda se dedicaba a la agricultura en provincia, pero decidió mudarse a Lima y empezar un nuevo negocio. Fue así que ella puso una bodega en su casa hace 10 años. Hilda ofrece toda variedad de productos a sus vecinos, quienes ya la conocen. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado en surtir su tienda con productos. A ella le gustaría poder convertir su bodega en un minimarket.

loans.use: To stock her store with products

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín is 60 years old, lives with his wife and 13 year-old son, who is a student. Since he was a boy farming was important to him as he helped his parents on their land and therefore knows well how to grow different crops. From early in the morning and all day long he does what he likes and knows how to, and even if his work is tough and tiring he carries it out joyfully, except for the expensive supplies needed to farm his land such as fertilizers and medicines. Benjamín plans to extend his land and start sowing corn to be prepared for the season and be able to commercialize his production in the towns close to his locality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Benjamín tiene 60 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 13 años, quien es estudiante. Desde niño, la agricultura fue la actividad que siempre lo acompañó, debido a que ayudaba a sus padres en las labores dentro de sus chacras, por ello es muy conocedor de cómo cultivar los diversos productos. Desde muy tempranas horas y durante todo el día hace lo que le agrada y sabe hacer, es por ello que aunque su trabajo es duro y cansado, lo realiza con alegría; salvo por los costosos insumos que requiere para el cuidado de sus terrenos, tales como fertilizantes, medicinas y abonos, los cuales son indispensables. Benjamín tiene proyectado ampliar sus terrenos y comenzar la siembra de maíz para estar preparado para la próxima temporada, y poder comercializar su producción en las ciudades cercanas a su localidad.

loans.use: Extend and prepare farm land for sowing corn.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Es una mujer luchadora, trabaja para ayudar en la economía de su hogar, muchas veces el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza para poder cubrir con los gastos, por lo cual decidió hace  6 años dedicarse a la venta de ropa, para ellos, viaja primero a la ciudad de Lima para adquirir la mercadería y luego se va a las ciudades de Cerro y Carhuamayo, y también Junín, por ello sus viajes son constantes, cada fin de semana.Ahora Esther está embarazada, y no puede realizar constantes viajes,   pero en los próximos meses continuará adelante con su trabajo.
Solicita este préstamo para abastecerse de mercadería, a fin de que pueda reiniciar su negocio, ella a futuro desea tener su propia boutique.
texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their four children. She has a fighting spirit, and works to help out with her household's economics. Many times, her husband's salary cannot cover their expenses, and that's why she decided to dedicate herself to selling clothing 6 years ago. To do this, she goes first to the city of Lima to acquire merchandise, then she goes to the cities of Cerro, Carhuamaya and Junín. She travels constantly, every single weekend. Now Esther is pregnant and she can't make these constant trips, but in the months ahead she will continue forward with her business. She is requesting this loan to stock additional merchandise so that she can restart her business. In the future, she hopes to run her own boutique shop.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her quantity of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.en: N. Zafarjon is a young livestock farmer who sells meat in the local market. This work is his only source of income for supporting his wife and their four children. He is 31 years old and carries an immense responsibility on his shoulders. He knows that he cannot give himself the luxury of rest because each moment counts toward increasing his productivity. In spite of leading a young family with lots of enthusiasm, he understands that to grow his business he needs additional money for investment capital. For this reason he is asking your help for a loan of 2200 Somoni ($650 USD). He will invest this money in his farm and purchase small animals so that, over time, he will increase his capital and improve the quality of life for his family. He promises to repay the loan within 12 months. If you are able to help Zafarjon please do so. He needs people like you to help him.

loans.use: Purchase farm animals

loans.name: Yaritza Yurie

texts.es: La Sra. Yaritza tiene 26 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, tiene dos hermosos hijos que cursan la primaria, su esposo es albañil a veces trabaja por contrato y otras independiente es un trabajo bien cansado pero se gana bien, muy temprano se levanta doña Yaritza para mandar a su esposo desayunado a parte que le aliña el almuerzo ya que la comida esta muy cara en los comedores. Su negocio es una pulpería que tiene desde hace siete años lo cual comenzó con dinero propio de una liquidación de su trabajo que trabajaba como obrera y con ayuda también de su esposo, con la solicitud de crédito es para invertir en inventario en compra de productos variados como granos básicos, golosinas, productos de limpieza para ofertar a su clientela pues los préstamo que ha hecho ha podido hacer mas grande su negocio gracias a la confianza y esfuerzo con AFODENIC ya que con este crédito es décimo y espero seguir trabajando para prosperar mas en la pulpería y así poder a ayudar a mis hijos con los gastos del colegio.
texts.en:
Yaritza is 26 years old, lives in Laureles Sur, a neighbourhood of the capital Managua, and has two beautiful children who attend elementary school. Her husband is a bricklayer who works at times on contract and at other times as an independent. It is tiring work, but pays well. Yaritza wakes up early in order to make her husband breakfast and lunch as restaurant food is very expensive. She owns a grocery store, which she opened seven years ago with monies from a settlement from her previous work as a labourer, as well as with her husband's help. She will use this loan to increase her inventory with a variety of products, such as staples, candies, and cleaning products to offer to her clients. She has used previous loans to increase her business. She is thankful for the trust and help AFODENIC have given her as this is her tenth loan. She hopes to continue working so that her grocery business may flourish and therefore be able to help her children with the cost of high school tuition.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staples and candies

loans.name: Sidikatou

texts.en:
Sidikatou M. is 37 years old and married to Imorou Bagoudou. She has 3 children in school. She sells onions that she buys from vendors in the north of Benin and elsewhere. She currently has a small store in the Slaughterhouse Market, and is the sole vendor to supply large quantities of onions. She seeks this loan to better serve her clients.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans. 

Agée de 37ans, dame M. Sidikatou est mariée à BAGOUDOU Imorou, elle est mere de 03 enfants,tous scolarisés elle vend de l'oignon qu'elle achète aupres des commerçants venu du nord et ailleurs. Actuellement disposant d'une boutique dans le marché de l'abattoir et actuellement la seule à fournir de l'oignon en grande quantité,elle a sollicité le renouvellement de son pret pour servir à mieux ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 40 baskets of 40 onions

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: La  Sra. O. habita junto a su familia en su casa ubicada en el barrio Tamanes de Juigalpa, local donde tambien tiene su cocina artesanal y su mostrador donde diariamente muy temprano palmea sus tortillas, las que su clientela compuesta por sus vecinos llega a comprarle su producto a tempranas horas durante los 3 tiempos de comida; sus hijos 2 mayores y 1 pequeño que asiste al colegio de primaria, el marido se desempeña como conductor de taxi y le apoya con los gastos del hogar; su mayor anhelo es algun dia contar con un horno electrico que le permita evitar el calentamiento en el fogon artezanal que actualmente ocupa.
texts.en:
Mrs. O. lives with her family in their home that is located in the Tamanes de Juigalpa neighborhood. This is also where she has her kitchen and sales counter where every day she gets up early to make tortillas. Her customers, mostly people from the neighborhood, arrive early to buy her tortillas for each of the three meals of the day. She has three children, 2 older children and 1 younger child that goes to elementary school. Her husband is a taxi driver and helps with the household expenses. Her greatest desire is to one day have an electric oven that would allow her to avoid heating up the artisans oven that she has now.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling tortillas

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with one child. She rents a kiosk and sells women's clothing at the central city market. She has been in this business for 3 years. Natalya's salary at her previous job was way low and she decided to start her own business. Now she can make additional income for her family. Her daughter got enrolled in the university and Natalya helps her to cover tuition and living expenses.

Natalya would like to receive 7,500 UAH to increase the assortment of her goods. Natalya's business goal is to purchase her own kiosk so she will not need to pay rent and can use her income to pay her daughter's university studies.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia P. is a seaweed grower. With her previous loan from CEVI, she bought seedlings and started to plant. The profit she gets from planting seaweed is what she uses to feed her 5 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Whenever her husband catches plenty of fish, they sell fish in their neighborhood.

Her seaweed farm is on Hingotanan Island. Letecia thinks that her farm could help her support the needs of her children, especially the school fees and their other projects.

She is asking for a CEVI loan of Php 10,000 ($225 USD) to buy more seedlings for her seaweed farm. She believes that the more she plants, the greater harvest she will have. The loan will also be used to help her get started in another line of business.  

CEVI supports Letecia in her seaweed farm. Now, she enjoys credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings for her seaweed farm

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: U. Muhabbat is 31 years old. She is married with 2 children She lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan but she comes every day to Khujand from Istaravshan to sell her food products in the local bazaar. She sells meat products (sausages and salami), dairy products (pasteurized milk, curd, kefir and mask), vegetable oil, sweets, candies, bread, salt and juices. Muhabbat wants to open a specialized mini-market and works very hard towards that goal. She would like to increase the variety of products that she sells and thereby increase her  profits. Muhabbat requests through KIVA a business development loan of  1200 STJ for 4 months to purchase new food products to increase her business. Muhabbat thanks KIVA for its support and financial help.

loans.use: To buy a variety of food products for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells sarongs of various colors. She loves this business because she makes a lot of profit. She hopes to expand this business. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is 38 years old and married with six children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Халимов Хикматулло проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Образование среднее. Всю жизнь занимается животноводством. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Он имеет хозяйство , где разводит бычков для продажи. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет развивать бизнес и уевличить доход семьи.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo H. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He has a high school education. He has been raising livestock for his entire life. This business is the sole source of income for his family. He has a plot where he raises bulls for sale. He plans to get credit in order to increase his livestock count. This will help to grow his business and increase the family’s income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock count

loans.name: Jero Ketut Pudak

texts.en:
Jero Ketut Pudak (DNR.M-0647) is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jero Ketut Pudak owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. Her main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Jero Ketut Pudak has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from this activity.

In 2007, Jero Ketut Pudak joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Jero Ketut Pudak has successfully repaid a previous loan of 400,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Jero Ketut Pudak is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be her third loan from DINARI. Jero Ketut Pudak plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socioeconomic development opportunities to small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Jero Ketut Pudak - (DNR.M-0647) merupakan 46 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Jero Ketut Pudak memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Jero Ketut Pudak sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Jero Ketut Pudak menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Jero Ketut Pudak bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Jero Ketut Pudak meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Jero Ketut Pudak berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.

Tentang DINARI:
Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie M. is 48 years old. She is married and happily blessed with her nine children. Her husband works in traditional gold mining. While her husband works in mining, she manages her variety store. She sells different items as requested by her customers.

Tessie M. wants to purchase additional items for her variety store because she believes that if her store had a greater inventory it would generate a much higher income. She is now applying for a loan offered by HSPFI, a KIVA partner. From this, all her plans for her business will be realized.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
"Hi dear friends. I think that you remember me. I am a taxi driver and you played a large role in improving my taxi business." Nariman is a taxi driver. In 2007, he applied to Kiva for a loan of US $1200 and with this loan he improved his business.
Now he has a problem with his car which he would like to repair. Nariman is applying for a second Kiva loan of 1200 AZN to buy spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a married woman and has one child. Her husband is an ordinary driver and his salary isn’t enough to feed their young family. So, understanding that, Fatima went to learn to sew dresses. After learning, she bought herself a simple old sewing machine. She started buying fabrics from the market and sewing men’s and women’s national dress on demand. But now she understands that her simple sewing machine is not good enough to sew better-designed dresses. So she decided to purchase a new sewing machine with better technology in order to sew better dresses for her clients. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mahmadumar

texts.ru: Уразов Махмадумар болеее 20 занимается торговлей. Он имеет собственную аптеку. Уразов женат, имеет 4 детей. Проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 43 года. Махмадумар просит кредит, чтобы закупить новые товары и увеличить товараоборот.
texts.en:
Mahmadumar U. has been involved in sales for over 20 years. He owns a pharmacy. U. is married and has 4 children. He lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is 43 years old. Mahmadumar is requesting a loan in order to buy new products and increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new products and increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Rose Nyambura

texts.en:
Rose Nyambura W. is married with 2 children.

She has been carrying out research and consultancy services for various companies and also auditing their books for the last one and a half years. In her enterprise Rose has employed two staff persons. Her office is situated in the busy Woodley Estate, in Nairobi, which is easily accessible to her clients.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client. Previously she had serviced a loan with a local bank. She estimates that her monthly income is Kshs. 250,000. In order to increase her earnings, she intends to increase her research network.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: Increasing  network to expand her research and consultancy services business

loans.name: Torre Group

texts.es:
El grupo Torre es proveniente de la ciudad de Masaya, de un barrio llamado Las torres de origen muy precario ubicado cerca del mercado central de Masaya, este nombre se debe a que son personas de escasos recursos económicos que establecieron su casa debajo de unas torres de electricidad ubicadas en esa zona. Está formado por la señora María Elena S., don Cándido José G. A. y Martha Ercilia G. S.. 

María Elena de 50 años de edad es la coordinadora del grupo; Quien elabora dulces tradicionales de la región (Cajeta de leche, de coco, de papaya, coyolito, leche burra, entre otros) desde hace más de 16 años, ella aprendió a hacer estos dulces desde que tenía 7 años, cuando su mamá le enseñó como elaborarlos. A los 16 años, se independizo y con su esposo emprendieron el negocio. Con esto lograron criar a sus 4 hijos, quienes ya son adultos y agradecen el esfuerzo de sus padres.

María Elena, a pesar de que enfrenta problemas en los riñones alega no se siente impedida para continuar su trabajo, puesto que todavía tiene sueños y metas que anhela alcanzar como los son mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar.

Los otros dos miembros del grupo, quienes son, Doña Martha vende comida por las noches en su casa (Fritangas Nicaragüenses) y Don Cándido quien trabaja vendiendo diferentes tipos de golosinas en su casa.
texts.en:
The Torre Group is from the city of Masaya. Their name originates from a very poor neighborhood called Las Torres, which is located near the central market in Masaya. It represents the poor people who established their homes underneath electrical towers (torres) that were erected throughout the area. The group members are Sra. María Elena S., Don Cándido José G. A., and Martha Ercilia G. S..

María Elena is 50 years old and serves as the group coordinator. She prepares traditional candies of the region (caramels made with milk, coconut and papaya; coyolito; leche burra, and others) and has been engaged in this business for over 16 years. Her mother started teaching her how make candy when she was 7 years old. By the age of 16, she became independent and started her business with her husband. She managed to raise 4 children, who are now adults who appreciate the efforts of their parents. Maria Elena, despite facing health problems with her kidneys, feels she can continue to work since she still has dreams and yearns to improve her living conditions at home.

As for the other two members, Sra. Martha sells food at night from her house (Nicaraguan fried snacks) and Don Candido sells different kinds of candy from his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making candy

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús D. Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado D. López del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. el Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 5 hijos, ella estudio secundaria incompleta (2do grado), y  vive  en la parcialidad D. Janchallani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para comprar ovejas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, este dinero ella lo invertirá en la compra D. cabezas D. ovino, para engorD. y venta en  feria zonales.

Su deseo es poder educar darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan  los ahorros
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Jesús D. Nazareth Community Bank, which is located in the López town center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 45, married, and has five children. She went to high school for two years. She lives in the Janchallani region. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to buy sheep. She currently needs an additional loan. That is why she is asking for 600 PEN to buy sheep to fatten and sell at the regional fairs. Her wish is to be able educate her children so that they have a profession. She likes the savings (in her Community Bank).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
Balbina tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy cariñosa, vive en una habitación alquilada con sus 3 hijos: Alberto de 25, Ricardo de 24 y Luis de 22, quienes la ayudan mucho en el trabajo. Su negocio es el alquiler de carpas, sillas y mesas para eventos sociales y en cualquier fiesta local es muy solicitada, ya que sus cosas están muy bien cuidadas y el precio que ofrece es muy accesible. Ella decidió por este trabajo, porque le permite tener libertad y no tiene un jefe que la presione, además puede dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos y velar por sus estudios. Lleva 3 años desempeñándose en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cargar las pesadas carpas hasta los lugares donde se las alquilan. Para el futuro anhela juntar el dinero necesario para implementar una tienda de abarrotes.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Balbina con MFP y al igual como hizo en sus primeros créditos desea pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que sino meterá en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por lo responsable que es. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas sillas y mesas, con lo cual espera poder subir un poco más el precio del alquiler.
texts.en:
Balbina is 45 years old. She is a charming lady who rents her home and lives with her three sons, Alberto, age 25; Ricardo, age 24; and Luis, age 22, who help her very much in her work. She runs a business renting out tents, tables and chairs for social events. She is well sought out by customers, as her items are well cared for and her prices are reasonable. She chose this business because it allows her flexibility and she does not have a "boss" to pressure her. It also allows her to spend time with her sons and stay up late studying. She has run this business for three years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying the heavy tents to the renters' places. In the future she will save up the money needed to open store selling groceries. This will be Baliba's fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). As with her previous loans, she plans to make her payments on time, because she knows that not doing so will cause problems for her community bank, with whom she has earned a good reputation for being responsible. With this loan of "500 Soles" ($175 US), she will invest in new tables and chairs, which she expects to be able to rent out for slightly higher prices.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and charis to rent out

loans.name: Guido

texts.es: Guido es soltero, tiene 25 años de edad, no tiene hijos y  vive en la casa de su padre. Guido se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros en su vehículo propio, actividad a la que se dedica hace más de 5 años. La competencia en el rubro del transporte es alta, pero la demanda también lo es, ya que para todos es conocido que es el medio de transporte más rápido. Cuenta con clientela fija que demanda sus servicios permanentemente. El destino del crédito es para cancelar el saldo por la compra de un nuevo vehículo, el mismo que prestara el servicio en el transporte público de pasajeros. Es el tercer crédito al que accede Guido con buen cumplimiento de pago. No tiene pasivos en el sistema financiero y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y morales.
texts.en:
Guido is single; he is 25 years old, has no children and lives at home with his father. Guido provides public transportation using his own vehicle, activity that he has been doing for more than five years. Competition in the transportation business is high, but demand is also high, because it is common knowledge that it is the fastest method of transportation. He has an established clientele that requests his services continuously. The loan purpose is to pay the balance owing from the purchase of a new vehicle, which will be used to provide public transportation services to passengers. This is the third loan for Guido and he has complied well with repayment terms. He has no liabilities in the financial system and has good personal and professional references.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, oil, beans and other food products

loans.name: Mabongle

texts.en:
E. B. is married with two children. He and his entire family live in a house with three rooms in GTTC Street, Nkwen, Cameroon. E. had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill health, facing difficulties to pay his children's school fees, and the death of his father when he was still young.

E. has an animal feed store business and also sells palm oil and corn.

E. has been a member of GHAPE since 2008. This will be his third loan. He has been quite successful in the past with his business due to the location of his business and his reasonable prices. Also with more experience he is now having good profits from his business.

Part of the profits from this loan will be used to take care of his children, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication whenever they are sick. Emmanual will plough back the rest into his business.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Animal feed store and sales of palm oil and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more medicine in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a new business, a general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell fish

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mrs. La C., age 44 (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Chork Kao, age 44, married in 1982 and have four children. The eldest son is a chef, another one is a security guard, and the other two attend school. They live in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

La has been selling vegetables and groceries for ten years. Her husband is a rice farmer and raises cows at home. She is requesting her first loan of $300 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting. She also will use a part of her loan to buy a water pump machine.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Magbontho Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Magbontho' group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. With the help of this loan, the can add more goods to their current stock, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ballay K. who is second from left in the photo. The 37-year-old Ballay is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a businessman and 2 of her children are attending primary school; 1 is in secondary school and 1 is a teacher. For more than 12 years now, Ballay has been selling groundnuts (peanuts), rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With her share of the loan, Ballay will buy bags of rice, bags of groundnuts, and gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, bags of groundnuts, and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 36 years old and married with five children. Her eldest child is 13 years old and her children are still dependent on her. They all go to school. Her husband is also involved in her business. She bakes loaves of bread to sell at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bags of flour and other baking materials to bake more loaves of bread to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour and other baking materials

loans.name: Sergio Genaro

texts.es:
Sergio Menéndez de 30 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, en su casa cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. Su esposa trabaja con el en la farmacia tiene una hija de 1 año y 7 meses. 

El empezó vendiendo artículos para el hogar, pero como no tenia ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia decidió invertir sus ahorros en el mismo negocio que los padres tenían. 

Ahora el tiene su propia farmacia en un local de su casa. Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 23h30 todos los días. Vende productos farmacéuticos, productos para laboratorios, laxantes, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos para laboratorios y medicamentos para la farmacia. En el futuro su sueño es tener 3 sucursales farmacéuticas.
texts.en:
Sergio Menéndez, age 30, lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. His house has the basic services of water and electricity. His wife works in the pharmacy. They have a daughter who is one year and seven months. He started selling articles for the home, but he did not have enough income to support his family. He decided to invest his savings in the same business that his parents had. Now he has his own pharmacy in a area of his house. He works from 7:00 a.m. until 11:30 p.m. everyday. He sells pharmaceutical products, products for laboratories, and laxatives, etc. With the loan he wants to buy products for laboratories and medicine for the pharmacy. In the future he dreams of having three branch pharmacists.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medications and products for laboratories

loans.name: Zaynudin

texts.ru: Умаров Зайнудин проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Зайнудин имеет средне- специальное образование. Более 14 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку рядом с домом. Он в основном продает лекарства и препораты для животных. До этого работал ветеринаром. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть аптеку.
texts.en:
Zaynudin U. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. Zaynudin has a secondary-specialized education. He has been involved in retail sales for over 14 years and has a retail outlet near his house. He primarily sells medicines and veterinary supplies. He previously worked as a veterinarian. Zaynudin is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover. He wants to expand his business and open a pharmacy.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Holboy

texts.ru: Саттаев Холбой проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Более 40 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Вся его семья занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Holboy S. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 57 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry for over 40 years. Holboy breeds livestock at home. He primarily fattens and sells livestock. His whole family is involved in this business. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Kart-E- Chahar Group

texts.en:
Morsal, daughter of M. R., is 24 years old and is the group leader of Kart-e-Chahar Group.  She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and she has a tailoring business. She has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. When she started this business for the first time, she had a small business and she was very weak in running the business, but when she got an individual loan, she really improved a lot in her business and still she is furthering her business, attracting a good number of customers, making a good income for her family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time. 

She is happy with this loan. She would like to thank both Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Serves Joint Stock Company) and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to expand their businesses. Finally, she wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: buy a new muchine for her tailoring

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en:
Hovik H. is 46 years old and lives in Geghamavan village in the Sevan area. Hovik is married and has three sons. One of his sons is serving in the Armenian Army and the other sons are studying in Sevan technical secondary school. Hovik worked as a worker for about five years and as a driver for about eight years. Hovik has been engaged in farming for 15 years. On his farm he has cows, calves and sheep. His wife helps him in farming. With their income from animal husbandry, they keep their family and pay for their sons’ education.   

Hovik needs a 400,000 AMD loan to buy two cows, which will help him to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Rosas Preciosas Group

texts.es:
ESTA BANCA D. EMPRENDIMIENTO SE DENOMINA ROSAS PRECIOSAS LA CUAL ESTA CONFORMADA POR 8 CLIENTES D. LAS CUALES 2 SON VARONES Y EL RESTO SON MUJERES INDEPENDIENTES,  ELLAS SE ORGANIZAN MEDIANTE UNA MESA DIRECTIVA  D. LAS CUALES SE DESTACAN LA PRESIDENTA  TESORERA Y SECRETARIA SOBRE LAS CUALES LLEGAMOS A CONFORMAR ESTA BANCA. 

LA PRESIDENTA, LA SRA. CRISTINA VIVE EN EL ALTO Y ES VENDEDORA D. COMIDA EN LA ZONA D. LA BALLIVIAN, TIENE MUCHAS ASPIRACIONES PARA SU NEGOCIO, ACTUALMENTE TIENE SU PUESTO, PERO QUISIERA AMPLIARLO Y ALQUILARSE UNA PENSION PARA ASI TENER MEJORES INGRESOS Y ,MEJORAR LA CALIDAD D. VIDA D. TODA SU FAMILIA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MESAS Y SILLAS PARA SU PUESTO D. VENTA.

LA TESORERA, LA SRA. ALICIA REALIZA VENTA D. MIEL OPTIENE SU PRODUCTO VIAJANDO A DIFERENTES REGIONES D. BOLIVIA Y LA COMERCIALIZA GENERALMENTE EN LAS FERIAS D. LA PAZ, ESTAN A SU CARGO DOS NIÑAS D. 12 Y 9 AÑOS D. EDAD,SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES LOGRAR QUE SUS HIJAS SEAN PROFESIONALES, ES UNA MUJER MUY LUCHADORA Y VALORABLE QUE NO SE DEJA VENCER.  

LA SECRETARIA D. ACTAS ES LA SRA. GUADALUPE  VIVE EN ANTICRETICO  EL LA ZONA D. BALLIVIAN, ES PRODUCTORA D. MEDICINA NATURAL, LA CUAL CONSISTE EN MATES, FOMENTOS, PARCHES, Y POMADAS, TODAS EN BASE A PLANTAS  TIENE DOS HIJOS Y SU ESPOSO LA APOYA  EN EL NEGOCIO, SU ANHELO MAS GRAND. ES TENER UN TECHO PROPIO POR ESO TRABAJA TANTO Y NECESITA EL CREDITO PARA VIAJAR A LA DESAGUADERO FRONTERA ENTRE BOLIVIA Y PERU PARA COMPRAR MERCADERIA YA QUE D. ESTE LUGAR SE PROVEE LA SRA. GUADALUPE.
texts.en:
The ROSAS PRECIOSAS community bank has 8 members, 2 men and the rest women. They organized themselves by means of a "mesa directiva", choosing a president, treasurer and secretary from among those who started the group. The president, Sra. CRISTINA, lives in El Alto and sells food in the Ballivian neighborhood. She is ambitious for her business. She only has a single stand now, but she wants to expand it and lease space so that she can increase her income and improve the lives of her family. She will use money from the loan to buy tables and chairs for her food stand. The treasurer, Sra. ALICIA sells honey. She buys her product from producers in various parts of Bolivia and sells it, generally, at markets in La Paz. She has two daughters, 12 and 9, and her greatest hope is to see them land professional careers. She is a courageous woman who strives hard to make sure nothing will hold her back. The secretary, Sra. GUADALUPE, lives in an "anticretico" (a lease-purchase arrangement common in Bolivia) in the Ballivian neighborhood. She makes natural medicines, patches, pomades, etc., all maD. from plants. She has two children and her husband helps her with the business. Her greatest wish is to build a covered structure for the business. She needs the loan to travel to Desaguadero on the Bolivian border with Peru where she buys the product that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: books, stationerery items, and renovations for a nursery school

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es: Eddy tiene 29 años por lo que su actividad es la reparación de bicicletas. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, el inicio este negocio solamente con la reparación de bicicletas con el paso del tiempo y con los financiamientos que han sido de gran ayuda para que el iniciara este negocio que es su principal fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de materia prima como es llantas, pedales, asientos, cadenas, destornilladores entre otras cosas. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y también brindar el alquiler de servicio de triciclo.
texts.en:
Eddy, 29, is a bicycle repairman. He’s been in this business for 7 years. He started out just repairing bicycles. The passage of time and financing has been of great help to his starting the business which is now his main source of income. He will use the requested funds to buy raw materials like: pedals, tires, seats, chains, screwdrivers, among others. He dreams with expanding his business and also to offer three-wheel cycle rental services.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Strong Hope Group

texts.en:
Cynthia K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Strong Hope. She is 42 years old, single and has three children who range from 13 to 21 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 4 years, she has been selling used clothes in Red Light Market, Paynesville on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this group loan to buy more used clothes. 

Her goal is to improve her business and build her dream house .

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Josephine is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Ena

texts.en:
Ena is a 56-year-old mother of five who lives in Puntarenas, located on the pacific coast of Costa Rica. Ena lives with her son, two granddaughters and a young woman who helps with domestic tasks. Ena has a business selling clothes. Her business is located in the center of Puntarenas; however, her business is not limited to this locale. Ena also has clients in Nicoya, Guanacaste, Playa Samara and Garza. She sells all types of clothes: for children, men, women, sports clothing, intimate clothing, casual and dress clothes. Ena knows her clients depend on her, which is why she has located her inventory and main selling point in a central location.

Ena plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of shirts both for men and children. She has a contact that has guaranteed her a good price. All she needs is an increase in working capital to take advantage of this favorable rate. At the moment, Ena has very low inventory levels, which is why this loan will help her to increase her supply.

Ena is a hardworking entrepreneur. She wakes up early at 4:30 AM to carry out the tasks of maintaining the household. At 7:00 AM she heads to Puntarenas, 10 Kilometers from her house, where she sets up her selling post in the center of the city. Ena works from 10 AM to 5 PM. After work, she heads to night classes where she is working towards the completion of primary school. 

Ena has the goal of purchasing a car by the end of the year. She hopes to earn enough money to be able to financially support the studies of her grandchildren, as well as make home improvements. A major obstacle for Ena has been going through the application process for the necessary legal permits she needs in order to sell from her location in Puntarenas. As a result of her perseverance, she has been able to secure the permits, increase her income and the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase men´s and children´s shirts.

loans.name: Anas Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana Lucia S. es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive por el sector del Paraiso, en la ciudad de Cuenca que es reconocida por ser la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador,  su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

La Señora Ana Lucia se dedica a trabajar en una fábrica de embutidos en donde labora en turnos rotativos, empezó  este trabajo hace 9 meses y también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en sus tiempos libres, lleva 2 años en esta labor.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 41 años, es divorciada hace 10 años y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 17 años de edad, su primer hijo pasa en casa y ayuda a realizar los quehaceres  del hogar y su segunda hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad de Cuenca, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Es su primer crédito y fue invitada por su sobrina  a ingresar a este hermoso banco comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para crecer más en su negocio. Su meta es llegar a tener un local propio para vender  ropa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Lucia S. is a member of the Primero de Enero (January 1st) communal bank. She lives in Cuenca’s Paraíso sector. Cuenca is known for being Ecuador’s third most important city. Its historic city center was named Cultural Patrimony of Humanity. Ana Lucia works in a canning factory; she has revolving shifts. She started working there 9 months ago but she also sells cosmetics during her free time. She’s been in this line of work for 2 years. She is 41 years old, has been divorced for 10 years, and has two children who are 18 and 17 years old. Her oldest son lives at home and helps her with housework and her daughter is going to school in Cuenca. She does not own her own home, she rents. This is her first loan. A niece invited her to join this beautiful communal bank. She will use the funds to buy cosmetics so that her business may grow. Her goal is to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eyeliner, eye shadow, lipsticks, creams, etc.
